column2: there‚Äôs a deeper astro-theological metaphor at work here. The ‚Äúpure eye that can gaze upon overabundance of joy without envy‚Äù (Nietzsche) in it‚Äôs virtual
column3: postmodern
column4: installment is not to be strictly represented by Swastika ‚Äì as Spencer apparently assumes
column5: but by other
column6: only seemingly ancient
column7: symbol taken in fact from the world of tabletop and PC gaming and turned into ideological brand by Russian philosopher Alexander Dugin (or his minions): an individual widely promoted by core members of alt right movement.

column1: The symbol in question is an eight pointed star signifying the movement
column2: not of sun
column3: but of presumably primordial origin of everything: Chaos.

column1: In the lines to follow
column2: we‚Äôll provide some preliminary analysis of the emerging situation: the channeling of chaos principle ‚Äì and adjacent chaos logic ‚Äì through loosely knit alt right movement
column3: taking as a starting point some statements from Spencer‚Äôs speech held at NPI Conference in Washington D.C. on November 21 st .

column1: Triumph of the will or hipster Babylon working
In introduction to his triumphal encomium to the ideological victory of alt right
column2: embodied in the election of Donald Trump
column3: Spencer makes one interesting remark:

column1: ‚ÄúBut even though we always took Trump seriously
column2: there was still a moment of unreality ‚Äì or perhaps too painfully intense reality ‚Äì when the state of Pennsylvania was called for Donald Trump
column3: the moment when we knew Kek had smiled upon us
column4: that meme magic was real. And though these terms are used half-jokingly
column5: they represent something truly important‚Äìthe victory of will . We willed Donald Trump into office
column6: made this dream into reality. ‚Äù

column1: It is all delivered in a manner of an in-joke
column2: not to be taken too seriously. Moreover
column3: to the uninitiated into mysteries of this Internet movement it is probably unclear who is ‚ÄúKek‚Äù and what exactly is ‚Äúmeme magic‚Äù.

column1: We‚Äôll start our explanation with lesser weirdness.
‚ÄúMeme‚Äù is an expression denoting ‚Äúinexistent existent‚Äù
column2: coined apparently by Richard Dawkins to explain how human thoughts fit in his evolutionary theology: memes are thoughts expressed in image and/or phrase which
column3: by circulation in public
column4: acquire the life and subsistence of their own and are able to ‚Äúinfect‚Äù the consciousness with their messages
column5: like viruses. Meme is inexistent because there‚Äôs no such thing as thoughts having a biologically based self-subsistence and ability to procreate like viruses. Images and/or phrases are not living beings save by bad analogy that omits to tell us on what exactly it is based: what is that one principle making memes and viruses congenial. Yet they
column6: quite paradoxically
column7: exist because analogy apparently works . However no one seems to pose the question
column8: why it works.

column1: Well
column2: it works because it is magical.

column1: Chaos Magick
Here we have an example of magical thinking in the postmodern ‚Äì in fact posthumanist ‚Äì vein
column2: resting on assumption that what has not evolved in nature can ‚Äì and should ‚Äì be created in analogy to imagined process of evolution. If artificial construct is in line with ‚Äúprinciple of evolution‚Äù it is real or
column3: to be more precise
column4: it is in accordance with imaginary nature of this principle; it is imagined into existence .

column1: Therefore ‚Äúmeme magick‚Äù works only insofar it relies upon artificial
column2: preferably technological medium for sustenance and on assumption that its recipients identify themselves with their artificial
column3: preferably online identities that can indeed be imbibed with ‚Äúmemes‚Äù as they are in themselves artificial and arbitrary constructs.

column1: The goal of practitioner of such magic ‚Äì a far cry from what was traditionally considered to be magic ‚Äì is to change the world according to his will. This is
column2: more or less
column3: what is known from the Seventies of the last century as chaos magick
column4: a postmodern imitation of ancient practice of acting in sub-human and sub-natural ‚Äúdomain‚Äù of the world
column5: in the past mostly confined to people born with dubious talent to practice it. The peculiarity of chaos magick is
column6: on the one hand
column7: that it is entirely syncretic
column8: i.e. that it uses everything that it‚Äôs practitioner can imbibe with intended
column9: subjective
column10: meaning
column11: and that it relies on virtual
column12: i.e. artificial world of mass culture
column13: now embodied above all in Internet.

column1: The idea behind it all is that nothing is true and everything is possible .
There are many interesting implications to this.
The first is that everything is interrelated
column2: i.e. that everything is connected with everything else. So any which way you take
column3: you‚Äôll get where you want to get if you will it hard enough. The second is that there‚Äôs no hierarchy of higher and lower ‚Äì there‚Äôs only an infinite surface dissolving into ever more complex elements
column4: dissolving in turn into nothingness
column5: if concentrated upon. As there‚Äôs nothing higher
column6: there‚Äôs nothing to be revered and everything can ‚Äì and indeed: should ‚Äì be an object of ironical laughter. And
column7: most importantly
column8: this is the world of dreams
column9: ruled by what is usually called ‚Äúdream logic‚Äù but in actual fact: chaos logic or un-logic .

column1: In this sense
column2: Richard Spencer quite accurately proclaimed Trump‚Äôs victory an accomplishment of meme- or chaos magick.

column1: Trump is willed into office by Internet memes binding the will of alt right adherents and turning their dream into reality ‚Äì virtual reality
column2: one may add
column3: yet reality nonetheless. The fact that Trump was elected for a plethora of motives ‚Äì from the appeal of his politics
column4: to public takedown of Hillary Clinton by Wikileaks ‚Äì is immaterial
column5: because in the world of chaos every subjective ‚Äúreality tunnel‚Äù
column6: or interpretation of the world
column7: is as real as any other.

column1: In this sense we can observe new ‚ÄúGod Emperor of USA‚Äù as a magical creation of Internet
column2: by the Internet and for the Internet ‚Äì today still the Internet of interconnected computer nodes
column3: but soon probably the Internet of things. If one is to push Spencer‚Äôs remark to it‚Äôs logical extreme
column4: we can assert that illustrious Donald is the world‚Äôs first president of posthuman race; an embodiment of ultra progressive dream invoked to reality by professed ultra anti-progressive group.

column1: So that was lesser weirdness. Let us proceed now to high weirdness.
We owe the reader an answer to a question: who the hell is Kek?
Well
column2: the reason why Spencer mentions him is again a magickal ‚Äúhalf-joke‚Äù: Kek is interpreted to be an ancient Egyptian deity by a number of Internet observers and identified with alt right memetic avatar ‚Äì Pepe the frog. While I habitually suspend judgment on all things Egyptian
column3: because ancient Egyptian culture is a slippery ground even for experts
column4: I consider this interpretation
column5: upon closer inspection
column6: to be quite valid in the virtual light of chaos logic.

column1: Namely
column2: Pepe
column3: the cartoon character
column4: conceived in 2005. by cartoonist Matt Furie
column5: emerged as a meme from the depths of Internet forums
column6: more precisely: 4chan sub-forum /pol/
column7: devoted to political discussions with no holds barred
column8: which was
column9: in view of some observers
column10: a breeding ground for many alt right aficionados; a place of absolute freedom
column11: therefore: absolute chaos.

column1: The expression ‚Äúkek‚Äù was also appropriated from the forums and stems from the in-joke among the players of World of Warcraft
column2: replacing the standard Internet abbreviation ‚ÄúLOL‚Äù (‚Äúlaughing out loud‚Äù). Someone eventually noticed that Kek is in fact the name of frog-headed Egyptian deity
column3: signifying Chaos and darkness
column4: and Pepe was rebranded as Kek the deity ‚Äì ironic one
column5: no doubt
column6: half joking one
column7: as surprisingly many alt righters like to put it
column8: but deity nonetheless.

column1: It is important to point out that in view of the most ‚Äúesoteric Kekists‚Äù
column2: that is: (half grinning) faithful of Kek/Pepe
column3: the association was originally entirely haphazard and accidental
column4: yet it developed into an ever growing system of synchronicities ‚Äì causally unrelated meaningful relations among events. So it came to pass that Kek sounds very similar to ‚Äòcuck‚Äô(originally: cuckservative)
column5: a term denoting old fashioned conservative who was still not ‚Äúred pilled‚Äù (another meme taken from pop culture
column6: shared by both alt right and conspiracy theorists) by alt right or
column7: should we assume: Kek himself; furthermore
column8: Hillary Clinton addressed Pepe as nothing less than public enemy
column9: identifying presumably the whole alt right movement with cartoon character. Then it happened that after this act Hillary fainted in front of the cameras
column10: and that was immediately interpreted as an action of Kek.

column1: A good run-down of Kek/Pepe/Trump identification
However
column2: it all began with people noticing the numerical synchronicities in the random series of numbers in posts on /pol/ sub-forum:

column1: ‚ÄûOne last thing you need to understand about imageboard culture: dubs.
Every post on 4chan and similar venues comes with an 8-digit numerical stamp. This number represents that post‚Äôs entry position in the entire posting lineage of the imageboard.
With the amount of traffic these sites get
column2: the last couple digits of this number are essentially a random roll. When a poster gets repeated digits
column3: its called ‚Äúdubs‚Äù
column4: ‚Äútrips‚Äù
column5: ‚Äúquads‚Äù
column6: and so on.

column1: Since a poster can‚Äôt know their post number until after they‚Äôve submitted the post
column2: its common for people to ‚Äúbet‚Äù the contents of their message on the occurrence of repeating digits (‚Ä¶) When that endeavor proves a successful
column3: a ‚ÄúGET‚Äù has been made and the stroke of luck is celebrated.

column1: Out of this practice
column2: a strange phenomenon began to take place on /pol/: discussion threads associated with Trump displayed noticeably frequent GETs. It wasn‚Äôt long before all of these seemingly random elements discussed so far became irreparably tied together within imageboard culture: Pepe the Frog (now /pol/‚Äôs unofficial mascot) Donald Trump (/pol/‚Äôs overwhelming candidate of choice) Repeating digit post numbers (‚ÄúGETS‚Äù) ‚ÄúKEK‚Äù (used as an expression of delight
column3: particular in response to Trump‚Äôs ‚Äútrolling‚Äù of the establishment
column4: as well as in reaction to unlikely GETs in general)

column1: ‚Ä¶and a god was born.‚Äú ( source )
Synchronicities related to emergence of Kek the God and his merging with Trump in the bowels of Internet forums early on in the presidential campaign
column2: are so numerous and
column3: frankly
column4: mind boggling that we cannot list them here
column5: for the sake of brevity. For our purpose it is sufficient to point out that for many alt right aficionados
column6: including core leadership
column7: Kek is the God and Trump is his prophet
column8: all declared with smug grin and ironical stance
column9: yet with all the necessary power of conviction.

column1: Namely
column2: chaos magick relies on laughter
column3: or irreverence of its own principles because it is essentially un-principled. Fairly in accordance with its postmodern nature it seeks to deconstruct any kind of order to enable its ‚Äúpractitioner‚Äù to impose his own will and change the world ‚Äì as Spencer would put it: make his dreams a reality.

column1: I would go further and add: make all reality a dream ; because
column2: chaos magick and alt right are nothing more but novel forms in the development of virtual
column3: i.e. posthuman
column4: world. The idea of adherence and reattachment to tradition that the alt right movement professes is nothing more but simulacrum appealing to people tired of liberal nihilism ‚Äì in its essence
column5: however
column6: it is a complete opposite: a disintegration of all substantial traditional principles ‚Äì above all an idea of preexistent hierarchy of Being ‚Äì into nothingness of primordial Chaos.

column1: Posthuman traditionalism
I already developed this insight regarding the subversive work of Alexander Dugin
column2: who is probably the most consequent subverter of Tradition with recognizable public persona acting in our age
column3: but now we can see how his affiliates in USA and Europe are doing the same thing ‚Äì with less philosophical subtlety
column4: but fueled by much greater raw power. Namely
column5: alt right
column6: if we are to judge by what it‚Äôs leadership advocates
column7: is ideologically nothing more but project of building the simulated tradition ‚Äì something Richard Spencer likes to call ‚Äúpolitical theology‚Äù ‚Äì founded on New Age filtered Aryan myths
column8: racial interpretation of Nietzsche and generally crossbred with ‚Äúdo your own thing‚Äù mentality
column9: all done in the virtual ether of information technology. After all
column10: if we are to agree with Spencer ‚Äì half jokingly of course ‚Äì that God Emperor was inaugurated by the act of Kek the God
column11: then the victory of alt right ‚Äútraditionalists‚Äù is in fact the victory of technological magic; the act of pseudo magus waving the same wand Ray Kurzweill and his ilk offer to progressive lunatics .

column1: In the end
column2: therefore
column3: we are talking about another victory of posthumanism
column4: branded
column5: spontaneously or otherwise
column6: as traditionalism. The obsession of alt right adherents with ‚Äúidentity‚Äù in general and ‚Äúwhite identity‚Äù in particular points to a fact that they are unable to realize the simple truth of Tradition they supposedly defend: they understand identity as something that can be created and not something that must be accepted . Observing the plethora of various
column7: rather eccentric individuals in it‚Äôs vanguard
column8: from macho gay postmodern Spartans to adherents to all kinds of exotic ‚Äì and to a large extent made up ‚Äì pagan religions one is at the lack to find a common denominator
column9: save maybe for quite unchallenged neo-darwinist stance
column10: especially to be found among ‚Äúgame‚Äù bloggers as Chateau Heartiste . If someone thinks that he can reattach himself to pre-modern spiritual history of humankind ‚Äì actually the only one there is ‚Äì while at the same time musing about ‚Äúalpha and beta males‚Äù
column11: ‚Äúsexual market‚Äù
column12: ‚Äúsignaling and counter-signaling‚Äù
column13: professing therefore his proud monkey ancestry and reducing human relations to mental GMO of memes
column14: genes and biological analogies
column15: he is doing nothing else than unconsciously subverting the very thing he seemingly defends.

column1: The allure of alt right lies in it‚Äôs dialectical opposition to political correctness and rampart destruction of moral substance of the West
column2: induced by process of globalization. Yet this is an eristic or
column3: to use an excellent neologism invented by one correspondent of mine: discordian dialectic; the process of infinite division into ever multiplying opposites founded on the principle of Chaos. It is all done with the crooked half grin
column4: a pinch of salt to every smug remark ‚Äì with irony of the man who knows he‚Äôs a liar and a cheat. But smug humor goes just a short way. In the end it morphs into sarcasm and irreverence of what should in fact be revered and subverts the very principles it professes to defend
column5: far more effectively than dead serious PC brigade or techno loonies of posthumanist movement could ever hope for.

column1: We‚Äôll end with the word of warning to Christian adherents of alt right. The words have a definite meanings and power. There‚Äôs only one Chaos and there‚Äôs only one bringer of light from Chaos ‚Äì as some Kek worshipers already defined the poor Frog‚Äôs main job . And it‚Äôs not the One to be defined as ‚ÄúGod from God
column2: Light from Light‚Äù
column3: but ‚ÄúGod from Gutter
column4: Light from Darkness‚Äù. A real Darkness shining in virtual brightness. Hope you guess His name.

column1: So
column2: without a pinch of irony
column3: I declare: be careful who your ‚Äúhail‚Äù.

column1: 57;8a35883f9c9f0b15a9e20ab8711d403d91d57405;0;Jimmy Rustling;2016-10-27T13:00:00.000+03:00;"The Amish In America Commit Their Vote To Donald Trump; Mathematically Guaranteeing Him A Presidential Victory - ABC News";"18 SHARE The Amish in America have committed their vote to Donald Trump guaranteeing him the Presidency. (AP Photo / Dennis System)
COLUMBUS
column2: OH (AP) ‚Äî History was made today in Columbus
column3: Ohio when more than 3 million Amish poured into the city to see the American Amish Brotherhood (AAB)
column4: an organization which acts as an informal governing body for the Amish community
column5: endorse Donald Trump for president. That number represents a significant portion of the total Amish population
column6: which the United States Census Bureau says numbers more than 20 million men and women nationwide all pledging their vote to Trump for President. With the full force of the Amish community behind him
column7: Donald Trump is now mathematically guaranteed to win the presidency in November.

column1: The organization typically meets once a year and the meetings usually consist of about 300 Amish leaders who meet to discuss the challenges
column2: such as urban sprawl
column3: that face the community. This year
column4: however
column5: the organization wanted as many people in attendance as possible so they can effectively instruct all Amish men and women of legal voting age to cast their vote for the flamboyant Republican nominee.

column1: The Amish
column2: who are direct descendants of the protestant reformation sect known as the Anabaptists
column3: have typically stayed out of politics in the past. As a general rule
column4: they don‚Äôt vote
column5: serve in the military
column6: or engage in any other displays of patriotism. This year
column7: however
column8: the AAB has said that it is imperative that they get involved in the democratic process.

column1: ‚ÄúOver the past eight years
column2: the Democratic Party has launched a systematic assault on biblical virtues
column3: ‚Äù said AAB chairman Menno Simons. ‚ÄúWe have seen more and more Christians being persecuted for their faith; we have seen the state defile the institution of marriage. Now
column4: they want to put a woman in the nation‚Äôs highest leadership role in direct violation of 1 Timothy 2:12. We need to stop this assault and take a stand for biblical principles. Donald Trump has shown in both action and deed that he is committed to restoring this country to the Lord‚Äôs way.‚Äù

column1: According to statistician Nate Silver of the website fivethirtyeight.com
column2: there are no possible scenarios in which Hillary Clinton can win with Donald Trump carrying the Amish vote.

column1: ‚ÄúThe Amish have their highest numbers in perennial swing states like Pennsylvania
column2: Virginia
column3: Ohio
column4: Indiana
column5: and Iowa
column6: ‚Äù Silver noted. ‚ÄúThey also have strong numbers in reliably Democratic states like Michigan
column7: Illinois
column8: and New York
column9: meaning that Hillary will lose those states as well. There is also a sizeable community in Florida which
column10: while not as large as it is in the Midwest
column11: is still large enough to turn Florida for Trump. Over the next two weeks
column12: you can expect Hillary to enter into a state of freefall in all of my predictive models.‚Äù

column1: The Clinton campaign issued a written statement to the AAB asking them to reconsider their decision.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe that Donald Trump is the person who best represents your interests
column2: ‚Äù Clinton wrote to the AAB. ‚ÄúAs a career real estate developer
column3: he represents a clear threat to your simple way of life. As former first lady of Arkansas
column4: I understand the concerns of rural Americans more than any candidate in this election. I implore you to consider all of the facts before voting for my opponent.‚Äù

column1: Most pundits believe that Mrs. Clinton‚Äôs plea is too little too late.
During a press conference in Manhattan
column2: Trump thanked the AAB for their support and promised to put the Amish to work maintaining government buildings
column3: which he said would save taxpayers millions because ‚Äúthe Amish do great work for a very low price.‚Äù

column1: Though Clinton has pledged to stay in the race until the very end
column2: many of her campaign workers have already resigned. According to the Associated Press

column5: with those results being used to help determine who will represent the individual states in the electoral college.

column1: Paul Horner

column12: and Virginia. No specific locations within those three states were mentioned.

column1: US authorities are said to be taking the threat seriously
column2: though CBS News ‚Äô sources stress that the threat is still being assessed and its credibility has yet to be confirmed. According to CBS
column3: counter-terrorism officials were alerted to the threat out of an ‚Äúabundance of caution.‚Äù

column1: Earlier this week
column2: there were also warnings that ‚Äúpolling places‚Äù could be seen as ‚Äúattractive targets‚Äù for ‚Äúlone wolf‚Äù attackers by individuals motivated by ‚Äúviolent extremist ideologies
column3: sovereign citizen or other extremist activity.‚Äù This has led federal law enforcement to plan for several worst-case scenarios. One FBI official told CBS :

column1: The counter-terrorism and homeland security communities remain vigilant and well-postured to defend against attacks here in the United States. The FBI
column2: working with our federal
column3: state and local counterparts
column4: shares and assesses intelligence on a daily basis and will continue to work closely with law enforcement and intelligence community partners to identify and disrupt any potential threat to public safety.

column1: However
column2: what‚Äôs interesting here is that the terror threat is coming from al Qaeda as opposed to the Islamic State. In the Syrian ‚Äúcivil‚Äù war
column3: the US has been actively helping al Qaeda there
column4: grouping their Syrian branch ‚Äì the al Nusra Front ‚Äì in with the ‚Äúmoderate rebels‚Äù they support. Therefore
column5: al Qaeda‚Äôs ability to launch attacks within the US has been directly aided by US intelligence
column6: making this announcement incredibly suspect.

column1: It‚Äôs also worth pointing out that al Qaeda
column2: since its inception
column3: has been a product of the US intelligence community. In the 1980s they were essentially created by the US to fight the Soviets in Afghanistan. Ever since
column4: they have conveniently been used as the justification for an expansion of US wars abroad and the elimination of civil liberties domestically.

column1: It is also interesting that the threat is al Qaeda and NOT the Islamic State. The Islamic State has been the terrorist ‚Äúbogeyman‚Äù of recent years and their involvement in any threat
column2: real or imagined
column3: is useful justification for escalating US involvement in Syria. It seems highly likely that the Islamic State was left out due to recent revelations from WikiLeaks showing that their funding comes from the very same entities that donate millions to the Clinton Foundation.

column1: It is also worth noting that if a terrorist attack does come to pass
column2: it will be a big help for Hillary. Hillary has been under siege in recent weeks due to WikiLeaks‚Äô near constant releases of her campaign chair‚Äôs emails
column3: but also due to the FBI‚Äôs ‚Äúmutiny‚Äù which led them to re-open a probe into Clinton‚Äôs use of a private email server. Any terror attack would give Clinton the opportunity to gain political ground by promoting her aggressive foreign policy aims in Syria and the rest of the Middle East.

column1: However
column2: as mentioned at the beginning of this article
column3: it is also possible that a terrorist attack on US soil would give President Obama the authority to either postpone or outright cancel the election
column4: something he could not normally do except in the event of extraordinary circumstances. Unfortunately
column5: only time will tell which theory is correct
column6: compelling us to stay vigilant in the meantime.

332;2ca77a341a3e26e3f842f2804aef1ecf62ba90f6;0;;2016-11-05T18:01:00.000+02:00;California Secessionists to Meet at Capitol Day After Presidential Election;"
By Joseph Jankowski
An organization which has the aim to separate the state of California from the Union of the United States is set to hold a meeting at the state capitol in Sacramento on Wednesday
column2: November 9
column4: the day after the presidential election.

column1: The Yes California Independence Campaign
column2: which is based in San Diego
column3: describes itself as a ‚Äúnonviolent campaign to establish the country of California using any and all legal and constitutional means to do so.‚Äù

column1: The group is currently trying to qualify a citizen‚Äôs initiative in 2018 to get a referendum for secession on the ballot in 2019
column2: reports SF Gate . They will be in Sacramento in hopes to gather support for the state‚Äôs exit
column3: or the ‚ÄúCalexit
column4: ‚Äù as they call it.

column1: ‚ÄúIn our view
column2: the United States of America represents so many things that conflict with Californian values
column3: and our continued statehood means California will continue subsidizing the other states to our own detriment
column4: and to the detriment of our children
column5: ‚Äù reads Yes California ‚Äôs official website.

column1: The group‚Äôs page reads on:
Although charity is part of our culture
column2: when you consider that California‚Äôs infrastructure is falling apart
column3: our public schools are ranked among the worst in the entire country
column4: we have the highest number of homeless persons living without shelter and other basic necessities
column5: poverty rates remain high
column6: income inequality continues to expand
column7: and we must often borrow money from the future to provide services for today
column8: now is not the time for charity. However
column9: this independence referendum is about more than California subsidizing other states of this country. It is about the right to self-determination and the concept of voluntary association
column10: both of which are supported by constitutional and international law.

column1: It is about California taking its place in the world
column2: standing as an equal among nations. We believe in two fundamental truths: (1) California exerts a positive influence on the rest of the world
column3: and (2) California could do more good as an independent country than it is able to do as a just a U.S. state.

column1: Yes California ‚Äôs website lays out 9 different points covering topics the group believes will benefit from a California exit from the US
column2: including education
column3: peace and security
column4: debt and taxes and immigration.

column1: One blog post on their page draws parallels with a ‚ÄúCalexit‚Äù and the recent referendum known as ‚ÄúBrexit‚Äù that passed in the UK in June which showed that most British people are ready for their country to leave the EU.
The push for secession is nothing new to California. In 1941 the mayor of Port Orford
column2: Oregon
column3: Gilbert Gable
column4: proposed the idea to push the Oregon counties of Curry
column5: Josephine
column6: Jackson
column7: and Klamath to join with the California counties of Del Norte
column8: Siskiyou
column9: and Modoc to form a new state
column10: later named Jefferson.

column1: Modoc County of Northern California voted in 2013 to join neighboring Siskiyou County in a push to secede from the State of California .

column2: two counties in northern California petitioned for the right to form a 51st State of America
column3: which they also wanted to name Jefferson.

column1: 360;266257d3076cd0a1b76446eef8577d1899485d93;0;;2016-10-31T01:25:00.000+02:00;Kellyanne Conway LOSES IT On Jake Tapper When He Calls Out Trump‚Äôs Bigoted Fans (VIDEO);"on October 30
One thing that has continuously dogged the Donald Trump for president campaign is the fact that racists
column2: anti-semites
column3: xenophobes
column4: misogynists
column5: and various other bigots have stuck with the bombastic real estate mogul since he first launched his travesty of a campaign. No matter how much Trump‚Äôs people try to say he doesn‚Äôt want the support of such folks
column6: the candidate himself refuses to take the fact that there is anything about the campaign he has been running that attracts these people seriously. So
column7: naturally
column8: when Trump‚Äôs campaign manager Kellyanne Conway sat down with an interview with CNN‚Äôs Jake Tapper on Sunday
column9: that particular issue came up again. Of course
column10: Conway was not happy. Tapper began:

column1: ‚ÄúThere are a lot of anti-Semites and racists and misogynists who support the Trump candidacy.‚Äù
Conway immediately went on defense
column2: saying
column3: ‚Äúwow.‚Äù Tapper went on to reference a man who was shouting ‚ÄòJEW-S-A‚Äô at the press pen at a recent Trump rally
column4: and directly asked Conway if she would refer to such people as ‚Äòdeplorable.‚Äô She responded:

column1: ‚ÄúYes
column2: I would. Wow
column3: I have to push back on some of the adjectives you just used to describe ‚Äî I hope you‚Äôve been to Trump rallies and I hope that you‚Äôve seen the tens of thousands. I mean
column4: he‚Äôs had over half a million people easily
column5: I think in excess of that. These are U.S.A.-loving Americans.‚Äù

column1: Tapper went on to say that no
column2: he isn‚Äôt putting all Trump supporters into that camp
column3: but went on to force Conway‚Äôs hand on this one:

column1: ‚ÄúBut without question
column2: people who are experts on hate groups say that there has been a comfort level that has been offered to people who are anti-Semitic that has been offered to people who are anti-Semitic and racists and on and on. And these people are comfortable coming out in the open and supporting Mr. Trump.

column1: Mr. Trump has refused to condemn in a very serious way his racist and anti-Semitic fans
column2: ‚Äù Tapper continued. ‚ÄúHe just has. He says things like
column3: ‚ÄúOh
column4: sure
column5: I disavow
column6: I disavow.‚Äô But he has never serious said
column7: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt want the support of those people
column8: they are reprehensible
column9: they have nothing to do with me.‚Äô He has never seriously done it.‚Äù

column1: Conway used the pushing to pivot back to the idea that the Trump campaign is winning
column2: saying:

column1: ‚ÄúI think this exchange is frankly the best piece of evidence I have that we‚Äôre actually going to win in nine days because the idea that we‚Äôre going to shift away from the pattern of corruption the cloud of ethical stain that Hillary Clinton would bring to the Oval Office in such an important week.‚Äù
No
column2: Kellyanne
column3: it‚Äôs not a sign that Trump is winning. It‚Äôs pointing something out that has been true since this whole fiasco began: That Donald Trump is a raging bigot
column4: and he has been so openly. Dog whistles have turned into fog horns this election cycle
column5: and it‚Äôs all because of Donald Trump. He embraces these bigots because he‚Äôs one of them. The quicker you learn that
column6: the better.

column1: 362;5ac146c54a890412d8f4c1e49253c026d4c359b7;0;;2016-11-03T11:22:00.000+02:00;Trump Supporters Booby Trap Polling Place And Spill Blood Of Election Volunteer (VIDEO) | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on November 3
Donald Trump‚Äôs deplorable supporters aren‚Äôt waiting for the election results to start spilling blood.

They‚Äôve been threatening bloody violence ever since Trump began claiming that the election is ‚Äúrigged‚Äù in favor of Hillary Clinton. And Trump has called for them to intimidate voters at polling places.
In Texas last week
column2: a Trump supporter was arrested for electioneering at a polling place because he was wearing one of Trump‚Äôs stupid hats and a ‚ÄúDeplorables‚Äù T-shirt to vote.

column1: Election code prohibits any person from electioneering within 100 feet of a polling place.
Of course
column2: Trump supporters threw a temper tantrum because they think the rules don‚Äôt apply to them.

column1: Well
column2: now it looks like they have retaliated by setting up a booby trapped Trump sign at a polling place knowing that an official or volunteer would have to take the sign down.

column1: At Collin College in Plano
column2: Texas a Trump sign was discovered zip-tied to an official polling location sign in direct violation of the election code that forbids electioneering at polling places.

column1: But when a volunteer went out to remove the sign they got a nasty surprise in the form of box cutter blades that were strategically hidden inside. The blades sliced into the volunteer‚Äôs hands and drew blood
column2: requiring medical attention and prompting officials to order that signs be checked thoroughly before removal.

column1: ‚ÄúIt just shows how far we have come in politics where people want to be so mean and so hateful to try and injure somebody who‚Äôs probably not got any political party persuasion one way or the other
column2: ‚Äù local Democratic Party campaign chair Steve Spainhouer said in response . ‚ÄúI think most people have already made their minds up at this point how they‚Äôre going to vote and so there‚Äôs nothing to gain by being mean spirited or hateful.‚Äù

column1: Here‚Äôs the video via KTVT .
Frankly
column2: this should be considered an act of domestic terrorism. Trump‚Äôs supporters have gone too far and it could get worse as Election Day approaches. And if Trump loses
column3: his supporters have already threatened to try to overthrow the federal government in a bloody coup.

column1: Clearly
column2: these people are deranged and the safety of voters and election officials are in danger. But you won‚Äôt hear Donald Trump condemning this act of violence. After all

363;512b10f6c4f4a9fb564eb08862192bbe1959550c;0;;2016-10-26T10:41:00.000+03:00;‚ÄòI Don‚Äôt Rent To N s‚Äô: Smoking Gun Proves Trump Family Racism (VIDEO) | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on October 25
New video has surfaced adding to the mountain of evidence that while working alongside his father
column2: Fred Trump
column3: young Donald Trump was part of a real estate business that discriminated against minority applicants.

column1: As part of an investigation by NBC News
column2: Stanley Leibowitz
column3: who worked as a rental agent for the Trump Organization
column4: told the news network that he personally witnessed the elder Trump explicitly lay out a racist policy for their apartment properties.

column1: In the interview
column2: Leibowitz said that Trump told him ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt rent to the n-word
column3: ‚Äù and indicates that Trump made this statement with Donald Trump in the room and that the younger Trump affirmed the policy.

column1: The revelation comes at the same time that the Clinton campaign has released a video highlighting Trump‚Äôs run-in with the federal government over discrimination.
Undercover investigators were sent to Trump properties
column2: and there they repeatedly ran into a policy where black applicants with identical financial backgrounds to white applicants were systematically denied housing. The white applicants were allowed into the Trump properties.

column1: One bit of testimony determined that Trump property managers indicated applications from blacks by putting a ‚ÄúC‚Äù on the documents for ‚Äúcolored
column2: ‚Äù and that was a sign that they should be denied.

column1: The Trumps denied the allegation
column2: but later settled with the government over the policy without admitting wrongdoing.

column1: Donald Trump‚Äôs involvement with his father‚Äôs business is key to the entire story of his rise to prominence in the real estate world and the media
column2: as is his father‚Äôs $14 million dollars that he gave to Trump to start his business. But if you accept that
column3: the Trump Organization‚Äôs history of racial discrimination and the legal entanglements that come with that are also part of the story
column4: and no matter how Trump may try to wave it away ‚Äì it‚Äôs still there.

column1: 365;787d6b67fbb3365bfcab0eb53be5f311381c8ca6;0;;2016-11-05T05:26:15.936+02:00;BREAKING: Melania Trump‚Äôs Immigration Records Made Public
column2: Show Trump‚Äôs ULTIMATE Hypocrisy | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on November 4

column1: GOP presidential nominee Donald Trump has taken a ridiculously hardline ‚Äì and even bigoted ‚Äì stance on immigration. He has promised to build a wall and force Mexico to pay for it
column2: and he has said that he will erect ‚Äúdeportation forces‚Äù to root out and get rid of all people in the United States without proper documentation. Well
column3: as we already knew
column4: it turns out that The Donald is the ultimate hypocrite on this one.

column1: According to the Associated Press
column2: it turns out that Donald Trump‚Äôs wife Melania violated immigration laws by working illegally in the United States when she first arrived from her native Slovenia. Melania often modeled using just her first name
column3: and was first granted entry into the country on a visitor‚Äôs visa
column4: known as a B1/B2 visa. This occurred on August 27
column5: 1996. Melania did not get a legal work visa until October 18
column6: 1996. During the time when she was prohibited from working in the country
column7: Melania made money on ten different modeling assignments
column8: totaling upwards of $20
column9: 000. She got a green card in 2000
column10: and became a naturalized citizen in 2006.

column1: So
column2: in other words
column3: Melania Trump lied about her immigration story
column4: as recently as Thursday
column5: when she once again touted how a million percent legal immigration is the only way to go
column6: and that this is how she did it. Melania said
column7: in part
column8: in her stump speech:

column1: ‚ÄúAs a young entrepreneur
column2: I wanted to follow my dream to a place where freedom and opportunity were in abundance. So of course
column3: I came here. Living and working in America was a true blessing
column4: but I wanted something more. I wanted to be an American.‚Äù

column1: Well
column2: it appears that
column3: as has long been suspected
column4: that Melania Trump wasn‚Äôt as kosher in her immigration and work practices as she claims. The information obtained by the AP include
column5: but are not limited to
column6: her contract from Metropolitan International Management ‚Äì a modeling agency. Also
column7: there‚Äôs the ledgers from the agency
column8: which is no longer in business
column9: that shows Melania working during the time when she had the visitor‚Äôs visa
column10: but no work visa. It seems to be a complicated story full of many attempts to cover up Melania‚Äôs wrongdoing
column11: but it is certainly quite interesting. This would be why Melania Trump never released actual records regarding her initial immigration to the United States and her eventual path to citizenship. While it is unlikely that her citizenship is at risk
column12: it certainly means that she committed immigration fraud. You can read more here at the Associated Press .

column1: The long and short of it is this: Donald Trump launched his crazy bid for the presidency preying on the fears of the ‚Äúother.‚Äù Namely
column2: immigrants. That is the height of hypocrisy
column3: seeing as how his own wife didn‚Äôt completely comply with immigration law. Hopefully this story
column4: and the many other lies and cover-ups and shady dealings surrounding the Trump campaign break through the hypnotism that the demagogue has spun onto so many desperate citizens of this great country
column5: and they figure out that they are falling for the biggest con of all time.

column1: 366;6e728a65950c4f686a534dffea96efdc52ce4d72;0;;2016-11-05T03:45:00.000+02:00;Unhinged Trump Supporter Holds Children AT GUNPOINT Over Damaged Trump Sign (VIDEO);"on November 4
If you had wanted to give Trump supporters the benefit of the doubt
column2: this most recent incident proves that it‚Äôs far too much to give them.

column1: A 56-year-old man in Allen Park
column2: Michigan has just been charged with six felonies after he held six children at gunpoint because he thought they‚Äôd damaged the Donald Trump sign on his lawn. Yes
column3: this is the kind of deranged
column4: emotionally unstable supporters Trump has attracted.

column1: The man
column2: Michael Robert Kubek
column3: had called police on October 29th to report that his Trump sign had been hit by teenagers
column4: who had fled the scene. When the police arrived at the scene
column5: they didn‚Äôt find Kubek at his home ‚Äì however
column6: when the officers followed the screams coming from around the corner
column7: there he was.

column1: The police saw Kubek standing over six children ages 12-14
column2: who were sitting on the grass. Kubek accused the children of destroying his sign despite the fact that he never actually witnessed them doing it. The children denied any involvement
column3: and the officers told Kubek to return to his house so they could speak to the children.

column1: According to the kids
column2: they were simply on their way to the park for a birthday celebration when Kubek had pulled out a gun and pointed it at them
column3: instructing them to sit down on the grass. Those witnessing the act took to social media to vent their shock: Twitter Twitter

column1: The News-Herald reported:
‚ÄúThe officer asked him again if he could identify any of the kids as the one who damaged his sign
column2: but Kubek repeated that he could not. The officer then asked Kubek if he pulled out a pistol and pointed it at the kids. According to police
column3: Kubek said ‚Äúyes.‚Äù

column1: In response to another question from the officer
column2: Kubek said he felt threatened because he was outnumbered.‚Äù

column1: Yes
column2: a grown man used a gun because he felt ‚Äúoutnumbered‚Äù by a small group of innocent kids. This is EXACTLY the type of unhinged person who shouldn‚Äôt be trusted with firearms! Kubek‚Äôs hearing is scheduled for December 5th ‚Äì let‚Äôs hope that whatever happens to Kubek
column3: that he is no longer considered a responsible gun owner. You can watch a report below:

Another is

column1: His false claims cast doubt on the legitimacy of mainstream polling ‚Äî and perhaps even the vote itself. If supporters feel Trump should be doing better

column1: On Oct. 24
column2: he said ‚ÄòI won the last two debates

column1: Of course

Falsely claimed Clinton didn‚Äôt release cholesterol or EKG information Falsely said sexual assault allegations against him ‚Äúhave been largely debunked.‚Äù Falsely said

369;1b9104850bec39ed6a90d185913108c87f267767;0;;2016-11-06T20:03:00.000+02:00;SNL Gets Real And Delivers The Most Important Message Of The Election Year (VIDEO);"on November 6
Saturday Night Live has helped bring quite a bit of levity to this otherwise horrific election year but in the final episode before the election
column2: before we as a nation go to the polls and decide if we want to be extraordinary or ‚Äúdeplorable
column3: ‚Äù the cast of Saturday Night Live could not help but drop the act and get real with America.

column1: It began as it normally does
column2: with Alec Baldwin‚Äôs masterful Donald Trump character and Kate McKinnon‚Äôs excellent portrayal of Hillary Clinton (if she spent all day every day mainlining a dangerous mixture of sugar and caffeine).

column1: ‚ÄúI never use emails
column2: ‚Äù Trump says in the cold opener. ‚ÄúI use a very private
column3: very secure site where one can write whatever they want to and no one can read it It‚Äôs called Twitter.‚Äù

column1: After he is informed that everyone can see his tweets
column2: ‚ÄúTrump‚Äù replies:

column1: ‚ÄúReally? And I‚Äôm still in this thing? America you must really hate this lady.‚Äù
After a scathing rebuke of the media‚Äôs decision to ignore Trump‚Äôs cozy relationship with Putin
column2: the KKK
column3: and the FBI and instead focus on something as meaningless as Hillary Clinton‚Äôs emails
column4: something magical happened: McKinnon and Baldwin dropped the facade and got serious.

column1: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry
column2: Kate. I just hate yelling all this stuff at you like this
column3: ‚Äù Baldwin says. ‚ÄúI just feel gross all the time about this. Don‚Äôt you all feel gross?‚Äù he added
column4: addressing the audience.

column1: McKinnon agrees and the two embark on a ‚Äúfriendship montage‚Äù through the city before returning to the stage. Then they dropped perhaps the most important message you will hear this election year. ‚ÄúNone of this would have mattered if you don‚Äôt vote
column2: ‚Äù Baldwin says.

column1: ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt tell you who to vote for
column2: but on Tuesday we all get a chance to choose what kind of country we want to live in
column3: ‚Äù McKinnon finishes.

370;3582348c3ebcd3c5dee39c3b1afb23dcec3d954e;0;;2016-11-12T05:06:00.000+02:00;Lindsey Graham Wants Trump To Put Ted Cruz On The Supreme Court Bench;"on November 11
As if the election of Donald Trump couldn‚Äôt get even more disastrous and hypocritical
column2: Senator Lindsey Graham just called on Trump to nominate a right-wing extremist to nation‚Äôs highest court.

column1: All year long
column2: Republicans have been blocking President Obama‚Äôs nomination of Merrick Garland to the Supreme Court because they want the next president to make the pick. And because they now have the conservative puppet president they have always wanted
column3: they want to make sure that nominee is a conservative extremist.

column1: South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham told WYFF-TV that Trump should pick Texas Senator Ted Cruz as the nominee and warned Democrats not to block him
column2: which is hypocritical considering how Republicans have treated President Obama‚Äôs nominee and threatened to block any nominees Hillary Clinton would have made had she won the election.

column1: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to tell my Democratic colleagues that I voted for Obama‚Äôs nominees. I expect them to give Trump‚Äôs nominees a fair shake. He won this election. He will pick a conservative. I would put Ted Cruz on that list. If they try to block this pick
column2: they will regret it. If you don‚Äôt honor Trump‚Äôs nominee
column3: you‚Äôre making a huge mistake.‚Äù

column1: Democrats should stand up and give Graham a collective middle finger.
Since Antonin Scalia died in February
column2: there has been a vacancy on the Supreme Court bench that has yet to be filled. The body wasn‚Äôt even cold yet before Republicans vowed to block any nominee President Obama picked to replace him
column3: going so far as to even deny Garland a confirmation hearing. That‚Äôs far from the ‚Äúfair shake‚Äù Graham is asking Democrats to give to a man as dangerous as Ted Cruz.

column1: Putting Cruz on the Supreme Court would guarantee rulings against women‚Äôs rights and LGBT rights as well as putting laws like the Voting Rights Act and the Civil Rights Act in further peril. In no uncertain terms should Democrats grant Cruz a hearing
column2: nor should they respect any of Trump‚Äôs conservative choices for the court. Republicans should have thought about ‚Äúfair shakes‚Äù before taking the totally unprecedented step of being complete assholes toward the Supreme Court nominee of a sitting president who also won an election and s far more popular than Trump. Again
column3: Senate Republicans didn‚Äôt even give Garland a hearing or a vote. They refused to do their jobs entirely out of disrespect towards President Obama. And so that‚Äôs exactly what Democrats should do to Trump. Turnabout is fair play and Republicans only have themselves to blame.

column2: So Racist Conservatives Call Her A ‚ÄòMonkey‚Äô (SCREENSHOTS);"on November 12

column1: Trump fans may have won the election
column2: but they aren‚Äôt taking a break from expressing their racist hatred of Michelle Obama. The Donald‚Äôs Deplorables were out in force after the First Lady posed for the cover of Vogue.

column1: ‚ÄúI could have spent eight years doing anything
column2: and at some level
column3: it would have been fine
column4: ‚Äù Obama told the magazine . ‚ÄúI could have focused on flowers. I could have focused on decor. I could have focused on entertainment. Because any first lady
column5: rightfully
column6: gets to define her role. There‚Äôs no legislative authority; you‚Äôre not elected. And that‚Äôs a wonderful gift of freedom.‚Äù

column1: In exercising her freedom
column2: Michelle Obama has done quite a bit to push education
column3: healthy eating
column4: and support for our veterans ‚Äî and in exercising their freedom
column5: the Right has responded with nothing but hate. The reaction to the First Lady appearing in elegant clothing was typical. Readers of Yahoo News showered Obama with racist remarks
column6: calling her an ‚Äúape‚Äù and a ‚Äúmonkey‚Äù and even wishing death upon her for the horrific crime of wearing pretty clothes.

column1: If you thought this behavior would stop after the election
column2: you were wrong. Trump fans are not done by a long shot ‚Äî and now they have been emboldened by America electing its first official KKK candidate.

column1: It will get worse before it gets better.

column1: 372;f495aee210336752f140bab451f664e4a975149d;0;;2016-11-14T01:53:53.917+02:00;Racist Sign Calls For Lynching Black People To Prevent Them From Getting Equal Rights;"on November 13
As predicted
column2: Donald Trump‚Äôs victory on Election Day has emboldened racist conservatives to start harassing and attacking minorities.

column1: And it‚Äôs even happening in the deep blue state of California
column2: where a woman spotted a sign hanging on the side of a building in the town of Pittsburg and snapped a photo of it.

column1: Twitter user James Thompson posted the image of the sign on the social media platform after his sister sent it to him. This picture was taken in Pittsburgh California. My sister texted this to me 10 minutes ago.Our democracy is being tested even in California pic.twitter.com/gDLKw54Lox
‚Äî James Thompson (@JETBallin) November 13
The sign clearly promotes lynching to prevent African-Americans from getting equal rights.
‚ÄúYou can hang a n****r from a tree / Equal rights he will never see!‚Äù it says.
The FBI has been notified and local police have filed a lawsuit in an effort to force the owners of the sign to remove it.
In the wake of Trump‚Äôs surprising and depressing victory there has been a rise in the number of racist incidents in this country. In fact
column2: there have been 139 reports of people being bullied by Trump supporters since the election night results.

column1: These incidents include the harassment of a Muslim teacher by a student in Georgia
column2: and students designating water fountains ‚Äúwhite‚Äù or ‚Äúcolored‚Äù at a Florida high school.

column1: Frankly
column2: there are so many incidents that it‚Äôs difficult to list them all. You can find a somewhat comprehensive tally here .

column1: This is what Trump‚Äôs America looks like and it‚Äôs scary. And this has all happend in the course of a few days as Melania Trump continues to tell the media that her focus will be on ending bullying. What exactly does she mean by that? Is she going to call out all bullying
column2: including the racist bullying being perpetrated by her husband‚Äôs own supporters? Or is she going to ignore those incidents and merely whine about people who criticize her husband. Because right now
column3: she isn‚Äôt even First Lady yet and her ‚Äúeffort‚Äù has failed miserably. And she only has her husband to blame.";english;2016-11-14T01:53:53.917+02:00;addictinginfo.org;FR;5772.0;Racist Sign Calls For Lynching Black People To Prevent Them From Getting Equal Rights;0.0;http://addictinginfo.addictinginfoent.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/CxGrYz8UAAAkiYB1-800x430.jpg;0;0;2;0;2;bias

column1: 375;3cf0dbc6c8884b53a531f9303e6ad300e5c5eb67;0;;2016-11-14T01:54:13.190+02:00;"30 People Arrested For Food Stamp Fraud; Guess How Many Were Black";"on February 15
It‚Äôs a common stereotype that food stamp recipients
column2: and those who abuse it
column3: are black
column4: Hispanic
column5: or any other race but white. According to the USDA in their report for fiscal year 2013
column6: 40% of recipients are white and 26% are black. Courtesy of Travissonno.com

column1: While the media and America‚Äôs culture will have you believe that black people (or anyone who isn‚Äôt white) account for copious amounts of fraud
column2: there‚Äôs a story breaking that you won‚Äôt hear on Fox ‚ÄúNews‚Äù anytime soon (or you might
column3: because any chance to crush the SNAP program
column4: they will take).

column1: According to WCAX News in New York:
More than 30 people have been nabbed for food stamp fraud in the North Country.
Investigators say over the past couple month‚Äôs people used their food stamps to get food or alcohol at the Old Time Butcher Block store in Brushton.
Police also say it‚Äôs not the first time the owner of that store
column2: Dennis Sauve
column3: has been charged with allowing such fraud.

column1: Police say more arrests are expected.
Now here‚Äôs the kicker: they‚Äôre all white. Brushton
column2: New York
column3: where this bust happened
column4: has a population of roughly 480 people. Approximately 99.83% of the population is white
column5: and 0.42% are black. These demographics are eerily similar to the food stamp capital of the country
column6: Owsley Country
column7: Kentucky
column8: which is 99.22% white and 95% Republican. Maybe we should investigate them.

column1: I just wish we could get the political affiliations of those arrested in Brushton.
According to WPTZ News:
Police say the arrests are the result of a year-long investigation
column2: initiated by the Franklin County Department of Social Services Fraud Unit. Franklin County District Attorney‚Äôs Office
column3: the United States Department of Agriculture
column4: and the New York State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance helped with the investigation.

column1: The store owner
column2: Denis Sauve (also white)
column3: has been charged with third-degree grand larceny and misuse of food stamps.

column1: This really isn‚Äôt a racial issue so much as it is an
column2: ‚ÄúI told you so
column3: ‚Äù issue. While the food stamp program has one of the lowest rates of abuse than any other welfare program
column4: a lot of people buy into this misconception that it is the ‚Äúlazy blacks‚Äù who account for all the fraud and woes of government assistance. Well
column5: here we are
column6: a major food stamp ‚Äúbust‚Äù and every criminal involved is white.

Early on into Trump‚Äôs campaign

column1: 377;4e23cd2cece886f25c82aa54c0e34451a6e2e591;0;;2016-11-17T04:56:00.000+02:00;Bernie Sanders Rises In The Senate
column2: Prepares To Become Trump‚Äôs WORST Nightmare (TWEETS) | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on November 16

column1: It was just a few days ago that Bernie Sanders responded to Trump‚Äôs election win with the perfect message from Democrats. He said :
‚ÄúIf Donald Trump takes people‚Äôs anger and turns it against Muslims
column2: Hispanics
column3: African Americans and women
column4: we will be his worst nightmare.‚Äù

column1: And from what was just announced
column2: it seems that Sanders has every intention of making good on that warning. Earlier today
column3: the Vermont Senator was named chair of outreach during a closed-door Senate Democrat caucus meeting
column4: according to The Hill . In his new role
column5: Sanders will lead outreach to blue-collar voters ‚Äî the very voters who became Trump supporters this year. Sanders will also be the ranking member on the Senate Budget Committee. Acknowledging that he has a ‚Äúheavy responsibility to help shape the priorities of the United States government
column6: ‚Äù Sanders said: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to do everything that I can to make sure that the budget that leaves the United States Congress is a budget that represents the needs of working families and a shrinking middle class and not billionaires.‚Äù With the announcement of Sanders‚Äô new position
column7: Trump is definitely going to be a nervous wreck. He‚Äôs spent his entire presidential campaign claiming that he would help the working class
column8: and now Sanders is in the position to challenge him and hold him to it for the next four years. By elevating Sanders to this new role
column9: Democrats are moving to a more grassroots message
column10: fully aware that Sanders‚Äô presidential campaign and vision for America resonated with many voters. As we saw with Sanders‚Äô popularity in the primaries
column11: the Vermont Senator struck a nerve with workers and families
column12: making him the perfect candidate to go up against Trump as he takes office. Sen. Debbie Stabenow (D-Mich.) commented on Sanders‚Äô new responsibility: ‚ÄúWe want to expand on that
column13: and he will be reaching out to all our allies. We have a tremendous amount of talent in our caucus and we want to make sure everyone is contributing.‚Äù Sanders hardly needed this promotion to upset Trump
column14: as he‚Äôs been one of the most outspoken politicians on Twitter since Trump‚Äôs win: Twitter Twitter Twitter

column1: However
column2: Sanders‚Äô new role is great news for our country
column3: and we know he‚Äôs going to give Trump hell.

column1: 378;1dc6ff5a17dbaae65f902edc49ea475a4ceb892a;0;;2016-11-22T07:58:00.000+02:00;Trump ERUPTS At Secret Meeting With The Press
column2: Transition In Chaos (TWEETS) | Addicting Info | The Knowledge You Crave;"on November 21

column1: Donald Trump has had a rocky relationship with the press ever since his presidential campaign
column2: and he‚Äôs only punished them further for trying to report the truth since becoming the President-elect.

column1: On Monday
column2: Trump was set to have an off the record meeting with television networks to try and hash out presidential press access. This meeting was particularly important because Trump has previously limited press access
column3: and has ditched two protocol press pools since getting elected.

column1: Some reporters in attendance were NBC‚Äôs Deborah Turness
column2: Lester Holt and Chuck Todd; ABC‚Äôs James Goldston
column3: George Stephanopoulos
column4: David Muir and Martha Raddatz; CBS‚Äô Norah O‚ÄôDonnell and Charlie Rose; Fox News‚Äô Bill Shine
column5: Jack Abernethy
column6: Jay Wallace
column7: Suzanne Scott; MSNBC‚Äôs Phil Griffin; and CNN‚Äôs Jeff Zucker and Erin Burnett. It was a good group
column8: and it could have been a very effective meeting if only things had gone according to plan.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: instead of having a respectful conversation and coming up with an amicable way to move forward
column3: what the press got was a baby Trump temper tantrum of epic proportions. Or
column4: as one person put it
column5: ‚ÄúIt was like a f*cking firing squad.‚Äù

column1: Trump made zero attempt to hide his disrespect for the media. According to The New York Post
column2: one anonymous source said:

column1: ‚ÄúThe meeting was a total disaster. The TV execs and anchors went in there thinking they would be discussing the access they would get to the Trump administration
column2: but instead they got a Trump-style dressing down.‚Äù

column1: This claim was backed up by another person
column2: who said:

column1: ‚ÄúThe meeting took place in a big board room and there were about 30 or 40 people
column2: including the big news anchors from all the networks.

column1: ‚ÄúTrump kept saying
column2: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre in a room of liars
column3: the deceitful dishonest media who got it all wrong. He addressed everyone in the room calling the media dishonest
column4: deceitful liars. He called out Jeff Zucker by name and said everyone at CNN was a liar
column5: and CNN was network of liars.‚Äù

column1: This attack left reporters stunned
column2: and even as they tried to keep bringing up press access to stay on topic
column3: Trump barely let them speak. While this is certainly shocking
column4: this behavior is completely typical of Trump. He has always hated the free press because it has held him accountable and reported on his mistakes and shortcomings.

column1: Americans on social media are already coming to terms with how terrifying this is: Twitter Twitter Twitter
Interestingly enough
column2: Trump spokeswoman Kellyanne Conway had the nerve to say the meeting went well. She said:

column1: ‚ÄúExcellent meetings with the top executives of the major networks. Pretty unprecedented meeting we put together in two days.‚Äù
Disgraceful.

column1: San Francisco
column2: California ‚Äì It was an agreement four years in the making
column3: oftentimes marred by shouting matches among city hall officials
column4: representatives of the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence
column5: merchants and homeowners. But the Halloween party in San Francisco‚Äôs gay Castro district finally returns in 2014.

column1: It will be recalled that the Halloween bash attracted as many as 500
column2: 000 each year and has become a major tourist attraction
column3: second and third only to the Pride parade and Folsom Street Fair. Stabbing and shooting incidents
column4: believed to be perpetrated by straight revelers
column5: prompted city officials to permanently ban the event beginning in 2010.

column1: As part of the agreement
column2: the ‚Äúnew‚Äù Castro Halloween will be open only to members of the LGBTQ community who will have to register with city hall and be included in a ‚Äúgay registry.‚Äù Registrants
column3: who will take an oath admitting that they are gay
column4: lesbian
column5: bisexual
column6: transgender or questioning
column7: will be issued special identification cards linked to the official registry. The IDs will be the only accepted pass to gain entry to the Halloween event. ID‚Äôs will be scanned at entrances to the event to confirm that individuals are listed in the official registry.

column1: 380;20e1a45f760f8db5f26207bbfe827bf8cd6d65bb;0;Ivan Jose;2016-10-27T09:18:46.193+03:00;Comment on Tutorial: Riding The Philippine Jeepney by Ivan Jose;"adobochron 1 Comment
MANILA
column2: Philippines (The Adobo Chronicles
column3: Manila Bureau) ‚Äì This is a tutorial on how to ride the jeepney which is an important mode of mass transportation in many cities and towns in the Philippines.

column1: Many of you may already be familiar with these rules
column2: etiquette and tricks but for those who are visiting the country for the first time or are returning nationals (balikbayan) who have been away for a long time
column3: you might want to keep this tutorial handy. First of all
column4: not all jeepneys you encounter are as colorful
column5: shiny and clean as the one pictured here. If you are bothered by smoke or the smell of gasoline
column6: remember to always carry and wear a disposable surgical mask. It also helps with
column7: you know
column8: body odor. In most cases
column9: there are no jeepney stops like there are bus stops. Wherever you are
column10: be rest assured that so long as there is room for one more passsenger
column11: the jeepney will stop for you. Speaking of room
column12: when the driver says the capacity of his jeepney is 10 passengers on either side
column13: you can‚Äôt argue. Ten means ten
column14: even if only half your butt sits comfortably on the padded seat. Only cash payment is accepted
column15: but you probably already know that. Exact fare is appreciated but Mr. Driver is happy to provide change except very early in the day. ‚ÄúBarya lang po sa umaga!‚Äù No five hundred peso bills in the morning
column16: please. Jeepney fare is passed on from one passenger to another until it reaches the driver. The same is true for any change back due the passenger. It takes a village to ride the jeepney you know. If you don‚Äôt want to be bothered by other passengers asking you to pass on the fare to the driver
column17: sit as far as possible from the driver
column18: assuming that premium spot is vacant. The jeepney driver would appreciate it so much if you pay your fare before you start texting on your mobile phone. ‚ÄúGod knows who doesn‚Äôt pay
column19: ‚Äù says one jeepney sign. There are two phrases you need to learn when riding the jeepney: ‚ÄúBayad po‚Äù (here‚Äôs my fare) and ‚ÄúPara po‚Äù (this is my stop). If you don‚Äôt speak the language
column20: no worries. Just pass on your fare to the passenger next to you and he or she will know what to do. And if you need to disembark
column21: just knock on the jeepney‚Äôs roof. It also means ‚Äúplease stop.‚Äù There are discounted fares for students and seniors. Be sure to say ‚Äúone senior‚Äù or ‚Äúone student‚Äù when paying your fare. Otherwise
column22: you pay full fare. Filipinos have learned to respect seniors and people with disabilities. The spot closest to the jeepney entrance (farthest from the driver) is reserved for them. Isn‚Äôt that nice? As always
column23: hold on to the hand rails. It can be a very bumpy ride. Rate this:";english;2016-10-27T09:18:46.193+03:00;adobochronicles.com;US;;Comment on Tutorial: Riding The Philippine Jeepney by Ivan Jose;0.0;https://adobochroniclesdotcom.files.wordpress.com/2016/10/img_6705.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;fake

column1: 381;9874fcff14d4af3c13954116c55590b28a5b98b8;0;Tony Rabon;2016-10-28T19:56:09.149+03:00;Comment on What White House Executive Chef Comerford Would Cook For President Hillary‚Äôs First Meal by Tony Rabon;"adobochron 1 Comment Comerford
WASHINGTON
column2: D.C. ( The Adobo Chronicles
column3: Washington Bureau) ‚Äì White House executive chef
column4: Filipino-American Cristeta Comerford
column5: has revealed what she would cook for President Hillary Clinton‚Äôs first meal when she moves (back) to the presidential residence. That is
column6: of course
column7: assuming the Clintons will continue to retain her services.

column1: It would be pancit
column2: that signature noodle dish closely identified with the Philippines.

column1: When asked by The Adobo Chronicles why she chose pancit
column2: Comerford said that pancit represents long life and a ‚Äòlong term
column3: ‚Äô meaning she was hoping Hillary would be elected to a second four-year term like her predecessor and current boss
column4: President Barack Obama. Filipino pancit (Photo: MyBayKitchen.com)

column1: We were hoping she‚Äôd say ‚Äúchicken or pork adobo‚Äù but we agree with her rationale for choosing pancit. 383;6cc3f4a496a8124a3832867e74a1a26a9ae43232;0;ÿ®ÿ±ŸÜÿßŸÖŸá ÿ±€åÿ≤€å ÿ∂ŸÖ€åÿ± ŸÜÿßÿÆŸàÿØÿß⁄ØÿßŸá;2016-11-04T22:17:00.000+02:00;Comment on Hillary Clinton Campaign Logo Has A Subliminal Message by ÿ®ÿ±ŸÜÿßŸÖŸá ÿ±€åÿ≤€å ÿ∂ŸÖ€åÿ± ŸÜÿßÿÆŸàÿØÿß⁄ØÿßŸá;"adobochron 1 Comment
SAN FRANCISCO
column2: California ( The Adobo Chronicles
column3: San Francisco Bureau) ‚Äì Now it can be told ‚Äî now that Hillary Clinton is all but assured of the Democratic presidential nomination.

column1: For months since the former secretary of state launched her presidential bid
column2: her campaign logo has always symbolized America‚Äôs quest to move forward
column3: with the arrow in the logo pointing to the right. Left-handed people
column4: of course
column5: dispute that symbolism because for them
column6: moving forward should be pointing to the left.

column1: But there is another school of thought about Hillary‚Äôs logo. Many believe that the arrow pointing right actually symbolizes moving to the (conservative) right as opposed to the (liberal) left.
The logo was a brilliant concept designed to help the Democrats win over Republican voters in the general elections ‚Äî voters who will definitely choose a rightist over a leftist candidate.
The GOP‚Äôs presumptive nominee
column2: Donald Trump
column3: is perceived by many as more leftist than rightist
column4: which would give Clinton the edge among conservative voters.

column1: Who knew the placement or direction of an arrow could spell victory or defeat for an American presidential candidate? 384;d6cf2ee2ebc9b55ec8385b0a20f9417cbd9f63a9;0;adobochron;2016-11-06T23:48:58.529+02:00;Comment on Philippine Government To ‚ÄòTake Back The Internet‚Äô From Maria Ressa And Rappler? by adobochron;"adobochron 2 Comments
MANILA
column2: Philippines ( The Adobo Chronicles
column3: Manila Bureau) ‚Äì Rappler CEO Maria Ressa‚Äôs widely-quoted statement
column4: ‚ÄúTime to take back the Internet‚Äù might just come back to haunt her. Just in time for Halloween.

column1: Ressa has been very vocal about the proliferation of ‚Äúfake‚Äù news sites and trolls that have left her online news organization lagging behind in terms of followers and reader engagements. She was particularly critical of entertainer-turned-political blogger
column2: Mocha Uson
column3: who has more than 4 million followers
column4: twice that of Rappler.

column1: Now
column2: the Philippine government may soon ‚Äòtake back the Internet‚Äô from Rappler because it appears it has violated the Philippine Constitution.

column1: Article XVI
column2: Section 11 of the 1987 Philippine Constitution specifically states that the mass media must be wholly-owned and managed by citizens of the Philippines.

column1: But Rappler is partly-owned by a foreign company
column2: Omidyar Network. How do we know? Rappler itself told us so way back on November 5

column1: So
column2: before Rappler can take back the Internet
column3: it may first have to give it up! column2: Donald Trump Will Not Live In The White House by Rebecca Bennett;"adobochron 2 Comments The Trump hotels in Las Vegas

column1: DES MOINES
column2: Iowa ( The Adobo Chronicles) ‚Äì Since he launched his bid to be the Republican nominee for president of the United States
column3: Donald Trump has made many promises
column4: but nothing has caught the attention of the media and electorate more than what he said today in Iowa
column5: on the eve of the first caucus of the 2016 presidential elections season.

column1: If elected president of the United States
column2: Trump says he will not live in the White House.

column1: Instead

‚ÄúWell

CUPERTINO
column2: California ( The Adobo Chronicles
column3: San Jose Bureau) ‚Äì Technology giant Apple is known for its innovation and for constantly reinventing itself and its products. This strategy has spelled the company‚Äôs tremendous success across the globe.

column1: Occasionally
column2: Apple immerses itself in politics and the current political atmosphere following the election of Donald Trump as the 45th U.S. president is one of those times.

column1: By now
column2: the term Alt-Right (Alternative Right) has become a familiar phrase especially on social media.

column1: The Alternative Right
column2: commonly known as the Alt-Right
column3: is a set of far-right ideologies
column4: groups and individuals whose core belief is that ‚Äúwhite identity‚Äù is under attack by multicultural forces using ‚Äúpolitical correctness‚Äù and ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù to undermine white people and ‚Äútheir‚Äù civilization. Characterized by heavy use of social media and online memes
column5: Alt-Righters eschew ‚Äúestablishment‚Äù conservatism
column6: skew young
column7: and embrace white ethno-nationalism as a fundamental value.

column1: In keeping up with this new political atmosphere
column2: Apple has just announced that it will be replacing all keyboards on its desktops
column3: laptops
column4: iPhones and iPads with a new design that adds the ‚ÄúAlt-Right‚Äù key. The key will be located in the lowermost right corner of the keyboard. How appropriate

column1: Apple CEO Tim Cook said that the addition of this all-important key will enable those who subscribe to the Alternative Right ideologies (and idiosyncrasies) to identify themselves when sending emails
column2: texts or posting on social media. Hitting the ‚ÄúAlt-Right‚Äù key will automatically add the hashtag #AlternativeRight to whatever a person is typing on the keyboard.

column1: We abide by the highest standards of creative writing and intend to make this site as respectable as possible to the extent allowed by our fertile mind. We welcome comments
column2: but please bear in mind that this is a family-oriented site. We reserve the right to edit or censor any comment that we deem inappropriate or funnier than our posts .

column1: We also welcome reposts of our stories but request appropriate credit to The Adobo Chronicles. We cannot be responsible for reposts without credit as they may be taken in a context outside of the original intent of this website. (Yeah we know
column2: that was quite a mouthful!)

column1: Why the title
column2: ‚Äú The Adobo Chronicles
column3: ‚Äù you might ask? Well
column4: adobo is the national dish of our home country. You see
column5: adobo is usually made with pork or chicken
column6: boiled and simmered in a mixture of vinegar
column7: soy sauce and other spices. When writing stories for this blog
column8: we let the news sizzle and simmer in our mind in a mixture of fact and fiction
column9: then we spice it up with figments of our imagination.

column3: parody and the Internet. No copyright infringement is intended.

column1: MANILA
column2: Philippines ( The Adobo Chronicles
column3: Manila Bureau) ‚Äì Advertising company McCann Worldgroup Philippines will be in charge of crafting the new tourism campaign of the country
column4: the Department of Tourism (DOT) said over the weekend.

column1: Tourism undersecretary for advocacy and public affairs Katherine de Castro said the P650-million contract with McCann
column2: which won the bid to be the advertising and promotions partner of the DOT for one year
column3: includes the production and positioning of marketing materials
column4: as well as the formulation of a new tourism slogan.

column1: The Adobo Chronicles spoke with a McCann spokesperson who informed us that the slogan selected for the 2017 tourism year is a take-off from the previous ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs More Fun in the Philippines.‚Äù
The new slogan is ‚ÄúMore Fun in P.I.‚Äù
P.I. of course stands for Philippine Islands (although the country is now known by the acronym of ‚ÄòPH.‚Äô)
But it also stands for ‚ÄòP*tang Ina‚Äô (Son of a Whore)
column2: the cuss words often heard from President Rodrigo Roa Duterte in his speeches and interviews.

column1: ‚ÄúPresident Duterte‚Äôs rhetoric and cussing have put the Philippines on the world map and we would like to capitalize on that
column2: ‚Äù the McCann spokesperson said.

column1: He added: ‚ÄúWhy reinvent the wheel when we can just tweak it to reflect the current situation in the Philippines?‚Äù";english;2016-11-25T08:08:35.160+02:00;adobochronicles.com;US;;Comment on Philippines‚Äô Department Of Tourism Unveils New Promo Slogan

column2: John Podesta

column1: 915;9eb39920d88dd43ea9ffd580de811aaa4c42f00f;0;;2016-10-26T23:53:00.000+03:00;Hillary has built the biggest big-money operation ever;"Email
BEVERLY HILLS
column2: Calif. ‚Äî More than 100 of Hillary Clinton‚Äôs biggest donors crowded into the home of Casey and Laura Wasserman here on Thursday night
column3: each having written a check for at least $33
column4: 400 to snag a ticket. The Hollywood glitterati in attendance ‚Äî Elton John performed on the piano; Barbra Streisand mingled in the crowd ‚Äî were sending her off for the home stretch of the campaign with north of $5 million in fresh funding.

column1: It was a fitting capstone to a remarkable 18 months for Clinton on the lucrative California fundraising circuit
column2: this final event anchored by a host committee of billionaires
column3: Hollywood executives
column4: media moguls and tech investors ‚Äî Sean Parker
column5: Jeffrey Katzenberg
column6: Haim Saban
column7: Chris Sacca ‚Äî that each directed $416
column8: 000 to Clinton‚Äôs efforts.

column1: Clinton calls them her ‚ÄúHillblazers
column2: ‚Äù campaign bundlers who have given or raised at least $100
column3: 000 for her campaign. And she has erected an unparalleled and unprecedented infrastructure of 1
column4: 133 such people ‚Äî nearly double the number of any past presidential candidate
column5: including President Obama four years ago.

column1: While Clinton and her advisers like to tout her small online donors
column2: it is these bundlers in more than 40 states and four foreign countries who form the true backbone of her financial operation. Combined
column3: this elite $100
column4: 000-and-up club has amassed a minimum of $113 million for Clinton and the Democratic Party ‚Äî and the actual figure is likely far
column5: far higher than that. (The biggest bundlers typically collect millions for campaigns.)

column1: ‚ÄúWe had the best base of donors and bundlers and raisers ever in 2008. It was even better in 2012. And it‚Äôs much better in 2016 than 2012
column2: ‚Äù said Wade Randlett
column3: a San Francisco-based Democrat who has raised money for Clinton
column4: Obama and Democratic causes for decades. ‚ÄúThe Obama people basically 100 percent in are favor of Hillary. There‚Äôs really no loss because of ideology or bad blood. And she has added an enormous number of people
column5: especially women.‚Äù

column1: Among her bundlers are celebrities (Will Smith) and sports stars (Earvin ‚ÄúMagic‚Äù Johnson)
column2: Hollywood directors (Steven Spielberg and George Lucas) and corporate executives (Marissa Mayer and Sheryl Sandberg)
column3: Wall Street-types (Marc Lasry)
column4: media executives (Haim Saban and Anna Wintour) and members of Congress
column5: including her running mate
column6: Sen. Tim Kaine
column7: who helped raise more than $100
column8: 000 for Clinton before he joined the ticket in July.

column1: The Clinton campaign said 45 percent of its bundlers are women.
There are also federal lobbyists
column2: from whom the Democratic Party under Obama refused to accept money
column3: a prohibition that has since been rolled back.

column1: This club has expanded to the point where Clinton would now struggle to fit all of these bundlers into a single ballroom. As of the end of June
column2: she counted 496 such individuals and couples. By the end of July
column3: it was 871. On August 31
column4: it was 1

column1: It includes billionaires George Soros
column2: Warren Buffett and Tom Steyer
column3: super lobbyists like Steve Elmendorf and bold-faced names like Calvin Klein and J.J. Abrams. There is also a sprinkling of longtime Clinton family advisers
