column1: 1009;d5196999e263839289d72d5f879b6288d5bfe7f3;0;;2016-10-30T14:19:34.955+02:00;Queen Elizabeth II owns every dolphin in Britain and doesn't need a driving licence and doesn't pay tax ‚Äî here are the incredible powers you didn't know the monarchy has;"Email
Queen Elizabeth II is not like you and me.
Did you know she is immune from prosecution? That she has her own personal poet
column2: paid in Sherry wine? Or that she holds dominion over British swans and can fire the entire Australian government?

column1: It's true that her role as the British head of state is largely ceremonial
column2: and the Monarch no longer holds any serious power from day to day. The historic ""prerogative powers"" of the Sovereign have been devolved largely to government ministers. But this still means that when the British government declares war
column3: or regulates the civil service
column4: or signs a treaty
column5: it is doing so only on her authority.

column1: And she still wields some of these prerogative powers herself ‚Äî as well as numerous other unique powers
column2: ranging from the surprising to the utterly bizarre.

column1: Most famously
column2: she owns all swans in the River Thames.

column1: Technically
column2: all unmarked swans in open water belong to the Queen
column3: though the Crown ""exercises her ownership"" only ""on certain stretches of the Thames and its surrounding tributaries
column4: according to the official website of the Royal Family.

column1: Today this tradition is observed during the annual ""Swan Upping
column2: in which swans in the River Thames are caught
column3: ringed
column4: and set free again as part of census of the swan population.

column1: It's a highly ceremonial affair
column2: taking place over five days. ""Swan uppers"" wear traditional uniforms and row upriver in six skiffs accompanied by the Queen's Swan Marker.

column1: The swans are also given a health check and ringed with individual identification numbers by The Queen's Swan Warden
column2: a Professor of Ornithology at the University of Oxford's Department of Zoology
column3: according to the Royal Family website.

column1: Rule
column2: Britannia
column3: Britannia rules the waves
column4: goes a classic British song ‚Äî and this rule extends beneath the waves
column5: too. The sovereign has dominion over a variety of aquatic animals in British waters.

column1: The Queen still technically owns all the sturgeons
column2: whales
column3: and dolphins in the waters around England and Wales
column4: in a rule that dates back to a statute from 1324
column5: during the reign of King Edward II
column6: according to Time.

column1: According to the article: ""This statute is still valid today
column2: and sturgeons
column3: porpoises
column4: whales
column5: and dolphins are recognised as 'fishes royal': when they are captured within 3 miles (about 5 km) of UK shores or wash ashore
column6: they may be claimed on behalf of the Crown. Generally
column7: when brought into port
column8: a sturgeon is sold in the usual way
column9: and the purchaser
column10: as a gesture of loyalty
column11: requests the honour of its being accepted by Elizabeth.""

column1: The law is still observed: In 2004
column2: a Welsh fisherman was investigated by the police after catching a 10-foot sturgeon
column3: the BBC reported at the time. The Scottish government also issued guidance on the law in 2007
column4: writing that ""the right to claim Royal Fish in Scotland allows the Scottish Government (on behalf of the Crown) to claim stranded whales which are too large to be drawn to land by a 'wain pulled by six oxen.'""

column1: The Queen can drive without a licence.
Driving licenses are issued in the Queen's name
column2: yet she is the only person in the United Kingdom who doesn't legally need a license to drive or a number plate on her cars
column3: according to Time.

column1: Despite not being required to have a license
column2: the Queen is comfortable behind the wheel
column3: having learned to drive during World War II when she operated a first-aid truck for the Women's Auxillary Territorial Service. (As a result of the Queen's training
column4: she can also change a spark plug
column5: Time notes).

column1: Queen Elizabeth II isn't afraid to show off her driving skills
column2: either. In 1998
column3: she surprised King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia (then still a prince) by driving him around in her country seat of Balmoral.

column1: Former British Ambassador Sherard Cowper-Coles recounted the meeting in the Sunday Times: ""As instructed
column2: the crown prince climbed into the front seat of the front Land Rover
column3: with his interpreter in the seat behind. To his surprise
column4: the Queen climbed into the driving seat
column5: turned the ignition and drove off. Women are not ‚Äî yet ‚Äî allowed to drive in Saudi Arabia
column6: and Abdullah was not used to being driven by a woman
column7: let alone a queen.""

column1: Cowper-Coles continued: ""His nervousness only increased as the Queen
column2: an army driver in wartime
column3: accelerated the Land Rover along the narrow Scottish estate roads
column4: talking all the time. Through his interpreter
column5: the crown prince implored the Queen to slow down and concentrate on the road ahead.""

column1: Unlike other members of the Royal family
column2: the Queen does not require a passport
column3: as they are issued in her name. Despite this lack of travel documents
column4: she has been abroad many times.

column1: She has two birthdays.
When you're the British head of state
column2: one birthday just isn't enough. The Queen's official birthday is celebrated on a Saturday in June
column3: though her actual birthday is on April 21.

column1: Official celebrations to mark a sovereign's birthday have often been held on a day other than the actual birthday
column2: particularly when the actual birthday has not been in the summer
column3: according to the Royal Mint.

column1: Both birthdays are celebrated in suitable style
column2: too. Her actual birthday ""is marked publicly by gun salutes in central London at midday
column3: according to the official website of the British Monarchy. This includes ""a 41-gun salute in Hyde Park
column4: a 21-gun salute in Windsor Great Park
column5: and a 62-gun salute at the Tower of London. In 2006
column6: Her Majesty celebrated her 80th Birthday in 2006 with a walkabout in the streets outside of Windsor Castle to meet well-wishers.""

column1: For her ""official"" birthday celebrations
column2: meanwhile
column3: she ""is joined by other members of the Royal Family at the spectacular Trooping the Colour parade
column4: which moves between Buckingham Palace
column5: The Mall
column6: and Horseguards' Parade.""

column1: She has her own private cash machine.
Less a ""power"" and more a perk of the job
column2: a private cash machine for use by the royal family is installed in the basement of Buckingham Palace. It's provided by Coutts
column3: one of Britain's most prestigious ‚Äî and exclusive ‚Äî banks.

column1: The Queen has her own personal poet.
The poet laureate is an honorary position in British society appointed by the Monarch to a poet ""whose work is of national significance
column2: according to the official website of the British Monarchy. When first the role was introduced
column3: the appointee was paid ¬£200 per year plus a butt of canary wine. Today the poet laureate is given a barrel of Sherry.

column1: Carol Ann Duffy will hold the position until 2019.
She has to sign laws.
The Queen's consent is necessary to turn any bill into an actual law. Once a proposed law has passed both houses of Parliament
column2: it makes its way to the Palace for approval
column3: which is called ""Royal Assent."" The most recent British Monarch to refuse to provide Royal Assent was Queen Anne
column4: back in 1708.

column1: Royal Assent is different than ""Queen's consent
column2: in which the Queen must consent to any law being debated in Parliament that affects the Monarchy's interests (such as reforming the prerogative or tax laws that might affect the Duchy of Cornwall
column3: for example). Without consent
column4: the bill cannot be debated in Parliament.

column1: Queen's consent is exercised only on the advice of ministers
column2: but its existence provides the government with a tool for blocking debate on certain subjects if bills are tabled by backbench rebels or the opposition.

column1: It has been exercised at least 39 times
column2: according to documents released under the Freedom of Information act
column3: including ""one instance [in which] the Queen completely vetoed the Military Actions Against Iraq Bill in 1999
column4: a private member's bill that sought to transfer the power to authorise military strikes against Iraq from the monarch to parliament
column5: The Guardian reported in 2013.

column1: She can create Lords.
The Queen has the power to appoint Lords
column2: who can then sit in Parliament
column3: the upper house in Britain's legislative system. Like many other powers
column4: this is exercised only ""on the advice of"" elected government ministers.

column1: She doesn't have to pay tax (but she does anyway).
The Queen does not have to pay tax
column2: but she has been voluntarily paying income tax and capital gains tax since 1992.

column1: The Queen has the power to form governments.
Unlike the Queen
column2: Prime Minister David Cameron doesn't literally sit on a throne. Rob Stothard/Getty Images/HBO/BI

column1: The Queen previously wielded the power to dissolve Parliament and call a general election
column2: but the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act put an end to that in 2011. Now a two-thirds vote in the commons is required to dissolve Parliament before a five-year fixed-term is up.

column1: She does still play a part after an election
column2: however
column3: when she calls on the MP most able to form a government to do so.

column1: This caused some worry ahead of this year's General Election. It once looked as if the Conservatives might not have a majority (but would be the largest party) and would try to form a government. Meanwhile
column2: it was feasible that Labour could form a majority
column3: despite having fewer seats
column4: by entering into a coalition with multiple other parties.

column1: In this situation
column2: the Queen would have been stuck between a rock and a hard place. Every year
column3: she opens Parliament with the Queen's speech
column4: which lays out the government's plans. But to give David Cameron's speech would arguably be to tacitly endorse his government ‚Äî while staying away would send the opposite message.

column1: At one point
column2: The Times was told by sources that she planned to ""stay away"" if Cameron failed to secure enough MPs
column3: but the Palace later had an about-face. ""Royal sources confirmed she would lead proceedings
column4: even if there was a risk the speech would be overthrown the following week because the Tories had failed to muster enough backing from smaller parties
column5: The Times subsequently reported.

column1: She has knights.‚Äã
Sure
column2: they no longer ride around on horseback wooing maidens with their tales of valour
column3: but Britain still retains knights. Like Lords
column4: they are appointed by the Queen ‚Äî and she knights them personally.

column1: Knighthoods are typically given to figures who have made a particular contribution to British society ‚Äî whether in business
column2: the arts
column3: the military
column4: or elsewhere. After Terry Pratchett was knighted
column5: the legendary fantasy author forged himself a special sword using pieces of a meteorite.

column1: The individuals knighted are decided by ministers
column2: the BBC reports
column3: ""who present her with a list of nominees each year for her approval.""

column1: She is exempt from Freedom Of Information requests.

All information about the royal family is exempt from Freedom of Information requests. The exemption was made after a legal battle between The Guardian and the government to have letters from Prince Charles sent to Whitehall ministers made public. The so-called black spider memos were recently released
column2: but the change means the same can't happen in the future.

column1: She can ignore or overrule ministerial advice in ""grave constitutional crisis.""
While the overwhelming majority of the Queen's prerogative powers are devolved to her ministers
column2: there is one exception that allows her to wield power herself. Only ""in grave constitutional crisis
column3: the Sovereign can ""act contrary to or without Ministerial advice."" With no precedent in modern times
column4: it's not clear what would actually constitute this
column5: but the possibility remains.

column1: The Queen holds the ability to fire the entire Australian government.
As the head of state in Australia
column2: the Queen has certain powers over the government. In 1975
column3: for example
column4: the Queen's representative in the country at the time
column5: Gov. Gen. Sir John Kerr
column6: fired the prime minister in response to a government shutdown.

column1: [Kerr] appointed a replacement
column2: who immediately passed the spending bill to fund the government
column3: Max Fisher wrote in The Washington Post. ""Three hours later
column4: Kerr dismissed the rest of Parliament. Then Australia held elections to restart from scratch. And they haven't had another shutdown since.""

column1: In addition to the UK and Australia
column2: the Queen is also the head of state in Antigua and Barbuda
column3: the Bahamas
column4: Barbados
column5: Belize
column6: Canada
column7: Grenada
column8: Jamaica
column9: New Zealand
column10: Papua New Guinea
column11: Saint Kitts and Nevis
column12: Saint Lucia
column13: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
column14: Solomon Islands
column15: and Tuvalu.

column1: All the above are Commonwealth Realms
column2: or former British colonies. The British sovereign retains the position she holds in the United Kingdom
column3: that of head of state. As in Britain
column4: this is largely a ceremonial role from day to day.

column1: She's the head of a religion.
Queen Elizabeth II is the head of the Church of England
column2: Britain's state religion first established after King Henry VIII split away from the Catholic Church in Rome in the 16th century.

column1: Her formal title is defender of the faith and supreme governor of the Church of England
column2: and she also has the power to appoint Bishops and Archbishops. As with many of her other powers
column3: however
column4: this is exercised only on the advice of the prime minister
column5: who himself takes advice from a Church Commission.

column1: An interesting side effect of this is that the Sovereign must be a confirmed member of Church of England. Catholics and those of other religions may not ascend to the British throne. If Prince Charles converted to Islam
column2: for example
column3: he would be unable to become king after Queen Elizabeth II dies.

column1: She gets to give away special money to the elderly.

Maundy money is a special kind of silver coin the Queen gives away to pensioners every year at a UK cathedral every Easter in a special ceremony. The number of recipients corresponds with the Sovereign's age. This year
column2: for example
column3: she will be 89 when Easter rolls around
column4: so she will give maundy money away to 89 pensioners.

column1: The coins are technically legal tender
column2: despite coming in unconventional 3-pence and 4-pence denominations. But given the coins' rare status
column3: they tend not to enter general circulation.

column1: She's also immune from prosecution.
All prosecutions are carried out in the name of the Sovereign
column2: and she is both immune from prosecution and cannot be compelled to give evidence in court.

column1: In theory
column2: the Sovereign ""is incapable of thinking or doing wrong
column3: legal scholar John Kirkhope told Business Insider. However
column4: barrister Baroness Helena Kennedy QC told the BBC in 2002 that ""nowadays
column5: that immunity is questionable.""

column1: Although civil and criminal proceedings cannot be taken against the Sovereign as a person under UK law
column2: the Queen is careful to ensure that all her activities in her personal capacity are carried out in strict accordance with the law
column3: according to official site of the Monarchy.

column1: If the monarch did commit a grievance offence
column2: he or she would almost certainly be forced to abdicate. There is at least one precedent of the Courts' prosecuting the Sovereign. In the 17th Century
column3: King Charles I was tried for treason following the English Civil War. He said ""no earthly power can justly call me (who am your King) in question as a delinquent."" The Court disagreed and had him executed.

column1: The Queen has the right to be consulted
column2: to encourage
column3: and to warn her ministers.

column1: Assuming no ""grave constitutional crisis
column2: the Queen's input into the legislative process is supposed to be limited in real terms to the right ""to be consulted
column3: to encourage
column4: and to warn"" her ministers ‚Äî advice delivered via meetings with the prime minister.

column1: The Queen also has certain historic rights and privileges. John Kirkhope
column2: a lawyer who successfully campaigned to have details of ""Queen's consent"" made public
column3: provided Business Insider with a list of some of the stranger rights the Queen still holds.

column1: Hungerford has to present a red rose to the Sovereign in exchange for its fishing and grazing rights.The Duke of Atholl must pay by way of a rose whenever the Sovereign calls. This most recently happened during the reign of Queen Victoria
column2: so it's unclear whether the rose has to be any particular colour.If the Sovereign passes near Kidwelly Castle in Wales
column3: the tenant has to provide a bodyguard in full armour. This is complicated slightly by the fact the castle is a ruin.The Marquis of Ailesbury owns Savernake Forest and is required to produce a blast on a hunting horn should the Sovereign pass through the Forest. This last happened in 1943.Similarly
column4: the owner of Dunlambert Castle in Northern Ireland has to produce a blast on an ancient bugle.And lastly
column5: many landowners must also pay a ""quit-rent"" ‚Äî a kind of tax on their property paid to the Monarch. Some are pretty unusual.

column1: The owner of Sauchlemuir Castle must set out three glasses of port on New Year's Eve for the grandmother of James IV of Scotland. (For reference
column2: James IV served from 1474 to 1513.)The owner of Fowlis must deliver ‚Äî when required ‚Äî a snowball in mid-summer.The City of Gloucester pays for its holdings of Crown Lands by providing an enormous eel pie.Great Yarmouth must provide a hundred herrings baked in 24 pasties to the Sheriff
column3: who then sends them to the Lord of the Manor ‚Äî who then sends them to the Sovereign.The Duke of Marlborough has to present a small satin flag with a Fleur de Lys on August 13
column4: the anniversary of the Battle of Blenheim.The Duke of Wellington has to present a French Tricolour flag before noon on June 19 ‚Äî the anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo.";english;2016-10-30T14:19:34.955+02:00;awdnews.com;DE;;Queen Elizabeth II owns every dolphin in Britain and doesn't need a driving licence and doesn't pay tax ‚Äî here are the incredible powers you didn't know the monarchy has;0.0;http://awdnews.com/images/14778275732701-bj74t1.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;conspiracy

column1: 1525;0fbb96f5a5fafc1bca0d46717800ebe3cc3ff757;0;;2016-10-27T01:45:00.000+03:00;Life: 6 Robot Street Performers That Refused To Break Character For A Fucking Second And Tell Me If They Had Seen My Son;Email I lost track of my boy. He‚Äôs 4-foot-9
column2: has brown hair
column3: and is wearing a shirt with a lizard on it. These robot street performers have not been any help at all. 1. The weather was nice
column4: so I took my son to the boardwalk to walk around and watch the street performers. We were in line to get pretzels when he ran off to chase after a pigeon
column5: and I lost him in the crowd. I looked around the area and couldn‚Äôt find him anywhere. So I ran up to one of those robot street-performer guys that I know my son loves to watch and asked him if he had seen a small boy with a lizard shirt on. The guy turned to me and just started robotically dancing to ‚ÄúFunkytown.‚Äù No matter how much I implored him to stop dancing to ‚ÄúFunkytown‚Äù and tell me if he‚Äôd seen my son
column6: he refused to break character for even a goddamn second. This was extremely upsetting to me
column7: but I didn‚Äôt have time to dwell on it. I ran off in search of my son. 2. The next robot street performer I asked about my son was doing the thing where they pretend to be in ‚Äúoff mode‚Äù and wouldn‚Äôt even look me in the eye as I begged him to help me find my little boy. But I was really starting to worry about my son
column8: so I played along and threw a dollar in his tip bucket hoping that would make him ‚Äúturn on.‚Äù But that didn‚Äôt make him turn on. So I threw $5 in his bucket
column9: and that didn‚Äôt make him turn on either. Finally
column10: I put a $20 in the bucket
column11: and he whirred to life
column12: blowing on his weird
column13: whirling whistle thing. But he still wouldn‚Äôt tell me if he had seen my son. He just kept blowing on that stupid fucking whistle of his. That‚Äôs all he did. Whistle and whistle and whistle. 3. At this point it had been 10 minutes or so since I lost track of my son
column14: so I was officially in panic mode. I went up to yet another one of the boardwalk‚Äôs many robot street performers and asked him if he had seen my son. I even took out a picture of him to show the guy. He looked at the picture and studied it for a moment
column15: and I‚Äôm elated because
column16: unlike the other ones
column17: he actually seemed like he might help me. But then he took the picture of my son
column18: put it in his mouth
column19: and pretended to robotically print it out of his mouth like a ticket or something. So I grabbed the picture and started to walk away when the son of a bitch took me by the hand and offered me a metallic rose. This piece of shit was incorporating me into his whole goddamn act. And by the way
column20: the crowd was loving it. They were eating it up. So I threw his stupid metallic rose on the ground and asked him again if he‚Äôd seen my son. And he just started doing a robotic version of the beating-heart thing that mimes do. By then I was just crying because I was so worried about my son
column21: and the motherfucker offered me a metallic handkerchief. A metallic fucking handkerchief. I swear to God. 4. When I went up to this robot street performer
column22: he was smoking a cigarette and looking at his phone
column23: clearly on a break. Finally
column24: I thought. This man will help me find my son. But when I asked him if he had seen my boy
column25: he actually went back into character and started smoking his cigarette all robotically. What a nightmare. 5. I really could‚Äôve used some comfort and assistance when I approached this robot street performer and asked him if he had seen my son. Instead
column26: I got a dance battle between him
column27: one of those tree guys
column28: and a couple of statue men. All of them refused to acknowledge me
column29: including the statue men who honestly shouldn‚Äôt have even been dancing because their whole thing is supposed to be that they‚Äôre statues. But they did dance. And they were really good. The whole group was really good at dancing. And they wouldn‚Äôt stop for a second to help a distraught mother find her child. Disgusting. 6. As soon as I asked this robot performer if he had seen my son anywhere
column30: he pointed his robot finger at a little boy in the front row. I told him that was not my son and described him to the guy. The guy then pointed at the boy again. Again
column31: I told him this was not my child. He then started robot dancing around the boy
column32: pointing to him over and over and over again. The boy was loving the attention
column33: but I was infuriated. Fed up with the robot street performers
column34: I turned to the little boy and asked him if he had seen a little boy about his age running around here on his own. The little boy looked up at me
column35: considering the question. Then one of these robot street-performer fucking shitwads showed up with a boombox blasting ‚ÄúFunkytown
column36: ‚Äù and suddenly everyone was dancing to ‚ÄúFunkytown
column37: ‚Äù including this little boy. That‚Äôs when I gave up hope of finding out if any of the robot street performers had seen my son. Daniel
column38: if you‚Äôre reading this
column39: I‚Äôm by the bike rental. Please come find me.;english;2016-10-27T09:20:19.202+03:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: 6 Robot Street Performers That Refused To Break Character For A Fucking Second And Tell Me If They Had Seen My Son;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3428/7/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1526;14c6c2e55d812e38604cb25cb408e236f5709b51;0;;2016-10-26T23:09:00.000+03:00;News: Doing Its Part: The NBA Is Housing Syrian Refugees On Whichever Half Of The Court Isn‚Äôt Being Played On;"Email
Whether or not you‚Äôre a basketball fan
column2: you‚Äôre going to love this story about a bold new humanitarian initiative from the NBA. In order to help alleviate the refugee crisis in Europe
column3: the league is housing Syrian refugees on whichever half of the court isn‚Äôt being played on during the game.

column1: Now that‚Äôs making a difference. Way to go
column2: NBA!

column1: Since the Syrian civil war began in 2011
column2: millions of Syrians have been displaced. But thanks to the generosity of the NBA
column3: some of them will now find a new home right around the three-point line on the half of the court that isn‚Äôt being played on at that time. While players occupy one half of the court
column4: Syrian refugees will have a safe and welcoming space on the other half to reassemble their lives until the ball changes possession and they are shuttled to the opposite end.

column1: Wow. What a beautiful gesture from the NBA! With 29 courts across the country and 82 games in the 2016-2017 season
column2: the league is set to provide housing that periodically oscillates from one half of the court to the other for several thousand Syrian refugees. This is huge.

column1: In contrast to Europe‚Äôs notoriously overcrowded refugee camps
column2: the NBA‚Äôs half courts are big enough to comfortably house at least five families around the perimeter and one or two in the paint. The refugees also have access to any snack vendors who happen to be milling about the crowd near whichever half of the court they‚Äôre on at the time.

column1: Of course
column2: it‚Äôs a new program
column3: and it‚Äôs not perfect. There have been several incidents in which refugees have collided with players after failing to get to the other half of the court in time
column4: and last night an 8-year-old Syrian girl had to be treated for minor injuries after LeBron James dunked on her during a fast break.

column1: Still
column2: according to NBA commissioner Adam Silver
column3: the program is a huge step up from the refugee camps abroad.

column1: ‚ÄúThe Syrian refugee crisis is only getting worse. Meanwhile
column2: we‚Äôve got this half of the court that isn‚Äôt being played on just collecting dust waiting to be put to good use
column3: ‚Äù said Silver
column4: adding that he felt the league had a moral responsibility to harbor the refugees. ‚ÄúIf we can help these people by sheltering them on one side of the court until there‚Äôs a change in possession and then sheltering them on the other half as soon as there‚Äôs a change in possession and then sheltering them on the other half until there‚Äôs a change in possession
column5: then we have an obligation to do that.‚Äù

column1: It‚Äôs refreshing to see a major organization like the NBA reaching out to a group of people who so desperately need our help right now. Faith in humanity restored!";english;2016-10-27T09:20:19.319+03:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;News: Doing Its Part: The NBA Is Housing Syrian Refugees On Whichever Half Of The Court Isn‚Äôt Being Played On;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3428/5/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire
1527;c9271ae36f70c45e52ca9cac3dbc7cffca25b648;0;;2016-10-26T20:55:00.000+03:00;Debunked: The Photo Of Obama With A Speech Balloo... | ClickHole;"Email
In an age where information can be spread to millions of people within seconds
column2: it‚Äôs often difficult to separate fact from fiction. That was certainly the case a few months ago when a controversial photo of President Obama began to circulate online
column3: with many insisting that the image was the real
column4: unedited deal. But today that picture was officially debunked: The photo of Obama with a speech balloon saying ‚ÄúIslam is my main thing‚Äù has been proven to be doctored.

column1: Wow. This is a good reminder to take everything you see on the internet with a grain of salt!
Take a look at the photo in question above. In it
column2: you can clearly see Obama proudly declaring his unshakeable Islamic faith.

column1: At first glance
column2: the photo looks like pretty clear evidence that Obama may be Muslim and confirms the suspicions of his most far-right critics
column3: who insist the president has been dishonest with the public about his true religious beliefs. But when the image went viral on Twitter
column4: one user pointed out a possible sign of doctoring:

column1: Many users agreed that the photo appeared to have been manipulated in some way and asked for an expert to weigh in. A graphic designer named Brendan McCann
column2: whose Twitter bio says he‚Äôs been in the industry for over a decade
column3: quickly answered the call.

column1: But it was Snopes that officially put the matter to rest. After scouring the internet far and wide
column2: they were able to dig up the original version of the photograph
column3: taken during one of the president‚Äôs official White House photo ops
column4: and there‚Äôs no speech balloon upholding the teachings of the Quran anywhere in sight.

column1: Take a look at the two images side by side to see how the effect was achieved:
Well
column2: there you have it. It looks like whoever made this image took some of the space from above the president‚Äôs head and used it to overlay the speech balloon on top. It‚Äôs a powerful effect
column3: but it‚Äôs definitely not real. Remember: When it comes to the internet
column4: always question your sources! ";english;2016-10-27T19:43:07.659+03:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Debunked: The Photo Of Obama With A Speech Balloo... | ClickHole;0.011000000000000001;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3429/4/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1529;c89f7a02045948641ef3b4c7b82eeb03f9d2e86e;0;;2016-10-28T00:09:00.000+03:00;Life: 5 New Emojis Apple Created Specifically To Shame Me For The Time I Backed My Car Into The Public Swimming Pool;"Apple is very cruel to taunt me about driving into a pool. I was already deeply embarrassed
column2: and these new iPhone emojis are just salt in the wound. 1. My Car Falling Into The Pool

column1: The swimming pool near my house closes after the summer
column2: so I decided to have one last splash in late September. It was a little cold to go swimming
column3: but I didn‚Äôt want to miss out on the fun of the pool. Despite the chilly weather
column4: I had a great experience
column5: at least until it was time to head to my car and drive home. Leaving the parking space
column6: I accidentally went backwards and drove my Honda right through a chain-link fence and into the pool. I can‚Äôt excuse this dumb mistake
column7: but in my defense I was still soaking wet and shivering
column8: and that distracted me from driving. When Apple released this emoji of my car going into the pool
column9: I was mostly curious why they had singled my situation out for an update
column10: but I have to admit I kind of deserved it. 2. Me In My Flooding Car

column1: I have always been a loyal customer of Apple‚Äôs technology products
column2: which makes this second emoji feel like a betrayal. The first emoji of my car falling into the pool was perhaps deserved
column3: because I was extremely clumsy and foolish
column4: but a second emoji at my expense was completely uncalled-for. Worst of all
column5: this emoji has now been embraced by teens to represent bad sex
column6: and they tweet messages like ‚Äúmy Tinder date went well but [EMOJI] FML.‚Äù I am uncomfortable having my face seen by millions of people in this context. 3. The Lifeguard Calling Me A Dunce

column1: I am furious with this emoji because it is inaccurate as well as cruel. Unlike Apple
column2: the lifeguard was nothing but polite as he helped me crawl out of my underwater car‚Äôs window
column3: and at no point did he call me a dunce. The lifeguard did ask
column4: ‚ÄúWhat the hell happened?‚Äù and I could tell he thought I was dumb
column5: but he did not say the word ‚Äúdunce‚Äù or any other insult. Not even once. If Apple wants to taunt me with their emojis
column6: they can at least depict things as they actually occurred. 4. The Words ‚ÄúWet Idiot‚Äù Beneath Me As I Swim Out Of The Pool

column1: Doesn‚Äôt Apple know I already feel bad enough about swimming across a pool in my street clothes? All the other swimmers had already evacuated the pool and were watching me with judgmental eyes as I flailed through the water in jeans and a polo T-shirt. My sneakers got completely soaked and still smell mildewy weeks after drying out. This humiliation is only mitigated by the fact that the wet-idiot emoji is now extremely popular among iPhone users in China
column2: and millions of Chinese people use it in text messages to represent amazing sex. But still
column3: I wish Apple had elected not to release any of these. 5. Me On The Bicycle I Must Ride Now That My Car Is Ruined

column1: Under normal circumstances
column2: I would be thrilled and honored to have Apple turn my bicycle into an emoji. However
column3: given the timing
column4: it seems like Apple is poking fun at the fact that now this bicycle is my only mode of transportation. Perhaps losing a car to a swimming pool isn‚Äôt a big deal to a rich company like Apple
column5: but to normal folks like me
column6: a Honda is a major investment and I cannot afford to replace it at this time. What stings worst of all is that I find this emoji very handy
column7: and I frequently text it to people to tell them I‚Äôm on my way. Unfortunately
column8: despite Apple‚Äôs cruel mission to shame me
column9: I find my iPhone too useful to stop using.";english;2016-10-28T07:36:37.979+03:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: 5 New Emojis Apple Created Specifically To Shame Me For The Time I Backed My Car Into The Public Swimming Pool;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3430/1/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1544;ae77b87f7b49c61976eecd8454518b651712dd4e;0;;2016-11-01T18:37:32.022+02:00;Life: 7 Incredible Animal Mating Rituals;"7 Incredible Animal Mating Rituals Posted today Email You know the birds and the bees. What about the rest? Here are seven mating rituals that showcase nature in all its complexity and beauty.
Orangutans: Orangutans are among a special group of animals with mating rituals based around the lunar cycle
column2: meaning that whenever a full moon is in the sky
column3: male orangutans will climb the tallest tree and try to have sex with the moon
column4: only settling for a female orangutan once they grow tired of stretching their penises outward so they might touch the moon with it.

column1: Armadillos: In the ‚ÄúArmadillo‚Äôs song
column2: ‚Äù the male armadillo‚Äôs penis makes an annoying high-pitched whirring sound until a female armadillo is so annoyed by it that she silences it by having sex with him.

column1: Alligators: During mating season
column2: male alligators stand upright and walk around on their hind legs and place their arms on their hips and sometimes even ride bikes until a female alligator gets horny from watching them.

column1: Beavers: The male beaver and female beaver each recite a fun fact about beavers
column2: taking a step closer to one another as they do so. At some point
column3: they get so close that they‚Äôre actually mating.

column1: Elephants: Before having sex
column2: the female elephant will coat her male partner in sticky
column3: boiling hot Pepsi that only comes out of her trunk when she‚Äôs ‚Äúin the mood.‚Äù

column1: Iguanas: When it is time for iguanas to mate
column2: the male iguana climbs on top of a female fox and the female iguana climbs on top of a male fox. The two iguanas ride their foxes straight at each other at full speed
column3: and when the foxes collide with each other
column4: the iguanas are flung forward and collide in midair. As they fly through the air
column5: the male iguana impregnates the female iguana
column6: who sprays eggs in all directions as she hurtles haphazardly toward the sky. When the mating ritual is complete
column7: both iguanas hit the ground and die.

column1: Bonobos: The male bonobo spends a full year trying to work up the courage to ask for a kiss. If he is rejected or the kiss isn‚Äôt that good
column2: he will crawl up a tree and scream at God for giving him such good lips for kissing but no one to share them with.";english;2016-11-01T18:37:32.022+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: 7 Incredible Animal Mating Rituals;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3436/3/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;85;0;85;satire

column1: 1545;691ed941b7a08a6982623971259a014cb4460a5c;0;;2016-11-01T18:37:32.630+02:00;News: Incredibly Selfish: The City Of Chicago Wants Its Baseball Team To Win The World Series Even Though It Already Has A Bunch Of Movie Theaters And A Zoo;"Email
If you want to see the full depths of human greed
column2: look no further than the city of Chicago. This week
column3: the residents of this selfish city are marching through the streets rooting for their hometown baseball team
column4: the Chicago Cubs
column5: to win the World Series. Yep
column6: you heard that right. The citizens of Chicago want their baseball team to win the World Series even though their city already has a bunch of movie theaters and a zoo.

column1: Some people just want more and more and more.

The endless selfishness on display here is just sickening. Apparently having dozens of movie theaters and a whole zoo to enjoy isn‚Äôt enough for the pleasure gluttons of Chicago. They need a big honking World Series victory
column2: too.

column1: We‚Äôll give you a minute to try to wrap your head around the sheer unbridled avarice of these people. All you have to do is Google ‚ÄúMovie Theaters Chicago
column2: ‚Äù and you‚Äôll be flooded with the names and addresses of cinemas all over the city playing both mainstream blockbusters and art house gems
column3: which the people of Chicago can go to whenever they want. And when they aren‚Äôt in the mood for a movie
column4: these spoiled brats can go see exotic creatures from all over the world at the Lincoln Park Zoo. But apparently that‚Äôs not enough to satisfy these unhinged hedonists. No
column5: they need a gigantic parade for the Chicago Cubs cutting right through the middle of their city. They need fountains of champagne and a picture of Anthony Rizzo celebrating on the front page of every major newspaper in the country.

column1: Hey
column2: Chicago! Maybe if the Cubs win the World Series someone will make a movie about it
column3: and you can go watch it in whichever one of the goddamn dozens of fucking movie theaters in your charmed little city is closest to your house. And then when the movie about your world champion baseball team is over
column4: you can go talk about it while you look at the majestic lowland gorillas that live at your fully functioning goddamn zoo. If you aren‚Äôt sickened by what you see in the mirror
column5: Chicago
column6: it‚Äôs because greed has warped your minds.

column1: Some people are just never content
column2: no matter how many blessings life serves to them on a silver platter. Apparently the people in Chicago will not be satisfied unless their brains are gushing dopamine in all directions at all times. They have so many movie theaters. They have a zoo. And yet they won‚Äôt be happy until the fucking president of the United States is personally congratulating them for having the best baseball team in the world. Where do they get the gall to desire a World Series victory amid their cornucopia of movie theaters and their zoo? It‚Äôs disgusting. Nothing is ever enough for Chicago.

column1: 1553;65f40204f704e559947d57e7b4c171d6a4d4fb97;0;;2016-11-03T00:40:00.000+02:00;Life: When This Middle School Introduced Meditation Into The School Day
column2: Many Of Its Students Saw Incredible Benefits And Three Went Insane;"Email

column1: Meditation is some pretty awesome stuff
column2: and the practice is finding its way into more and more lives every day. Now a program at Cedar Creek Middle School in Portland
column3: ME is proving that meditation can have a major impact. By meditating just 15 minutes a day
column4: nearly all of the kids in the program have seen lower stress levels and higher test scores
column5: and three of them have gone absolutely insane.

column1: What a remarkable result!
The program
column2: called Mindful Kids
column3: encourages students to sit silently in a darkened classroom for 15 minutes a day and listen to white noise. Six weeks in
column4: the effects were already striking: Most of the students had noticeably improved behavior and were more engaged in their schoolwork
column5: and three of them had pulled out all of their hair and created their own language that they speak through their nostrils.

column1: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs astounding
column2: ‚Äù said Colin Creedman
column3: the teacher who started the program. ‚ÄúWe expected the meditation to cause some improvement
column4: but we didn‚Äôt plan on it having such a big impact. ‚ÄòC‚Äô students became ‚ÄòA‚Äô students. There have been no fights. Three of them started worshipping a Bunsen burner as their god. And they‚Äôre much more focused in class. Anyone who‚Äôs skeptical of the effectiveness of meditation really needs to meet these kids.‚Äù

column1: The students in the program have noticed some big differences
column2: too. ‚ÄúI feel more calm
column3: ‚Äù said 11-year-old Melissa Hogseth. ‚ÄúNot just during the meditation
column4: but throughout the day. I think it‚Äôs great for kids to meditate.‚Äù

column1: Ten-year-old Jason Woodward says he also has benefited from meditating: ‚ÄúMy blood has become pure mercury. I can absorb shadows now. Meditation has helped me focus my energy into a beam that can cut glass and
column2: soon
column3: flesh and bone.‚Äù

column1: Unbelievable! The brain is an amazing thing
column2: and these kids prove that meditation can unlock its full potential and sometimes make it go batshit insane. Way to go
column3: Cedar Creek Middle School!";english;2016-11-03T09:50:11.194+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: When This Middle School Introduced Meditation Into The School Day

column1: 1555;8d23309f28844c876cf8b6f40eacc354340065be;0;;2016-11-02T21:15:00.000+02:00;Life: Life Of Luxury: Elton John‚Äôs 6 Favorite Shark Pictures To Stare At During Long
column2: Transcontinental Flights;"Ever wonder how Britain‚Äôs most iconic pop pianist gets through a long flight? Here are the six pictures of sharks Sir Elton John likes to stare at to pass the time on an airplane. 1. A Shark Swimming

column1: Sit next to Elton John on a flight and you‚Äôll see a man living in the lap of luxury
column2: as he immediately tapes this photo of a shark darting through the ocean over his window to stare at throughout the trip. The platinum-selling artist has been known to pull his window shade down to make the shark disappear
column3: and then quickly retract it to mark the animal‚Äôs triumphant return. He will often repeat this act dozens of times per flight. 2. A Great White Shark Leaping Into The Air

column1: When you‚Äôre an international pop sensation worth an estimated $450 million
column2: people go the extra mile to make you happy. Flight crews are instructed to place this photo of a breaching great white in Elton John‚Äôs seat-back pocket before he even boards the plane. The five-time Grammy winner loves to pull the image out at his leisure to stare at while flying
column3: sometimes holding it a mere 3-to-4 inches away from his face while he fixates upon the shark‚Äôs beady eyes. 3. A Shark On The Prowl

column1: Rumor has it Elton John first acquired this shark photo in 1997
column2: just before flying to London to perform ‚ÄúCandle In The Wind‚Äù at Princess Diana‚Äôs funeral. It‚Äôs been a staple of his travel routine ever since. Those who have flown with the music legend say that Sir Elton turns on every single overhead light in his row to study this picture with a magnifying glass. 4. Two Hammerhead Sharks

column1: How does the man behind ‚ÄúTiny Dancer‚Äù and ‚ÄúRocket Man‚Äù handle turbulence as his plane traverses the Atlantic? Once that ‚ÄúFasten Seat Belts‚Äù sign lights up
column2: this picture of two hammerhead sharks comes out. Elton John holds the photo in a tight vice grip and stares straight at it until the turbulence passes
column3: often without blinking for minutes at a time. 5. The Poster For Jaws

column1: Sir Elton John absolutely adores the poster for Steven Spielberg‚Äôs Jaws and hopes to one day see the film. In the meantime
column2: the British icon makes do by slowly unfolding his 24-by-36-inch copy of the poster whenever he‚Äôs on a long flight
column3: gently tracing the shark‚Äôs teeth with his finger as he stares lovingly into its gaping mouth. 6. Pilot‚Äôs Choice

column1: As much as Elton relishes in the calming regularity of his shark picture rotation
column2: he also loves the excitement of gazing upon a totally unexpected shark when flying from London to a distant corner of Europe. That‚Äôs why all pilots who fly Sir Elton print out a shark picture of their choice from their home computers before going to the airport
column3: and hand it to the visibly excited musician prior to takeoff. So yeah‚Äîit‚Äôs good to be Elton!";english;2016-11-03T09:50:11.327+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: Life Of Luxury: Elton John‚Äôs 6 Favorite Shark Pictures To Stare At During Long
column4: Transcontinental Flights;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3437/3/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;470;0;470;satire

column1: 1556;44eaab3822f2643caa15965a411eaa7666a85f72;0;;2016-11-02T21:07:00.000+02:00;Life: Touching: After Her Brother Passed Away
column2: This Woman Took Over His Facebook Page To Continue Sharing Islamophobic Rhetoric;"Email

column1: For friends and family who loved him dearly
column2: the death of Robert Harkin in early August was sudden and unexpected. But despite their sadness
column3: they can take comfort in knowing that his legacy will live on. His sister Karen has taken over his Facebook page and honors her brother by continuing to share Islamophobic rhetoric in his memory.

column1: Absolutely beautiful.
They rarely chose to talk about politics while he was alive
column2: but Karen has been able to reconnect with her brother since his death by discovering his fear and hatred of Islam. It‚Äôs been a steep learning curve
column3: but in time she‚Äôs been able to understand so much about what he cared about most
column4: and she now feels closer to him than ever. The threat Syrian refugees pose to our freedom
column5: the politicians who willingly turn a blind eye to the rising threat of Islamic terrorism‚Äîall of the bigoted beliefs that made Robert who he was.

column1: Since picking up the mantle of his Facebook account
column2: Karen has committed to maintaining the xenophobia that exemplified her brother‚Äôs life. When Time magazine ran a story about a Muslim woman who felt unsafe in America
column3: Karen understood right away that Robert would want to share the article with the comment ‚ÄúMaybe she‚Äôd feel more safe if she moved to Saudia Arabia where she can practice Sharia Law with the rest of them.‚Äù Sometimes a sister just knows.

column1: For those who were close to Robert
column2: seeing a backwards

column7: I look at these cases
column8: and I can‚Äôt help but worry for my children. In times like these
column9: we must take a stand
column10: and we must teach our sons that being brought to trial and then convicted of rape is simply
column11: utterly wrong.

column1: Our children
column2: and more specifically
column3: our boys
column4: need to know that they should never
column5: under any circumstances
column6: be put in a situation where they could potentially lose a case accusing them of sexual assault. My son knows that
column7: and every parent should make an effort to teach their boys the same.

column1: Whether they made the vile
column2: unforgivable mistake of having a bad lawyer
column3: calling an unreliable witness
column4: or openly admitting to their crime to an undecided jury
column5: America‚Äôs youth must understand that being convicted of rape should never
column6: ever happen. Going to court for sexual assault is one thing
column7: but being declared guilty is quite another
column8: and as responsible parents
column9: we need to do everything in our power to ensure that no child crosses that line
column10: no questions asked.

column1: Bottom line
column2: we need to do a better job at showing our sons that there is no worse mistake a young man can make than being declared guilty of rape
column3: not now
column4: not ever.

column1: I don‚Äôt care who you are‚Äîif you have a son
column2: you need to teach him that being convicted of rape
column3: even just one time
column4: is unforgivable. The truth is
column5: the moment your boy loses a rape trial is the moment that lives are ruined
column6: and there‚Äôs absolutely no taking that back.

column1: As a father of a young man myself
column2: I would not be able to live with myself if he someday went to jail just because of something as easily preventable as a sexual assault conviction. When I look into my 8-year-old Callum‚Äôs eyes
column3: the last thing I want to think about is my little guy becoming the type of man who can‚Äôt somehow weasel his way out of a high-profile court case
column4: in front of all his friends
column5: family
column6: and the public at large.

column1: Bottom line
column2: we need to do a better job at showing our sons that there is no worse mistake a young man can make than being declared guilty of rape
column3: not now
column4: not ever. Because if we want this generation of boys to grow into men that we truly take pride in
column5: we have to start teaching them that any young man who gets punished for rape brings shame not only to himself but also to his gender
column6: and this country as a whole.

column1: So please
column2: don‚Äôt wait. Please talk to your son today about his responsibility to never be convicted of rape
column3: and to speak up if he ever sees someone else in danger of being convicted of rape. Our future depends on it.";english;2016-11-05T01:09:27.704+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Blog: We Need To Teach Our Sons That Being Convicted Of Rape Is Wrong;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3440/4/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: Well

column1: Most people think of Costco as the place that sells bulk quantities of pretty much everything. But the warehouse superstore is now making headlines for a very different reason

column3: GA and are currently stuck flying around inside the discount retailer.

column1: The Blue Angels were performing at a routine air show in Augusta
column2: GA earlier today when they veered too close to the Costco and zipped through the automatic doors as they slid open for a customer. Before Costco employees could react
column3: the diamond formation of five F/A-18 Hornets had entered the store and began performing death-defying aerial feats right over the shelves of bulk cereals and jumbo-size ketchups.

column1: Customers are trying to ignore the roaring jets overhead

column3: but inside Costco
column4: the elite pilots are proving to be a serious nuisance.

column2: Costco staff just propped the front door open with a bucket
column3: assuming the Blue Angels would find their way back out eventually. After an hour

With the store set to close in only a few hours

column1: Grab a box of tissues

column1: Two years ago

column3: Sophie
column4: who was just starting to forge her path in life. That‚Äôs when this amazing uncle decided to step up in a seriously inspiring way: With Robert no longer there for her
column5: John took it upon himself to discourage his niece‚Äôs art career.

column2: is someone cutting onions in here? Because we‚Äôre getting just a little bit teary.

column1: Ever since his brother‚Äôs passing

column4: and how unstable a career in the arts can be compared to more traditional nine-to-five employment. Sophie‚Äôs true passion in life has always been drawing and painting
column5: but thanks to her selfless uncle‚Äôs constant reminders that almost nobody actually ends up working their dream job
column6: she‚Äôs now just two years away from getting her BA in marketing!

column1: ‚ÄúI want Sophie to know that she can always depend on me

column4: especially in a field as oversaturated and undervalued as the arts. She‚Äôs way too smart for that.‚Äù

column2: when Sophie landed an internship at a Brooklyn art gallery
column3: John spent countless hours reminding her that New York is expensive
column4: dangerous
column5: and very far away from Ohio
column6: before ultimately finding her a job doing administrative work for his friend instead. And when Sophie briefly considered getting a double major in studio art
column7: her uncle pulled out all the stops
column8: even going so far as to gain control of her late father‚Äôs finances so that he could temporarily withhold the semester‚Äôs tuition check until she changed her mind!

column1: Incredible! Is there an Uncle of the Year award? Because this guy definitely just won it.
While nobody can ever take the place of Sophie‚Äôs father
column2: it is seriously heartwarming to see John step up to the plate like this. Sophie is so lucky to have an uncle she can always turn to for love
column3: guidance
column4: and stacks of brochures for MBA programs handed to her at every family holiday. Here‚Äôs to you

column1: 1576;1a8332f6b00c3dea2a865495d7aaa3be7f26e685;0;;2016-11-09T00:24:44.205+02:00;News: Democracy Win: Volunteers Across The Country Are Oiling Up The Sidewalks To Help Voters Slide Uncontrollably To Their Polling Place;"Email
Despite the fact that voting is the cornerstone of our democracy
column2: only 60 percent of eligible voters turn out in a presidential election. But this year we may see that number spike
column3: because groups of incredible volunteers are doing everything they can to get out the vote: They‚Äôre hitting the road and oiling up the sidewalks to help voters slide uncontrollably to their polling places.

column1: Democracy FTW!
You might not know their names
column2: but these hardworking men and women are out there in the trenches from Maine to California
column3: slathering thick
column4: black oil on the ground so every American can skid down the road
column5: windmilling their arms wildly to try and stay upright
column6: and careen straight through the doors of a voting booth. Republican or Democrat
column7: these patriotic volunteers want every American to have access to a frictionless slick of oil that leads right to a polling place.

column1: Yes! These incredible volunteers are absolutely killing it!

column5: until they crash face-first into a registered polling location.

column1: We might live in a democracy
column2: but we wouldn‚Äôt have a truly representative election without the help of a select few everyday heroes. So when the polling stations close and every last slippery
column3: oil-covered voter has put their ballot in the box and slid back out the door

column1: 1577;ade819eb7f96758e67b015361882dd6280c3e4f6;0;;2016-11-09T00:24:44.324+02:00;Life: The Power Of Unity: This Trump Supporter And Clinton Supporter Held Each Other‚Äôs Hair While Vomiting Out Of Election Anxiety;"Email
If this doesn‚Äôt prove what‚Äôs beautiful about America
column2: we don‚Äôt know what does.

column1: Politically
column2: Sarah Goodwin and Colleen Cassidy agree on almost nothing. They vehemently oppose the other‚Äôs candidate of choice and couldn‚Äôt differ more on the direction our country should be heading in. Yet
column3: as this heatedly divisive election cycle comes to a head
column4: these two demonstrated just how powerful a united American people can be when we put our differences aside and work together: Sarah
column5: a Trump supporter
column6: and Colleen
column7: a Clinton supporter
column8: held each other‚Äôs hair back while vomiting out of intense election anxiety.

column1: In a campaign season as contentious as this one
column2: you really have to stop and appreciate moments like this.

column1: Though Sarah and Colleen come from opposite ends of the political spectrum
column2: you wouldn‚Äôt know it when looking into the stall at their polling station in Cranford
column3: NJ
column4: where they both lowered their heads into the same trash can and took turns holding each other‚Äôs hair back as they retched over the psychological toll this long
column5: strenuous election‚Äôs taken on them. No arguing
column6: no finger-pointing
column7: no name-calling: just dual streams of stress-induced upchuck crescendoing in a duet of dry-heaving. The sight of two people
column8: who have been bombarded for months with messages that the other candidate will completely ruin the country as they know it
column9: patting one another on the back and encouraging each other to get it all out
column10: is all too welcome in an otherwise toxic and polarizing campaign season.

column1: Need more proof that it‚Äôs possible for Trump and Clinton supporters to overcome their shared animosity during this historical moment of anxiety? Colleen even offered Sarah an Altoid once they‚Äôd both stopped throwing up and cleaned the barf from their shirts. Further
column2: Sarah graciously let Colleen borrow her eyeliner
column3: which had been smudged due to the tears summoned by a panic attack she experienced while in line to vote. After checking in to make sure the other was feeling all right one last time
column4: each went their separate ways
column5: having found rare common ground with their political opposites in the form of sickening anxiety stoked by the intense fear politics and extremist partisan rhetoric deployed in the 2016 election.

column1: Yup
column2: the spirit of Abraham Lincoln is alive
column3: knitting a torn nation back together.

column1: Look at the media and you‚Äôll see interactions between Trump and Clinton supporters portrayed as vitriolic and irreconcilably at odds. But in reality
column2: you‚Äôll find two human beings offering each other their sleeves to wipe the sick from their mouths before they head back out there to get this goddamn fucking thing over with
column3: and that‚Äôs worth celebrating.";english;2016-11-09T00:24:44.324+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;Life: The Power Of Unity: This Trump Supporter And Clinton Supporter Held Each Other‚Äôs Hair While Vomiting Out Of Election Anxiety;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3445/9/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;0;0;0;satire

column1: 1579;63f3dae2892dba4b815dd83294df8f84959e10cd;0;;2016-11-09T01:21:03.736+02:00;News: Inspiring: When This Woman Was Feeling Too Lazy To Vote

column1: Well
column2: if this doesn‚Äôt inspire you to do your civic duty
column3: nothing will!

column1: When California resident Candice Payne woke up this morning
column2: she wasn‚Äôt totally sure she was up to going through the hassle of voting. She figured the lines would be long
column3: the wait would be awful
column4: and the stress probably wouldn‚Äôt be worth it. But just when this 26-year-old woman was feeling too lazy to vote
column5: something absolutely amazing happened‚Äîher ovaries burst out of her body and dragged her to the polling place.

column1: Amazing! Now THAT is how you rally on Election Day!
Like so many Americans
column2: Candice spent her morning lying in her bed
column3: kicking herself for not having voted early
column4: but as soon as it seemed like she‚Äôd go back to sleep
column5: her fallopian tubes shot out of her abdomen
column6: curled themselves around the side of her bed
column7: and threw her to the floor. After dragging her body to her living room
column8: her helpful ovaries crawled up to the doorknob and jostled the front door open. What started out as a lazy morning ended with her ovaries anchoring themselves to the floor and pulling the rest of her body to a polling place at nearby Jefferson Public School
column9: where she dutifully filled out her ballot for President of the United States!

column1: If that‚Äôs not getting out the vote
column2: we don‚Äôt know what is! It‚Äôs definitely easy to come up with a million excuses to avoid the polls

With millions of eyes watching CNN for election results tonight
column2: the network really couldn‚Äôt afford any high-profile screwups. But unfortunately
column3: that‚Äôs exactly what they got when John King tapped his touchscreen electoral map too hard and plunged himself straight into a digital hellscape from which there seems to be no escape.

column1: Ouch. That‚Äôs some major egg on CNN‚Äôs face!
The night appeared to be going smoothly in the network‚Äôs Washington studio
column2: until King tried to zoom in on a breakdown map of crucial Ohio swing districts. When the map seemed to freeze up
column3: a frustrated King tapped the Magic Wall with enough force that his whole arm plunged through the suddenly fluid surface of the screen. Before Wolf Blitzer or Anderson Cooper could step in
column4: he had been fully engulfed in a vast virtual expanse of colorful
column5: swirling data.

column1: With millions of Americans tuning in to watch the results of this historic election
column2: CNN has been forced to press on even as they try to free John King from the computerized map. A noticeably emotional Wolf Blitzer mouthed the words ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù to his imprisoned colleague before tapping the board to call up a gender breakdown of likely Oregon voters
column3: the bar graph of which animated right into John King‚Äôs spine
column4: launching nearly all the way to the mid-Atlantic states. If CNN producers thought that they had stabilized the situation by urging King to take refuge in the bottom corner of the screen
column5: it did not take long for them to realize how wrong they were. When Connecticut was called for Hillary Clinton
column6: the trapped John King was also turned entirely blue and let loose a horrible scream as if he were being burned alive. This level of panic was matched moments later when King tried to fend off a ravenous piece of malware with just his loafer
column7: only for the shoe to shatter into pixels that the code devoured.

column1: Yikes. CNN will be wondering for a while how this all went so wrong
column2: and on their biggest night
column3: too.

column1: With plenty of states left to declare tonight
column2: there‚Äôs still time for King to be rescued from the computerized nightmare. But with uploading a JPEG of a ladder for him to climb up and trying to shepherd him onto a thumb drive having already failed to return King to the studio
column3: CNN may be running out of options.

column1: No matter how this shakes out
column2: it‚Äôs clear CNN has a MAJOR technology fail on their hands. Then again
column3: this is just what happens when anchors play with tech toys without reading the instructions. Well
column4: better luck in 2020

column2: American companies are trying to make sense of how to react to a Trump presidential election win. But one major company has clearly made up its mind and just came down squarely in the anti-Trump camp in a big way: Donald Trump will be added to Disney‚Äôs Hall Of Presidents
column3: but his animatronic figure will be able to feel pain.

column1: Wow. Disney just showed that it does not pull punches when it comes to what the company believes in. Check out the press release they put out this morning:
‚ÄúDisney prides itself on promoting inclusivity
column2: empathy

column5: crying
column6: screaming
column7: vomiting
column8: or a mix of all of these.

column1: If that doesn‚Äôt send a powerful statement about where Disney stands politically
column2: we don‚Äôt know what does.

column2: They Kept Feeding Him More And More Lunches Until He Clogged The Door And Got School Canceled;"Email

column1: Life can be tough
column2: but students at Willow Creek Elementary School in Duluth
column3: Minnesota
column4: have done something this year that will make you cry tears of joy: When they noticed that a fellow student wasn‚Äôt eating lunch at school
column5: they brought him so many lunches that he clogged the door and school got canceled.

column1: Compassion for the win!
When caring students saw that 9-year-old Bryce Oswald was showing up to school every day without a lunch
column2: they knew they had to do something. They started giving Bryce fruit snacks and pats of butter from their lunches
column3: and even pooled their allowances to buy Bryce hoagies and rotisserie chickens in an effort to make sure that he wouldn‚Äôt go hungry and would instead get massive enough to clog the door to the school and get school canceled.

column1: ‚ÄúBryce didn‚Äôt have anything to eat
column2: so we knew we had to help him out
column3: ‚Äù said Willow Creek student Kali Summers. ‚ÄúWe gave him our lunches every day
column4: even if we got really hungry. We knew if he kept eating he would get fat enough to clog up the door and we wouldn‚Äôt have to go to school.‚Äù

column1: The plan worked perfectly. In a matter of months
column2: Bryce went from having no lunch at all to having so many lunches that he packed on 115 pounds
column3: got stuck in the door
column4: and school got canceled. The students were so successful in plumping Bryce up that it took four firefighters with a jackhammer to finally be able to pry him out.

column1: Mission accomplished!
Due to these kids‚Äô selfless dedication
column2: not only did Bryce not go hungry
column3: but all of the kids and teachers were able to stay home from school to play
column4: watch TV
column5: and relax instead of going to school for a full two days. They aren‚Äôt stopping there
column6: either: Even though Bryce is now bigger than any other student in the district
column7: the kids are going to continue to give him lunches in hopes that he can get stuck in the door so tightly that school gets canceled for a full week.

column1: 1602;3bfd732dd0f9b8d09d02f71746a35f35b3f3a37b;0;;2016-11-15T18:16:59.191+02:00;Life: Animal Rights Win: The San Diego Zoo Has Taped Telescopes To All Of Their Animals‚Äô Heads So That They Can Look At The Planets;"Email
No matter how you feel about zoos
column2: this story will make you feel good.

column1: Zoo administrators are always experimenting with ways to make their animals‚Äô caged experiences as accommodating to their needs as possible
column2: with varying degrees of success. But thanks to an innovative and humane new initiative
column3: one of our most beloved institutions is setting a new standard for animal rights. The San Diego Zoo has taped telescopes to all of their animals‚Äô heads so that they can look at the planets.

column1: What a tremendous step forward!
For decades
column2: the San Diego Zoo led the way in terms of tourist attractions
column3: but this latest move proves that they are even more committed to treating their animals with dignity. With a telescope affixed to each animal‚Äôs head
column4: these incredible creatures can now gaze at the planets just by looking up. Visitors can take great comfort knowing that the ostriches
column5: chinchillas
column6: and all other animals are no longer limited to just looking at trees
column7: dirt
column8: or clouds
column9: as they had been for so many heartbreaking years.

column1: According to president and CEO Douglas Myers
column2: the project directly addresses a basic right of all animals.

column1: ‚ÄúWhen you consider the challenges we face when improving animal captivity
column2: strapping a telescope snugly to each animal‚Äôs head is a no-brainer
column3: ‚Äù said Myers. ‚ÄúThese are beautiful creatures that deserve to look at the planets.‚Äù

column1: Indeed

column3: but in San Diego it‚Äôs now a key part of every animal‚Äôs care plan. At any moment
column4: an otter can swivel his head and take a look at Saturn. A zebra can glance up from grazing to observe a sea of constellations seemingly close enough to lick. And when the park welcomed a new fox last month

column6: equipped with a polarized filter to protect his sensitive eyes.

column1: Wow!
Well

column3: you‚Äôve officially got it. Hopefully

column1: 1603;6db1d2dc07165691939c126c2d5b75600e462128;0;;2016-11-15T18:17:00.044+02:00;News: Office Of The Future: Researchers Predict That Over 50 Percent Of Workplace Discrimination Will Be Automated By 2040;"Email
Automation in the workplace can bring new levels of efficiency and employee happiness
column2: but it can also mean that human workers lose their jobs in favor of robotic replacements. No matter your stance on cutting-edge technology in the office
column3: there is no doubt that it‚Äôs a swiftly approaching reality. According to a new study released by Stanford University
column4: Americans can expect over 50 percent of all workplace discrimination to be fully automated by 2040.

column1: The future is coming
column2: and it‚Äôs coming fast.

column1: Thanks to recent advancements in computer intelligence and predictive analytics
column2: it may not be long before you see an automated machine in your office demoting female employees for becoming pregnant. Whether humiliating subordinates with unwanted sexual comments or automatically filtering out r√©sum√©s from people with Middle Eastern last names
column3: trends in technological development suggest that an increasingly computerized workforce will soon be enforcing inequality in office environments with far greater proficiency and cost-effectiveness than human labor.

column1: ‚ÄúPeople think that automated workplace discrimination is still far off in the future
column2: when truthfully it‚Äôs right around the corner
column3: ‚Äù said Stanford computer scientist Dr. Oliver Thorpe
column4: who spearheaded the new study. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre already at the point with facial recognition software where it can identify which genders and races should be passed up for leadership roles with far greater accuracy than humans
column5: and technologies like this are only getting better and cheaper by the day.‚Äù

column1: With intelligent algorithms becoming rapidly more sophisticated and capable
column2: virtually every industry can soon expect to begin replacing humans with machines that can oppress minorities
column3: senior citizens
column4: and other subjugated people groups with unprecedented efficiency and accuracy. Within 10 years
column5: market-available computers will have the ability to grossly neglect the needs of disabled workers and make them feel like burdens. Within 15 years
column6: roving automatons will travel about open-plan offices smacking female subordinates‚Äô buttocks with their carbon-fiber paddle attachments
column7: adeptly wielding their power in such a way as to avoid consequences.

column1: Some believe that machines will never be able to fully replicate the complexity and intuitiveness of human on-the-job prejudice
column2: but employers will likely be willing to sacrifice that human touch for the sake of their bottom line. Thorpe notes that maintaining a fucked-up culture of occupational disparity is expensive
column3: and as soon as companies realize that they can enlist semi-autonomous robots to mistreat their employees at a fraction of the cost
column4: they‚Äôll be lining up to install them in offices nationwide.

column1: Only time will tell whether or not the human workers who have so dutifully carried out discriminatory business practices for decades get laid off or reassigned
column2: but one thing is for sure: The American office is about to look way different.";english;2016-11-15T18:17:00.044+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;News: Office Of The Future: Researchers Predict That Over 50 Percent Of Workplace Discrimination Will Be Automated By 2040;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3463/4/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;520;0;520;satire

column2: So We‚Äôve Stretched His Face Out All Wide So Nobody Can Recognize It‚Äôs Him;"Email Several months ago we published a list of irreverent Photoshops depicting the then-presidential candidate Donald Trump as a bald man in several humiliating contexts. We understood that these images were a bit crass and promised to remove them if Trump were to win the election
column3: as a sign of respect for the office of the United States presidency. True to our word

column6: it seems to be stuck there. Though we cannot delete the bald Photoshops

column1: Now that the American electorate has chosen Donald Trump to lead our nation

column4: but until then

column1: Get ready for the most cringeworthy story you‚Äôre going to read all day.

column4: 000 Panasonic TVs abruptly ascended to heaven without warning.

The scandal broke early last night when 60
column2: 000 of the company‚Äôs popular DX802-model flat-screen TVs from all over the world silently lifted off of the ground and

column1: Yikes. Needless to say

column1: Wow. Panasonic definitely wishes it could rewind the clock on this one! Chances are

column1: We‚Äôve got to give credit where credit is due: At least Panasonic had the decency to admit that they let their customers down. The company has issued a public apology

column3: I would travel to Heaven and retrieve each and every one of these televisions. I would kill any angel who tried to stop me from carrying these TVs out of paradise and returning them to our loyal Panasonic customers on Earth. Even if I saw God sitting on one of our missing DX802 flat-screens
column4: I would shove the Lord off of the TV so that I could retrieve it for our customers. Unfortunately
column5: I do not have the power to travel to Heaven
column6: and so I am left with no choice but to resign my position.‚Äù

column1: Tsuga‚Äôs resignation is a nice gesture
column2: but it doesn‚Äôt bring back a swarm of televisions from heaven. Panasonic‚Äôs reputation has been severely tarnished by the rapturing of their televisions. Oh
column2: how the mighty have fallen.

column1: It‚Äôs always an embarrassing moment when a high-powered executive suffers a scandal that forces him or her to resign
column2: but it looks like yet another head honcho is about to step into that humiliating spotlight: After nearly a decade on the job
column3: the CEO of beans has officially stepped down following reports that there cannot be a CEO of beans.

column1: Yikes. Talk about a fall from grace.
Patrick Buckley was an ambitious leader as the CEO of beans
column2: often telling people that he was in charge of every single bean that came out of the dirt
column3: and even going so far as to print up business cards with ‚ÄúCEO of beans‚Äù listed right on the front. With beans being such a common staple of diets worldwide
column4: a man in Mr. Buckley‚Äôs position may have seemed poised to become one of the most powerful people in the food industry. But in the blink of an eye
column5: everything the executive had been working for came crashing down before him
column6: as reports began to circulate late last week that while bean manufacturers may have CEOs
column7: it‚Äôs impossible for beans in general to have a CEO of their own.

column1: ‚ÄúAfter a wonderful career at the helm of beans
column2: it has become apparent that there is no such thing as my job
column3: ‚Äù the scandalized CEO wrote in a brief statement to the press. ‚ÄúIn light of this news that my position
column4: and my former role as director of garbanzo
column5: do not exist
column6: it seems prudent that I step down immediately. I am proud of the work I have done for beans during my tenure
column7: and I look forward to continuing to prepare and eat beans in the future.‚Äù

column1: As of this morning
column2: the board of directors of beans has accepted Mr. Buckley‚Äôs resignation
column3: and then the members promptly stepped down themselves amidst reports that beans cannot have a board of directors
column4: either.

column1: Making matters worse
column2: the entire corporate structure of beans now finds itself crumbling from the top all the way down
column3: as an onslaught of new allegations indicate that beans
column4: as a relatively loose category of foods
column5: has never been and cannot be a staffable organization.

column1: Wow. It‚Äôs hard to imagine how Mr. Buckley will ever bounce back from such a disgrace
column2: but hopefully he learns an important lesson from all this. CEOs
column3: take note: Your mistakes will always come back to haunt you.";english;2016-11-17T09:35:12.758+02:00;clickhole.com;US;16425.0;News: Disgrace: The CEO Of Beans Has Stepped Down Amid Reports That There Can‚Äôt Be A CEO Of Beans;0.0;http://images.onionstatic.com/clickhole/3469/6/16x9/1200.jpg;0;0;20;0;20;satire
