column1: The quality of sleep has a great impact on one‚Äôs productivity. It will determine how effective and alert you will be throughout the next day. The importance of having a relaxing sleep to the body cannot be over-emphasized . It serves as a means to recharge the body and brain
column2: and give rest to all the vital organs of the body. It is important for the body‚Äôs general health and vitality.

column1: However
column2: the quality of sleep matters. Making your sleep deep
column3: relaxing and refreshing goes a long way to impact your health. Just as your body needs a good and balanced meal every day
column4: the body equally needs a deep and refreshing sleep. It is unfortunate however that deep sleep evades most people. The good news is that there are tricks that could be learned to make sleep more enjoyable. There are little things you can do to ensure a deep and relaxing sleep. Here are some of them: Get Your Worries Off the Way

column1: If you are the type that thinks about your struggles during bedtime
column2: you have got to find a way to deal with it. You could schedule a time to ruminate about your struggles during the day. You could schedule a time to discuss your struggles with a confidant or write them in a journal. By getting it out of your chest
column3: you will be keeping it off your mind which then limits the chances of it disturbing your sleep. Keep Your Naps Short

column1: Many people advise doing away with afternoon nap If you desire a good night and relaxing sleep. However
column2: if you desire to nap at all
column3: keep it short. You could adopt some simple routine such as: Maintaining a schedule: Make it early in the afternoon. Keep it short ‚Äì brevity is the key. Limit afternoon nap to a maximum of 30 minutes. Try a More Comfortable Mattress for relaxing sleep

column1: A typical human spends over 30% of his/her entire life sleeping. If relaxing sleep is this vital
column2: then attention should be given to where the ‚Äúart of sleeping‚Äù is done ‚Äì the mattress. However
column3: an uncomfortable mattress could also limit the quality of sleep gotten. How do you know when to change mattress? Do you have to try several sleeping positions before you can sleep? Are you fond of waking up and shifting positions? Do you wake up with back and joint pains?

column1: If you can identify with the above
column2: it is time to consider a new mattress. A good mattress should provide support for your curves and natural spine. Limit Light Exposure hinders relaxing sleep

column1: There is a natural occurring hormone in the body called Melatonin. It is controlled by exposure to light and helps regulate your sleep-wake cycle. You feel sleepy when the brain secretes more melatonin
column2: which occurs majorly during the dark. However
column3: less melatonin is secreted when there is light
column4: making you more alert. Many aspects of our life can alter the production of melatonin. However
column5: during the night
column6: you could develop some habit that will influence the production of melatonin. Some of such are: Within 1 to 2 hours of your bedtime
column7: avoid bright light. Reduce the brightness of your phone or tablet if you must use it Avoid late-night TV
column8: it suppresses melatonin Avoid reading with backlit device Sleep in a dark room
column9: Use heavy curtain to shade light from outside

column1: Make Vigorous Exercise a Priority

One of the many advantages of exercise is that it helps enhance sleep. Hardly will you see any good exerciser that does not enjoy a sound sleep at night. They are hardly a victim of insomnia. Exercise increases the amount of time you spend in deep and restorative stages of sleep.
Vigorous exercise makes your sleep deep. However
column2: light exercise as simple as some minutes of the walk could also improve your sleep quality. Note however that it could take a while before you see the influence of exercise on your sleep
column3: but it will come. However
column4: avoid exercising when it‚Äôs close to your bedtime
column5: at least 3 hours to your bedtime is ideal. Carefully Choose Your Meal

column1: The food you eat
column2: especially some hours to your bedtime also influences the level and quality of your sleep. Caffeine and nicotine intake should be reduced; they contain a stimulant that can keep you alert for hours. Also do away with smoking
column3: it does not help your sleep. Avoid Background Noise

column1: You should avoid things that will interfere with your sleep regarding noise. White noise is helpful; an ideal one can help you block out unnecessary ones. A fan is ideal as it not only maintains a consistent flow of air but also provides a continuous background noise.
You can get a white noise machine or even get the app on your mobile phone. Some white noise gives the impression of rain
column2: wind
column3: etc. You could also go for a varied sound such as that of a babbling rock
column4: waterfall or a croaking frog. Match Your Pillow to Your Sleep Position

column1: Pillows are an essential sleep aid and could make a great deal between having a good night sleep or a bad one. Your pillow can help lower back pain by using it to support your knees if you sleep on your back While sleeping on your side
column2: your pillow could come between your knees. This maintains alignment with the hips. Used to sleeping on your tummy
column3: a flat pillow is advised so as not to strain your neck.";english;2016-10-28T01:28:25.876+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Eight Tips To a Deeper and More Relaxing Sleep;0.0;http://10667-presscdn-0-56.pagely.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/Sleepy-Time.jpg;0;1;3;0;3;junksci

column1: By following the above natural home remedies

column3: drought (NaturalNews) California

column30: including dairy and meat
column31: in just three hours.The food waste
column32: picked up from grocery stores across the country

column37: 000 acres of farmland. Because the fertilizer is a pasteurized (pathogen-free) liquid
column38: farmers can easily apply it to their fields through their drip irrigation lines

column1: 6447;34bfc124839a8e26bad3e51666a08b17136d0498;0;Daniel Barker;2016-10-28T09:33:57.630+03:00;Non-GMO 'crop circles' showing up in corn fields in Nebraska;"Non-GMO 'crop circles' showing up in corn fields in Nebraska

column2: crop circles
column3: Our Little Rebellion (NaturalNews) An American company has hit on a novel way to promote its non-GMO corn snacks while raising awareness concerning the dominance of GM agriculture in the country ‚Äì by using crop circles as an advertising medium.Our Little Rebellion ‚Äì a company that sells a line of non-GMO corn snack products called PopCorners ‚Äì has joined up with Nebraska farmer Jim McGowan to create a giant message in his cornfield urging people to ""Join The Corn Revolution.""The 9-acre crop artwork also features a large-scale version of the PopCorners website address and the logo of the Non-GMO Project
column4: an organization that verifies Our Little Rebellion's products.Courtney Pineau
column5: associate director of the Non-GMO Project
column6: said:""It's super creative ‚Äì we're really excited about it. I've never really seen a brand undertake an endeavor like this
column7: so that's one of the things that we really loved about it.""The project involved some high-tech GPS mapping
column8: a crop circle artist and a week of hand-cutting corn by a team of 15 people.A drone camera captured the creation of the artwork
column9: as seen in the video below:Fifth-generation farmer McGowan said:""We're really excited to be able to see the whole circle here come into effect. Most of the time in production agriculture
column10: it's treated as a regular raw commodity and you don't even know what happens to it. To see the actual chain complete with this product from that field is really special.""From Eco Salon :""The project seeks to draw attention to the baffling 92 percent of American corn acreage currently being grown with genetically modified seeds ‚Äì and to Our Little Rebellion's efforts to source the 20 million pounds of corn it uses annually from the other eight percent."" Meeting a growing demand for non-GMO foods To manufacture its products
column11: Our Little Rebellion has had to take a creative approach
column12: partnering with dozens of small farmers like McGowan to restructure supply chains so that they can obtain enough non-GMO corn to keep production steady.The Non-GMO Project says that the growing demand for non-GMO corn

column14: Americans have consistently spoken out in favor of GMO labeling and the right to have a choice between purchasing GMO and non-GMO foods.There is a market for natural
column15: organic
column16: GMO-free foods

column19: the GM agricultural model hurts small farmers and poisons the planet with glyphosate
column20: and GM cross-contamination and the development of herbicide-resistant superweeds are threatening the entire agricultural spectrum ‚Äì and the public is finding out about it.The GMO deception is no longer sustainable

column1: 6448;f9c41de4dc0c4261b4783893c9a9c24af44e0404;0;Vicki Batts;2016-10-28T09:33:58.211+03:00;Farm owner arrested for protesting Dakota Access Pipeline's theft of her land;"Farm owner arrested for protesting Dakota Access Pipeline's theft of her land
Vicki Batts Tags: eminent domain
column2: Dakota Access Pipeline
column3: civil liberties (NaturalNews) There have been countless stories across the web that have documented those struggling to fight against the Dakota Access Pipeline. Native Americans
column4: farmers
column5: ranchers
column6: landowners and environmental activists have joined together to oppose the pipeline and bring the project to a grinding halt.Just recently
column7: 127 Native American activists were arrested at a construction site near the Standing Rock Sioux reservation in North Dakota. Despite the corporate media's attempts to suppress information surrounding the controversial pipeline
column8: concerns about the Dakota Access project have become increasingly visible.However
column9: one issue has remained in the dark: the government's abuse of eminent domain.Eminent domain is what gives the government the right to seize private
column10: law-abiding citizens' properties for public use. Normally this means a road
column11: a school or another public structure that will be used by the citizens of a town or which in some way serves them. However
column12: the government can also seize private land if they can prove that it will provide some sort of ""public good."" This loophole ‚Äì and yes
column13: it is a loophole ‚Äì has allowed our government to steal land from taxpayers for years
column14: and then give it to a private citizen or company. Such is the case with the Dakota Access Pipeline.This pipeline is not a public project; it is being conducted by a private company that will profit off their endeavors. And yet
column15: in spite of all the land that will be destroyed and the people whose lives will be disrupted by this project
column16: the government has still seen fit to steal land and give it to the pipeline's creators under the guise of ""public good.""In Iowa
column17: a major conflict between farmers and the government has broken out. You see
column18: the state government is trying to take their land
column19: and consequently
column20: their livelihoods
column21: to make way for the pipeline .The state's decision to hand over land owned by farmers to the Dakota Access LLC has been met with quite a lot of opposition ‚Äì as it should have. Just last week
column22: Calhoun County farmer Cyndy Coppola was arrested on her own property for protesting the government's usurpation of her own land .Apparently
column23: they expected farmers to idly sit back and watch them steal what they worked so hard for.Cyndy Coppola's arrest has been ignored by the mainstream media
column24: probably because it doesn't align with their narrative that Big Government knows best. An injurious move at best
column25: her arrest highlights everything wrong with the way our government is being run.The theft of privately owned land simply cannot be ignored any longer ‚Äì it is unconstitutional for the government to give a tax-paying citizen's land to a multi-billion dollar energy company so that they can make even more money. And it won't just be the oil and gas companies that profit off this disgusting display of government; dozens of big banks and investment firms will also be taking home a piece of the pie. Food and Water Watch reported in September than 17 financial institutions loaned Dakota Access LLC a whopping $2.5 billion to launch their project. They noted that banks have also given a substantial number of resources to the Energy Transfer Family of companies
column26: such as billion-dollar credit lines and revolving credits. In total
column27: a staggering 38 banks have given this corporation over $10 billion in loans and credits.How many of those banks do you think have ties to our government? Goldman Sachs is on the list

column1: 6451;ea7ef3de823cbfb94095a594d7b046cb54812f0a;0;Vicki Batts;2016-10-28T09:33:59.765+03:00;CLAIM: Watching scary movies could help boost your immune system and promote weight loss;"CLAIM: Watching scary movies could help boost your immune system and promote weight loss
Vicki Batts Tags: scary movies
column2: immune system
column3: weight loss (NaturalNews) Who doesn't love a good horror flick
column4: right? There may actually be some health benefits to be found in watching scary movies
column5: too. Experts say that when you watch something frightening
column6: it engages your fight or flight response. This in turn raises the amount of adrenaline pumping through your veins
column7: which can be pretty good for your body.Psychologist Mark Griffiths
column8: a professor of behavioral addiction at Nottingham Trent University
column9: says that there are a number of reasons why people typically seek out fear-inducing films. While the desire to experience something unusual isn't totally health related
column10: Griffiths also commented on the potential healthy release some people may experience. ""Watching such films 'may also be cathartic
column11: providing an emotional release for pent-up frustrations
column12: '"" he told the UK's Daily Mail .But there could be more to it than just that
column13: at least according to some new research. Evidence indicates that the fear you experience while watching a scary movie could help to temporarily bolster your immune system .Scientists from Coventry University took blood samples from a group of test subjects before
column14: during and after they either watched a scary movie or spent time in a quiet room. Their findings
column15: which were published in the journal Stress
column16: revealed that white blood cell counts were increased in those who saw the horror film . Normally
column17: white blood cells respond in this way when there is a sign of infection.According to Natalie Riddell
column18: an immunologist at University College London
column19: this is all part of our evolutionary process
column20: which has been ""geared to promote the survival of the individual."" Getting scared can engage the ""fight or flight"" response
column21: which in turn
column22: causes the release of adrenaline.The surge of adrenaline then launches the immune system into action ‚Äì leading to an increased white blood cell count.That's not all adrenaline can do
column23: either. The survival hormone also elevates your heart rate and boosts your metabolic rate ‚Äì the speed at which your body burns calories. You may think that the number of calories you could burn by watching horror movies is negligible
column24: but studies have shown that you can actually burn a surprising amount of energy just by being scared. That's right
column25: watching horror movies could help support your weight loss efforts.In 2012
column26: researchers from the University of Westminster conducted an experiment to see how many calories volunteers could burn off while watching 10 classic scary films. On average
column27: each film scared the participants into torching about 113 calories ‚Äì which is equivalent to walking for about 30 minutes. The researchers found that the best horror movie for burning calories was none other than a classic Steven King film. That's right
column28: when people watched The Shining directed by Stanley Kubrick
column29: they burned away a whopping 184 calories.The classic films Jaws and The Exorcist came in second and third place
column30: respectively
column31: for total calorie burning. Dr. Richard Mackenzie
column32: senior lecturer and specialist in cell metabolism and physiology at the university commented that each of the 10 films sent hearts beating and pulses racing. He explained
column33: ""As the pulse quickens and blood pumps around the body faster
column34: the body experiences a surge in adrenaline. It is this release of fast-acting adrenaline
column35: produced during short bursts of intense stress (or in this case
column36: brought on by fear)
column37: which is known to lower the appetite
column38: increase the basal metabolic rate and ultimately burn a higher level of calories.""Overall
column39: calorie burning increased by about one-third while the study participants watched the films. Of course
column40: this doesn't mean that you should watch a movie instead of exercising or eating healthfully . But the next time you sit down to watch a movie
column41: you might want to pick one from the horror genre. Sources:";english;2016-10-28T09:33:59.765+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;CLAIM: Watching scary movies could help boost your immune system and promote weight loss;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Men/Asian-Man-Cover-Ears-Scared.jpg;0;1;104;0;104;junksci

column2: staff writer;2016-10-28T09:34:00.931+03:00;"Soy should not be consumed in significant quantities unless it has been fermented or otherwise traditionally processed; industrially processed soy should be avoided";"Soy should not be consumed in significant quantities unless it has been fermented or otherwise traditionally processed; industrially processed soy should be avoided

column1: David Gutierrez
column2: staff writer Tags: soy
column3: fermentation
column4: phytoestrogens (NaturalNews) The recent history of soy in the Western diet has been a turbulent one
column5: from its status as a non-food item in the early 20th century through its transition to a health food in the last few decades of that century to current concerns over its high content of natural estrogen mimics.What many debates over the nature of soy fail to take into account is that soy-based foods are neither healthy nor unhealthy; it all depends on the processing.The soy bean itself is highly unhealthy for human consumption. In addition to potentially dangerous levels of phytoestrogens
column6: it contains exceptionally high levels of chemicals that bind to the nutrients in the bean
column7: preventing their absorption. Soy derivatives such as soy protein are even worse
column8: as they are isolated from the rest of the nutrients in the bean and have usually been extracted with toxic chemicals.Traditional cultures developed two major ways to bypass this problem: fermentation and curdling. Both are ancient techniques for changing the fundamental nutritional makeup of foods. These processes are what transform soy (the dangerous food) into the healthful products of tofu
column9: tempeh
column10: miso and soy sauce that have played a major role in the diets of many Asian cultures for hundreds of years. Sources:";english;2016-10-28T09:34:00.931+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;"Soy should not be consumed in significant quantities unless it has been fermented or otherwise traditionally processed; industrially processed soy should be avoided";0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Food/Soy-Products.jpg;0;1;293;0;293;junksci

column1: 6455;d1ff8c0bb54bff63b5215bfbdf242fd74c4d8bfd;0;Vicki Batts;2016-10-28T14:00:00.000+03:00;Lifting weights could ward off dementia and make you smarter;"Lifting weights could ward off dementia and make you smarter
by: Vicki Batts Tags: weight lifting
column2: dementia
column3: brain health (NaturalNews) There are many reasons to partake in strength training; weight-baring exercises are known for their health benefits. But
column4: could lifting weights also boost your brain? Recent research indicates that may just be the case.To begin the study
column5: researchers asked a group of people aged 55 to 86 to engage in a mix of weight lifting and brain training exercises. All of the people who partook in the study had been diagnosed with mild cognitive impairment
column6: which is a precursor to Alzheimer's disease
column7: and is an early sign of dementia.While this particular study did not examine whether the benefits of exercise could be extended to the general population
column8: the results were quite impressive. Published in the Journal of the American Geriatrics Society
column9: the study found that weight-baring exercises could indeed provide some brain benefits. The researchers found a casual relationship between an increase in muscle strength and an increase in brain function. On that basis
column10: the team recommended that more people begin a strength training regime so that the world's aging population can hopefully be a little healthier. It is currently projected that about 135 million people will have dementia by the year 2050.The same team behind this most recent research also published a paper in 2014 that revealed that weight training provided cognitive benefits to just about every area of the brain ‚Äì something cognitive training failed to do.While discussing their most recent data
column11: one of the study's researchers
column12: Dr. Yorgi Mavros of Sydney University
column13: commented
column14: ""What we found in this follow-up study is that the improvement in cognition function was related to their muscle strength gains. The stronger people became
column15: the greater the benefit for their brain.""For the strength training
column16: study participants were asked to lift weights that were equivalent to about 80 percent of their maximum capacity
column17: twice a week for six months ‚Äì similar to the way in which many athletes train. And
column18: as the participants got stronger
column19: the amount of weight they lifted went up as well
column20: in order to maintain the desired 80 percent of their maximum effort.Brain scans revealed that certain regions of the brain actually increased in size for those who took part in the exercise regime. Dr. Mavros says that the benefits were profound enough to warrant recommending weight training for everyone.""The more we can get people doing resistance training like weight lifting
column21: the more likely we are to have a healthier ageing population
column22: he told the Independent . Dr. Mavros also added that the best way to ensure that you get the most benefit from exercise is by maintaining a regular routine. Exercising frequently
column23: and with some intensity
column24: is key to getting the most out of what you're doing.This new research is not the first to suggest that exercise can provide benefits to brain health . The body of research linking physical exercise to better cognitive function has only continued to grow over the last several years. Science has indicated that in addition to better mental health
column25: exercise can also promote both better memory and concentration.Dr. James Pickett
column26: head of research at the Alzheimer's Society
column27: also had a few things to say about this new study. He noted
column28: ""New research is beginning to unravel how physical exercise may have benefits for the brain as people get older. This study suggests that people with minor memory and thinking problems
column29: known as mild cognitive impairment
column30: may benefit from weight training to improve their brain health.""Pickett also noted that while it is not yet clear if exercise can reverse dementia
column31: they do know that it is one of the most important factors in its prevention. Along with being active
column32: he says that not smoking and eating a healthy
column33: balanced diet are all essential to reducing the risk. Sources:";english;2016-10-28T20:35:53.366+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Lifting weights could ward off dementia and make you smarter;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Exercise/Elderly-Woman-Workout-Swimming-Pool-Weights.jpg;0;1;178;0;178;junksci

column1: 6456;8ac3d8dcb6398e7c64d13e9b706c304e610c86cd;0;Twain Yobra;2016-10-28T22:11:00.000+03:00;10 Signs of Vitamin B12 Deficiency (And best food sources of Vitamin B12);"10 Signs of Vitamin B12 Deficiency (And best food sources of Vitamin B12) http://blogs.naturalnews.com/10-signs-vitamin-b12-deficiency-best-food-sources-vitamin-b12/
By Twain Yobra
Posted Friday
column2: October 28
column3: 2016 at 10:11am EDT

column1: Vitamin B12 is crucial for the brain
column2: nerves
column3: DNA and blood cells. Unfortunately
column4: it becomes harder and harder for our bodies to absorb vitamin B12 as we age. In fact
column5: 4 in every 100 women between age 40 and 60 have vitamin B12 deficiency . But age isn‚Äôt the only contributing factor ‚Äì avoiding certain foods is what‚Äôs making you vitamin B12 deficient.

column1: Here are signs of vitamin B12 deficiency and the foods you should eat to combat them.

Signs of vitamin B12 Deficiency Being sleepy all the time despite getting adequate sleep at night Strange sensations in the body ‚Äì pins and needles sensations Feeling of weakness and sluggishness Loss of memory and impaired thinking Feeling dizzy while doing simple things like walking Skin looks pale (yellow) Tongue gets swollen and red Anemia Blurry vision
Note that very low levels of vitamin B12 can have more harmful effects. Also
column2: vegan and vegetarian diets don‚Äôt offer enough vitamin B12 so you‚Äôll need supplementation if you‚Äôre either. But non-vegetarians can get enough vitamin B12 from their diet. Below are great sources of vitamin B12

column1: 15 Best food sources of vitamin B12
1. Oysters: Oyster has high amounts of vitamin B12
column2: it is also a great source of zinc. Zinc boosts testosterone
column3: libido and benefits the ovaries.

column1: 2. Clams: Clams contain more vitamin B12 than any other food. They‚Äôre also rich in potassium.
3. Mussels: Other than vitamin B12 mussels are also rich in protein
column2: potassium
column3: omega 3s and vitamin C.

column1: 4. Sardines: This fish is known for its omega 3 properties
column2: it can also fight vitamin B12 and D deficiency.

column1: 5. Crab: Crabs are loaded with lots of nutrients
column2: they‚Äôre rich in magnesium
column3: zinc
column4: and vitamins A
column5: B and C.

column1: 6. Salmon: 3 ounces of cooked salmon have 4.8 mcg of vitamin B12. Salmon is also contains vitamin D and omega 3s.
7. Trout: This fish can help you fight inflammation and improve brain function.
8. Tuna: Just make sure the tuna is bred in a clean environment. It‚Äôll give you lots of omega 3s and vitamin D.
9. Grass-fed beef: Beef will give you lots of proteins and B vitamins.
10. Haddock: This fish has low amounts of mercury and it will give you omega 3s.
11. Milk: Not only is milk a good source of vitamin D and calcium
column2: recent studies show it can reduce PMS symptoms.

column1: 12. Yoghurt: Yoghurt is rich in probiotics
column2: magnesium
column3: calcium and protein. Plain greek yoghurt is the best option.

column1: 13. Whole eggs: Eggs will also give you vitamin D and aid absorption of calcium in the bones.
14. Chicken: Chicken will give you lots of protein and keep you full.
15. Turkey: Turkey has small amounts of vitamin B12 so it may not be the best option for folks with severe deficiency.
For more information on eating healthy and staying fit
column2: download your FREE 3 Weeks Flat Stomach Guide to help you improve your health and physique. And like our Facebook page . column1: 6458;b4cbaaff18c6b854936125e4d235dde1dc4cad2c;0;George Zapo;2016-10-28T20:04:00.000+03:00;Volunteers Succeed at Eliminating Food Waste and Hunger;"By George Zapo
Posted Friday
column2: October 28
column3: 2016 at 08:04am EDT

column1: Keywords: Atlanta
column2: food
column3: food waste
column4: fresh food
column5: Georgia
column6: hunger
column7: landfills
column8: perishable food
column9: Second Helpings Atlanta
column10: volunteers
column11: waste managment

column1: Food waste and hunger are enormous global
column2: environmental
column3: and public health problems. As overwhelming as these issues are
column4: community groups
column5: volunteers
column6: local businesses
column7: and organizations are working on trying to find a solution.

column1: What started as a social action project in 2004
column2: a few members of a small community in metro-Atlanta
column3: Georgia took up the challenge to feed people in need and eliminate food waste.

column1: And they‚Äôre succeeding!
The project grew into a non-profit organization with a team of more than 400 volunteer drivers
column2: a network of more than 50 donors
column3: and front-line agencies who feed the hungry on a daily basis.

column1: Amazingly
column2: the entire group has rescued more than 5.5 million pounds of food ‚Äî enough to provide 4.6 million meals. Here‚Äôs more of this motivating
column3: against-all-odds story. Food Waste and Hunger

column1: About a third of the planet‚Äôs food goes to waste. That‚Äôs enough to feed two billion people.

The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) and the World Resources Institute (WRI) report that about one-third of all food produced worldwide ‚Äî worth around $1 trillion ‚Äî are lost or wasted in food production and consumption systems.
Furthermore
column2: the Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC) cites the following:

column1: ‚ÄúForty percent of the food in the United States is never eaten. But at the same time
column2: one in eight Americans struggles to put enough food on the table.‚Äù

column1: Nearly 800 million people worldwide suffer from hunger . But according to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
column2: we squander enough food ‚Äî globally
column3: 2.9 trillion pounds a year ‚Äî to feed every one of them more than twice over.

column1: In developing nations
column2: much of the food is lost after harvest
column3: because of the lack of refrigeration
column4: good roads
column5: and adequate storage facilities. On the other hand
column6: developed nations waste more food when retailers order
column7: display
column8: or serve too much.

column1: Additionally
column2: consumers waste food when they ignore leftovers in the back of their refrigerators ‚Äî or toss perishable food out before it expires. More Alarming Statistics of Wasted Food

column1: Much of the wasted food in the U.S. ends up in landfills. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) reports that food waste is the second largest category of municipal solid waste sent to landfills in the United States.
And it accounts for about 18 percent of the waste stream. That‚Äôs more than 30 million tons of food waste that the U.S. sends to the landfills each year.
Additionally
column2: according to NRDC
column3: on average
column4: people dining out leave 17 percent of meals uneaten and 55 percent of these potential leftovers are not taken home.

column1: In spite of the dismal statistics on food waste ‚Äî and the struggles and pain hungry people endure ‚Äî community groups
column2: organizations
column3: local businesses
column4: and volunteers in metro-Atlanta
column5: Georgia are making headway in not wasting food and feeding people in need. People Are Fed
column6: Perishable Food Not Wasted

column1: More than ten years ago
column2: a few members of a community in metro-Atlanta
column3: Georgia took up the challenge to feed people in need and eliminate food waste. They wanted to take leftover fresh food from grocery stores and restaurants and quickly deliver it to agencies that provide food to families and individuals in need.

column1: Since the first delivery was made in 2004
column2: the group has ‚Äúrescued‚Äù more than 5.5 million pounds of food. And the group believes this figure equals enough to provide more than 4.6 million meals.

column1: As success mounted in eliminating food waste and feeding people in their community
column2: the group established itself as a non-profit organization called Second Helpings Atlanta . Now
column3: Second Helpings Atlanta has 62 donors
column4: 31 partner agencies
column5: and a team of more than 400 volunteer drivers who pick up and drop off perishable food every day.

column1: Executive Director Joe Labriola says
column2: ‚ÄúThe challenge is getting the food from those who have it to those who need it
column3: and that‚Äôs what we do. We play a very specific role. We do 125 scheduled pickups and deliveries a week. We‚Äôve gotten pretty good at this.‚Äù Fresh Food versus Non-Perishable

column1: Fresh food provides more nutrition than the non-perishable
column2: processed diet that so many people eat ‚Äî especially people with low or no income. One of Second Helpings Atlanta‚Äôs goals is to change that standard
column3: offering fresh food that will ideally help prompt healthier eating habits.

column1: This year
column2: the group has delivered 962
column3: 635 pounds of food and Labriola estimates they will pick up and deliver more than 1.3 million pounds by the end of the year.

column1: ‚ÄúThe reason we‚Äôre so focused on perishable food is that we‚Äôre providing nutrition to the diets of people who are surviving on processed food. We‚Äôre breaking the cycle and hope that some of the health benefits of fresh food will start to kick in.‚Äù
According to Labriola
column2: he sees no reason why this type of food waste program can‚Äôt easily be adopted anywhere. He adds that 40 percent of the food produced in the U.S. is never consumed. And the average annual cost per household of food that is thrown out is $650.

column1: Twenty percent of people in Georgia live in a food-insecure environment ‚Äî meaning they‚Äôre not sure when they‚Äôre going to eat next. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a pretty grim story
column2: ‚Äù Labriola says. ‚ÄúBut if we rescue just 15 percent of that food
column3: we can feed 25 million Americans.‚Äù How it‚Äôs Working

column1: When people sign up to volunteer
column2: they‚Äôre shown the available routes. Then they‚Äôre asked to choose the route that would work best with their location and schedule.

column1: Most pickups are regularly scheduled. However
column2: the group often gets calls from people holding weddings
column3: bar mitzvahs
column4: or festivals ‚Äî knowing there will be leftover food at the end of the night. Then
column5: a call goes out to find a volunteer to help pickup and delivery the leftover food.

column1: Volunteer drivers make food deliveries every day of the year
column2: except Christmas. Food pickups range in size ‚Äî so people can pick them up no matter if they own a small sedan or a minivan. That way volunteering is within the reach of everyone.

column1: From the time a driver leaves home ‚Äî stopping to pick up the food and drop it off at a partner agency ‚Äî it usually takes no longer than 90 minutes for he or she to return home. Families Volunteer
Quite often
column2: entire families will volunteer and work together for the weekly delivery service. Labriola says families volunteering are instrumental to educating younger generations about hunger and food waste.

column1: For example
column2: around Thanksgiving
column3: a family with two young children met Labriola one day to pick up dozens of turkeys at a grocery store. The children looked amazed as they helped carry the delivery ‚Äî bird-by-bird ‚Äî from the store to the truck
column4: and into the agency that would distribute them to families. Labriola told the kids they just helped feed 225 families. The children soon realized what they did. One of the children said
column5: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs as many kids that are in my school!‚Äù

column1: The exemplary work and dedication exhibited by volunteers in the metro-Atlanta
column2: Georgia community is a truly successful model of how to eliminate food waste and hunger. Perhaps more community groups
column3: organizations
column4: local businesses
column5: and volunteers will consider following their worthy example. 6461;c3e87636e988e2f4ddecb599eaeeee286ce5d397;0;Caleb Stephen;2016-10-28T19:54:00.000+03:00;How to Survive a Nuclear Fallout;"How to Survive a Nuclear Fallout Ad 728√ó90 ‚Äì HBS Account ‚Äì 2149237058061490 http://blogs.naturalnews.com/survive-nuclear-fallout/
By Caleb Stephen
Posted Friday
column2: October 28
column3: 2016 at 07:54am EDT

column1: Keywords: fallout
column2: Nuclear
column3: nuclear attack
column4: nuclear attack survival
column5: nuclear bomb
column6: nuclear bomb survival
column7: nuclear power
column8: nuclear radiation
column9: nuclear war
column10: nuke
column11: radiation
column12: survival
column13: tactical nuke With the ongoing tensions between the United States and Russia
column14: fears of a nuclear World War 3 breaking out are running at an all-time high.

column1: With that in mind
column2: I thought it needful to write an article on how to survive the aftermath of a nuclear fallout. Obviously we could discuss the likelihood of such an event occurring but that isn‚Äôt within the scope of this article. Personally I believe that at this point in time
column3: such a scenario is not at all far fetched
column4: however the situation is very fluid and thus things could change at any time.

column1: Basically there‚Äôs two main types of nuclear weapons out there. First
column2: you‚Äôve got what is known as the ‚Äòtactical‚Äô nukes and then the intercontinental sort ‚Äì the stuff that would basically flatten the earth. In that case there‚Äôs no point even trying to survive that. I‚Äôm going to be talking about how to survive a tactical nuke incident. #1. Don‚Äôt be anywhere near ground zero

column1: Obviously the first step to surviving the initial explosion is to not be there in the first place. Of course
column2: there‚Äôs not a ton that you can do if you happen to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. You‚Äôve just got to hope that you exit this world pretty quick ‚Äì which would most certainly happen if you‚Äôre anywhere close to ground zero.

column1: The tremendous heat and sheer force of the explosion is enough to kill anyone and flatten anything within an 8 km radius of the detonation site. The intense thermal radiation emitted by the flash of light at detonation is enough to blind you
column2: burn your flesh and start fires in the impact zone.

column1: If you‚Äôre outside when this happens and you happen to survive
column2: you should take immediate cover in a building. If you get any debris on you
column3: you should wash it off with soap and water as soon as possible.

column1: As a survivor of the initial explosion
column2: you now have around 10 to 20 minutes to bail out of the area before a lethal amount of radiation (fallout) comes down from the mushroom cloud. In those 10-20 minutes
column3: you need to get at least 1.5 km (1 mile) from the blast zone to survive the fallout however within 24 hours lethal radiation will spread with prevailing winds so keep moving to safety. You should feel for the wind and begin running perpendicular to it ‚Äì not upwind or downwind. #2. Getting to shelter

column1: If you can‚Äôt get out of ground zero for whatever reason
column2: then you need to get to shelter as soon as possible. Get into the deepest underground basement that you can find
column3: or the highest story (above the 9th level) if possible.

column1: If you are in the fallout zone
column2: but safely sheltered
column3: you need to remain there for at least 9 days. During this time
column4: food and water should be carefully rationed and clothing layered up to prevent radiation.

column1: Really the best way to survive a nuclear event is to prepare for one.

Remember the nuclear fallout shelters of the Cold War era? Well that‚Äôs what you need to be inside to survive. But not just any shelter. It‚Äôs got to meet a number of different specifications which I am not going to go into because you can find plenty of information on that if you Google ‚Äòhow to build a nuclear fallout shelter‚Äô etc. #3. Personal protection measures
Protecting your body from harmful radiation and fallout particles is your number one priority after getting to shelter.
Like I said before
column2: being prepared prior to such an event is very important which is why it‚Äôs a good idea to carry the gear I‚Äôm going to talk about shortly inside a ‚ÄòGo Bag‚Äô that you can keep in your car
column3: house or workplace.

column1: Some quick first aid tips: It is necessary that all wounds should be covered to prevent contamination and the entry of radioactive particles. Any burns caused by radiation must first be washed and then normal burn first aid procedure should be followed.
Now let‚Äôs look at the gear you should have ready before a nuclear attack happens.

Gas mask: You‚Äôll need a gas mask to protect your face and respiratory system from airborne pathogens and chemical particles. Israeli Military Surplus M-15 Gas Masks fitted with NATO 40 mm CBRN filters are some of the best and cheapest around
column2: yet are getting harder and harder to find these days with huge supplies flying off the shelves in the relatively recent Ebola scar. I have the M-15 civilian version of this gas mask and it‚Äôs extremely comfortable
column3: has a port for a hydration tube and best of all it‚Äôs been tested in real life conditions in the Middle East.

column1: Military chemical suit: These suits provide optimal protection from chemical and biological attacks and are used by the British army. These are surprisingly cheap yet are proven to work by soldiers whose lives depend on them in everyday combat situations. You can get these for around $25 from Amazon.com
Gloves: You‚Äôre going to need gloves to protect your hands from contact with chemical pathogens and biological particles. Long
column2: chemical resistant gloves can be found online
column3: at some supermarkets and hardware stores. You can get these at around $10 ‚Äì $15 depending on the brand etc.

column1: Boots: In order to have full protection from chemical and biological hazards
column2: it is important to have a good pair of rubber over-boots to protect your feet and legs from chemical and biological particles from coming into contact with your body. Ensure that you ‚Äòblouse‚Äô your trousers inside your boots for maximum protection. Once again
column3: these boots that I recommend are used by the UK military and you can get them on Amazon.com for around $25.

column1: Nuclear Protection: There is a way to reduce the effects of nuclear radiation in your body. Its called Potassium Iodide and its available on Amazon for less than $10 for a pack of 14 tablets. What this basically does is it reduces the chances of harmful radioactive iodine from entering your thyroid glands.
If you don‚Äôt have any of these when a nuclear attack happens
column2: you can improvise. As I mentioned before
column3: clothing should be layered up to prevent radiation contact with the skin. Cover your eyes with close-fitting sunglasses or improvised goggles.

column1: #4. Decontaminating food and water
Water and food will be contaminated by debris from the nuclear fallout making procurement and consumption difficult
column2: however it is not impossible to make them safe to consume.

column1: Whenever possible
column2: try to use water that has been sealed in a container or bottle as you can safely assume that the water inside the sealed container is not contaminated. Wash the container thoroughly with soap and water or boil it for at least 10 minutes before breaking the seal. If water in sealed containers is not available
column3: your next choice
column4: only under emergency conditions
column5: is water from springs. Again
column6: boil the water for at least 10 minutes before drinking. Keep the water covered while boiling to prevent contamination by airborne pathogens.

column1: Your last choice (only in an extreme emergency where sealed water and spring water are unavailable) is to use standing water (that found in small pools
column2: ponds and basically any water that does not flow). Contaminants
column3: micro-organisms and germs can survive easily in stagnant water. First
column4: boil this water as long as practical to kill all organisms. Next
column5: filter it through a cloth to remove the nasties.

column1: In all cases mentioned above
column2: use water purification tablets (following all directions on the bottle/packaging) after boiling and initial filtration prior to consumption.

column1: Like water
column2: you can also assume that sealed containers or packages of processed food are safe. To ensure safety
column3: decontaminate all food containers by washing with soap and water or by boiling the container in water for 10 minutes. This is where it helps to have a decent supply of sealed buckets and containers of military-style MRE‚Äôs and freeze-dried foods such as Wise Foods and Mountain House.

column1: You should consider supplementing your sealed rations with local plants
column2: animals and produce only in extreme emergencies. Unfortunately
column3: no matter what you do to prepare or decontaminate the food
column4: there is no guarantee that cooking will kill all the biological agents.

column1: Remember
column2: you can survive for a long time without food (at least 3 weeks
column3: but can be longer)
column4: especially if the food you eat may potentially kill you!

column1: If you must use local food
column2: select only healthy-looking plants
column3: animals
column4: fruit and vegetables. Do not select known carriers of organisms such as rats or other vermin. Always use gloves and protective clothing when handling and dressing animals
column5: plants etc. Cook all plant and animal food by boiling only. Boil all food for at least 10 minutes to kill all pathogens. Do not try to fry
column6: bake
column7: or roast local food as there is no guarantee that all infected portions have reached the required temperature to kill all pathogens. Do not eat raw food at all costs!

column1: Obviously this article is nowhere near comprehensive
column2: but I hope it gives you some idea of what you need to do in order to survive the aftermath of a nuclear attack. We can only hope and pray that such an event does not happen and that peace will prevail on this planet. column1: 6464;fc1dd9182d81f269ac93bb4e116e6da140f5e2b3;0;Hesh Goldstein;2016-10-28T19:36:00.000+03:00;Sometimes the road to diet change can be fun;"Sometimes the road to diet change can be fun Ad 728√ó90 ‚Äì HBS Account ‚Äì 2149237058061490 http://blogs.naturalnews.com/sometimes-road-diet-change-can-fun/
By Hesh Goldstein
Posted Friday
column2: October 28
column3: 2016 at 07:36am EDT

column1: When I was a kid
column2: if I were told that I‚Äôd be writing a book about diet and nutrition when I was older
column3: I would‚Äôve thought that whoever told me that was out of their mind.

column1: Living in Newark
column2: New Jersey
column3: my parents and I consumed anything and everything that had a face or a mother except for dead
column4: rotting
column5: pig bodies
column6: although we did eat bacon (as if all the other decomposing flesh bodies were somehow miraculously clean). Going through high school and college it was no different. In fact
column7: my dietary change did not come until I was in my 30‚Äôs.

column1: Just to put things in perspective
column2: after I graduated from Weequahic High School and before going to Seton Hall University
column3: I had a part-time job working for a butcher. I was the delivery guy and occasionally had to go to the slaughterhouse to pick up products for the store. Needless to say
column4: I had no consciousness nor awareness
column5: as change never came then
column6: despite the horrors I witnessed on an almost daily basis.

column1: After graduating with a degree in accounting from Seton Hall
column2: I eventually got married and moved to a town called Livingston. Livingston was basically a yuppie community where everyone was judged by the neighborhood they lived in and their income. To say it was a ‚Äúplastic‚Äù community would be an understatement.

column1: Livingston and the shallowness finally got to me. I told my wife I was fed up and wanted to move. She made it clear she had to be near her friends and New York City. I finally got my act together and split for Colorado.
I was living with a lady in Aspen at the end of 1974
column2: when one day she said
column3: ‚Äù let‚Äôs become vegetarians‚Äù. I have no idea what possessed me to say it
column4: but I said
column5: ‚Äúokay‚Äù!

column1: At that point I went to the freezer and took out about $100 worth of frozen
column2: dead body parts and gave them to a welfare mother who lived behind us.

column1: Well
column2: everything was great for about a week or so
column3: and then the chick split with another guy.

column1: So here I was
column2: a vegetarian for a couple weeks
column3: not really knowing what to do
column4: how to cook
column5: or basically how to prepare anything. For about a month
column6: I was getting by on carrot sticks
column7: celery sticks
column8: and yogurt. Fortunately
column9: when I went vegan in 1990
column10: it was a simple and natural progression. Anyway
column11: as I walked around Aspen town
column12: I noticed a little vegetarian restaurant called
column13: ‚ÄúThe Little Kitchen‚Äù.

column1: Let me back up just a little bit. It was April of 1975
column2: the snow was melting and the runoff of Ajax Mountain filled the streets full of knee-deep mud. Now
column3: Aspen was great to ski in
column4: but was a bummer to walk in when the snow was melting.

column1: I was ready to call it quits and I needed a warmer place. I‚Äôll elaborate on that in a minute.
But right now
column2: back to ‚ÄúThe Little Kitchen‚Äù. Knowing that I was going to leave Aspen and basically a new vegetarian
column3: I needed help. So
column4: I cruised into the restaurant and told them my plight and asked them if they would teach me how to cook. I told them in return I would wash dishes and empty their trash. They then asked me what I did for a living and I told them I was an accountant.

column1: The owner said to me
column2: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs make a deal. You do our tax return and we‚Äôll feed you as well‚Äù. So for the next couple of weeks I was doing their tax return
column3: washing their dishes
column4: emptying the trash
column5: eating three squares a day and learning as much as I could.

column1: But
column2: like I said
column3: the mud was getting to me. So I picked up a travel book written by a guy named Foder. The name of the book was
column4: ‚ÄúHawaii‚Äù. Looking through the book I noticed that in Lahaina
column5: on Maui
column6: there was a little vegetarian restaurant called
column7: ‚Äù Mr. Natural‚Äôs‚Äù. I decided right then and there that I would go to Lahaina and work at ‚ÄúMr. Natural‚Äôs.‚Äù To make a long story short
column8: that‚Äôs exactly what happened.

column1: So
column2: I‚Äôm working at ‚ÄúMr. Natural‚Äôs‚Äù and learning everything I can about my new dietary lifestyle ‚Äì it was great. Every afternoon we would close for lunch at about 1 PM and go to the Sheraton Hotel in Ka‚Äôanapali and play volleyball
column3: while somebody stayed behind to prepare dinner.

column1: Since I was the new guy
column2: and didn‚Äôt really know how to cook
column3: I never thought that I would be asked to stay behind to cook dinner. Well
column4: one afternoon
column5: that‚Äôs exactly what happened; it was my turn. That posed a problem for me because I was at the point where I finally knew how to boil water.

column1: I was desperate
column2: clueless and basically up the creek without a paddle. Fortunately
column3: there was a friend of mine sitting in the gazebo at the restaurant and I asked him if he knew how to cook. He said the only thing he knew how to cook was enchiladas. He said that his enchiladas were bean-less and dairy-less. I told him that I had no idea what an enchilada was or what he was talking about
column4: but I needed him to show me because it was my turn to do the evening meal.

column1: Well
column2: the guys came back from playing volleyball and I‚Äôm asked what was for dinner. I told them enchiladas; the owner wasn‚Äôt thrilled. I told him that mine were bean-less and dairy-less. When he tried the enchilada he said it was incredible. Being the humble guy that I was
column3: I smiled and said
column4: ‚ÄúYou expected anything less‚Äù? It apparently was so good that it was the only item on the menu that we served twice a week. In fact
column5: after about a week
column6: we were selling five dozen every night we had them on the menu and people would walk around Lahaina broadcasting
column7: ‚Äòenchilada‚Äôs at ‚ÄúNatural‚Äôs‚Äù tonight‚Äô. I never had to cook anything else.

column1: A year later the restaurant closed
column2: and somehow I gravitated to a little health food store in Wailuku. I never told anyone I was an accountant and basically relegated myself to being the truck driver.

column1: The guys who were running the health food store had friends in similar businesses and farms on many of the islands. I told them that if they could organize and form one company they could probably lock in the State. That‚Äôs when they found out I was an accountant and ‚ÄúDown to Earth‚Äù was born. ‚ÄúDown to Earth‚Äù became the largest natural food store chain in the islands
column2: and I was their Chief Financial Officer and co-manager of their biggest store for 13 years.

I started to do a weekly radio show to try and expose people to a vegetarian diet and get them away from killing innocent creatures. I still do that show today. I pay for my own airtime and have no sponsors to not compromise my honesty. One bit of a hassle was the fact that I was forced to get a Masters Degree in Nutrition to shut up all the MD‚Äôs that would call in asking for my credentials.

column1: My doing this radio show enabled me
column2: through endless research
column3: to see the corruption that existed within the big food industries
column4: the big pharmaceutical companies
column5: the biotech industries and the government agencies.

column1: This information
column2: unconscionable as it is
column3: enabled me to realize how broken our health system is.

column1: I left Down to Earth in 1989
column2: got nationally certified as a sports injury massage therapist and started traveling the world with a bunch of guys that were making a martial arts movie. After doing that for about four years I finally made it back to Honolulu and got a job as a massage therapist at the Honolulu Club
column3: one of Hawaii‚Äôs premier fitness clubs.

column1: It was there I met the love of my life who I have been with since 1998. She made me an offer I couldn‚Äôt refuse. She said
column2: ‚Äù If you want to be with me you‚Äôve got to stop working on naked women‚Äù. So
column3: I went back into accounting and was the Chief Financial Officer of a large construction company for many years.

column1: Going back to my Newark days when I was an infant
column2: I had no idea what a ‚Äúchicken‚Äù or ‚Äúegg‚Äù or ‚Äúfish‚Äù or ‚Äúpig‚Äù or ‚Äúcow‚Äù was. My dietary blueprint was thrust upon me by my parents as theirs was thrust upon them by their parents. It was by the grace of God that I was able to put things in their proper perspective and improve my health and elevate my consciousness.

column1: The road that I started walking down in 1975 has finally led me to the point of writing my book
column2: A Sane Diet For An Insane World. Hopefully
column3: the information contained therein will be enlightening
column4: motivating
column5: and inspiring to encourage you to make different choices.

column1: Doing what we do out of conditioning is not always the best course to follow. I am hoping that by the grace of the many friends and personalities I have encountered along my path
column2: you will have a better perspective of what road is the best road for you to travel on
column3: not only for your health but your consciousness as well.

column1: Aloha!
To learn more about Hesh
column2: listen to and read hundreds of health related radio shows and articles
column3: and learn about how to stay healthy and reverse degenerative diseases through the use of organic sulfur crystals and the most incredible bee pollen ever

column5: or email me at heshgoldstein@gmail.com or call me at (808) 258-1177. Since going on the radio in 1981 these are the only products I began to sell because they work. Oh yeah
column6: going to www.asanediet.com will allow you to read various parts of my book ‚Äì ‚ÄúA Sane Diet For An Insane World‚Äù
column7: containing a wonderful comment by Mike Adams. In Hawaii
column8: the TV stations interview local authors about the books they write and the newspapers all do book reviews. Not one would touch ‚ÄúA Sane Diet For An Insane World‚Äù. Why? Because it goes against their advertising dollars. column5: court decision (NaturalNews) In what freedom fighters across the country are calling a stunning victory against a tyrannical government agency
column6: a jury in Oregon has acquitted all seven defendants involved in the armed takeover of a federal wildlife refuge in January.Cheers broke out in the Portland
column7: Ore.
column8: federal courtroom when the jury announced the acquittals of Ammon Bundy
column9: along with brother Ryan Bundy and five others
column10: the Chicago Tribune reported .The seven were charged with conspiracy to impede federal workers from their jobs at the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge
column11: which is located about 300 miles southeast of Portland. Also
column12: the jury could not reach a verdict on even one count of theft for Ryan Bundy. Shocked by the acquittals The announcement by the jury did not come without additional drama
column13: however. Upon hearing the jury's decision
column14: Marcus Mumford
column15: one of Ammon Bundy's attorneys
column16: demanded his client be released
column17: even shouting at the judge. That prompted U.S. marshals to tackle Mumford to the ground and use a stun gun on him a number of times before arresting him
column18: the Tribune reported.U.S. District Judge Anna Brown said she was not able to release Bundy because he faces federal charges in Nevada
column19: his home state
column20: related to an armed standoff with federal Bureau of Land Management agents at his father Cliven Bundy's ranch in 2014 .As reported by KATU
column21: the armed standoff began Jan. 2 and lasted nearly six weeks. The incident brought new attention to the long-running issue of too much federal ownership of lands in the American West. The confrontations at the refuge earlier this year and on Cliven Bundy's ranch in 2014 essentially reignited arguments between private citizens ‚Äì mostly ranchers ‚Äì and the federal government that stem from the so-called Sagebrush Rebellion in the late 1970s
column22: when Western states like Nevada attempted to wrestle more control of their own territory from the federal government .As noted by The New York Times the federal government owns nearly half of the land ‚Äì 47 percent ‚Äì in the West.The Tribune noted that even the defendants' attorneys were shocked by the acquittals.""It's stunning
column23: said Robert Salisbury
column24: an attorney for defendant Jeff Banta. ""It's a stunning victory for the defense. I'm speechless.""The U.S. Attorney in Oregon
column25: Billy J. Williams
column26: said in a statement that his office stood by its decision to prosecute the seven defendants.""We strongly believe that this case needed to be brought before a Court
column27: publicly tried
column28: and decided by a jury
column29: the statement said. 'When the jury hears the story
column30: I expect the same result' The Oregon case was
column31: in a sense
column32: an extension the tense standoff between federal officials with the BLM and other authorities
column33: and the Bundy's two years ago in Nevada. Cliven
column34: Ammon and Ryan Bundy are all scheduled to go on trial for that standoff early next year.It's not clear what the outcome of the Nevada trial will be. Federal attorneys have said they don't feel like the outcome in Oregon will have any effect whatsoever on the Nevada trial.But defense attorneys involved in the Nevada trial aren't so sure. Daniel Hill
column35: an attorney for Ammon Bundy
column36: says the Oregon acquittal bodes well for his client and the other defendants

column1: 6467;0bee1ceec2a6eb37e58027c465d81a2488975069;0;Amy Goodrich;2016-10-29T14:00:00.000+03:00;Study: Running linked to extended lifespan and brain repair;"Study: Running linked to extended lifespan and brain repair
Saturday
column2: October 29
column3: 2016 by: Amy Goodrich Tags: running
column4: brain repair
column5: longevity (NaturalNews) We don't have to be scientists to know that exercise is good for us. However
column6: researchers at the Ottawa Hospital and the University of Ottawa in Canada have added another item to the long list of potential health benefits of regular exercise. They found that running triggers a particular molecule called VGF
column7: a nerve growth factor that can help repair brain and nerve damage in mice with an unusually small cerebellum and a shorter lifespan. The cerebellum is the part of the brain important for balance and coordination.Although more research will be needed to determine how the healing process would work in a human brain
column8: the Canadian researchers are hopeful that their groundbreaking discovery may open new doors in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases. Put on those running shoes and extend your life In the study
column9: published in the scientific journal Cell Reports
column10: the researchers reported that VGF production induced by running in a wheel extended the life of mice with smaller cerebellums and difficulties in walking. Typically these mice only lived for 25 to 40 days
column11: but when they were allowed to run
column12: they lived for over a year
column13: which is the normal lifespan for a mouse.Furthermore
column14: they discovered that the running mice had a better sense of balance
column15: and showed increased levels of myelin production. Myelin plays a key role in a healthy brain . It is the insulating material of our nerves
column16: and is best compared to the plastic material around electrical cables. Lose that protective layer and nerves will have difficulty carrying their messages as quickly or efficiently
column17: resulting in a host of neurological issues.While running improved the quality and quantity of life for the mice
column18: they had to maintain their healthy running habit. Once the opportunity to exercise was taken away
column19: they began to degenerate again and their lifespans shortened once more. The positive effects of regular exercise Dr. Picketts
column20: a senior scientist at the Ottawa Hospital and professor at the University of Ottawa
column21: said that these findings shine a new light on the effect exercise might have on people suffering from neurodegenerative diseases
column22: like multiple sclerosis (MS)
column23: that involve a loss of myelin or insulation of the nerve fibers.""With multiple sclerosis
column24: you get a lot of degeneration of the (neuron) insulation
column25: and patients with MS go through these relapses and remissions
column26: Picketts said. ""We're really hoping that maybe if we could use VGF to limit the number of degenerations
column27: (it would) really allow remissions to be more prevalent and longer
column28: he added.Last month
column29: another study published in the journal Neurorehabilitation and Neural Repair
column30: showed that exercise helped gerbils who had a stroke to recover their memory
column31: partly though myelin repair around the neurons.However
column32: when Dr. Picketts and his colleagues analyzed myelin levels in healthy mice
column33: running didn't seem to produce any significant change. These findings suggest that VGF-triggered myelin repair probably only kicks in when our brain or nerves are under attack.""Generally
column34: healthy people [already] have normal levels of myelin
column35: noted Dr. Matias Alvarez-Saavedra
column36: lead author of the study.Of course
column37: that doesn't mean healthy people should not exercise. Many studies have linked regular exercise to healthy brain changes such as improved memory
column38: increased blood flow and decreased inflammation in the brain. Sources for this article include:";english;2016-10-29T20:09:20.176+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Study: Running linked to extended lifespan and brain repair;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Transportation/Group-Young-Adults-Training-Running-Together.jpg;0;1;208;0;208;junksci

column1: 6468;b800c0f7744d31186f3ba5183bc6ccd19b8b82a3;0;Isabelle Z.;2016-10-29T14:00:00.000+03:00;Fast food 'combo meals' tied to kids' over-consumption of high-calorie drinks;"Fast food 'combo meals' tied to kids' over-consumption of high-calorie drinks
Saturday
column2: October 29
column3: 2016 by: Isabelle Z. Tags: fast food
column4: obesity
column5: children (NaturalNews) Fast food chains know how to squeeze every last dollar out of their customers. From decorating their establishments with appetite-stimulating colors
column6: to pricing their meals to encourage people to get bigger sizes
column7: their every move is perfectly calculated to maximize profits. Unfortunately
column8: these practices are hurting a lot more than just your wallet ‚Äì they are also affecting the health of your children.A study led by researchers from the NYU Langone Medical Center found that children who ate at any of five fast food chains consumed an average of 179 more calories when their meals came with soda
column9: juice
column10: sweetened tea or flavored milk
column11: when compared to those who drank unsweetened beverages with their meals.The researchers also discovered that the children consumed an average of 82 more drink calories when the drinks were part of bundled meals than when the drinks were bought separately. Moreover
column12: parents who bought a combo meal were 24 percent more likely to buy a high-calorie drink sweetened with sugar.The study looked at almost 500 children aged 18 and younger who ate food from McDonald's
column13: KFC
column14: Burger King
column15: Subway or Wendy's in New York and New Jersey between January 2013 and June 2014. Seventy-four percent of the combo meals purchased were kids' meals. Half of the drinks were sodas
column16: and 38 percent of them were juice
column17: with flavored milk making up 5 percent. A further 5 percent was made up of lemonade
column18: sweetened tea and hot chocolate. Non-sugary drinks proved to be quite unpopular
column19: with regular milk accounting for just 2 percent and water a measly 1 percent.Dr. Brian Elbel of NYU Langone
column20: the study's senior investigator
column21: said: ""Our study strongly suggests that uncoupling sugary drinks from combo meal deals might reduce high-calorie beverage consumption and help to curb childhood obesity rates fueled by these kinds of liquid calories."" Parents need to take responsibility Combo meals tend to appeal to big families
column22: which can find their bills quickly adding up at fast food restaurants. Well-meaning parents who might not normally allow their children to drink sugary beverages sometimes find themselves giving in when the drink is included.Although the practice on the part of fast food chains of bundling unhealthy foods together to create perceived value encourage unhealthy habits
column23: it is ultimately up to the parents to decide which meals to buy for their children. Parents have the final say
column24: and just because that super-sized Coke comes with your child's meal does not mean that you should let them drink it. Fast track to diabetes Fast food meals are already high in calories
column25: which means that the last thing you should be doing is pairing them with high-calorie beverages. Research published in the journal Diabetes Care showed that drinking even just one sugary beverage each day raised a person's risk of developing type 2 diabetes by as much as 25 percent. It also upped the risk of developing metabolic syndrome by 20 percent.With around 17 percent of our nation's youth believed to be obese
column26: there is an urgent need for poor eating habits to be curbed. Until people start giving up the convenience of the local drive-through and start making a concerted effort to feed their children clean food
column27: the situation is only likely to get worse
column28: and more and more children will end up obese or diabetic.So
column29: the next time you're thinking of ordering that combo meal
column30: keep in mind that any money that you might save on a meal deal is likely to end up costing far more in medical bills down the road. Sources include:";english;2016-10-29T20:09:21.344+03:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Fast food 'combo meals' tied to kids' over-consumption of high-calorie drinks;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Misc/McDonalds-Happy-Meal-Mascot.jpg;0;1;108;0;108;junksci

column1: 6469;7c6b058649e75d73ef56d2d472d9d72131cf0669;0;Natural News Editors;2016-10-29T14:00:00.000+03:00;Zika: a masterpiece of public mind control;"Zika: a masterpiece of public mind control
Saturday
column2: October 29
column3: 2016 by: Natural News Editors Tags: Zika
column4: mind control
column5: propaganda (NaturalNews) It's been nearly nine months since the word ""Zika"" flashed like a lightning bolt in the headlines of mainstream news. Before January 1
column7: Zika was just one of many viruses that public health officials monitored. But suddenly in January of this year everything changed
column8: as a nearly harmless virus was transformed into a worldwide threat.(Article by John P. Thomas
column9: republished from HealthImpactNews.com )As we will see
column10: the Zika propaganda machine was turned on in October of 2015 and it has been running wild ever since. This is a classic example of a mind control program
column11: a public brainwashing project
column12: or a high powered marketing campaign.Regardless of what you call it
column13: it is clear that the mainstream news media
column14: the World Health Organization (WHO)
column15: the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO)
column16: the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
column17: Big Pharma
column18: Big Chem
column19: and both Republicans and Democrats have joined forces to sell a Zika eradication program to the people of the United States and to the rest of the world.This has been and continues to be one of the best orchestrated programs of propaganda in recent history. This article will discuss how the program started
column20: how it has been developed
column21: and where it is going. Zika is not a Threat to the Babies of the World Just to be absolutely clear from the beginning
column22: there is no solid evidence that Zika is a threat to humanity. It is a minimally dangerous viral infection
column23: which does not cause microcephaly.In the almost 70 years since the Zika virus was patented by the Rockefeller Foundation
column24: [1] no one ever noticed any association between Zika infection of pregnant women and their babies being born with abnormally small heads or with defects in brain development. But in 2015
column25: we were suddenly made aware of this supposed problem. This claim
column26: based on nothing more than circumstantial evidence
column27: was the beginning point for the propaganda campaign. A propaganda claim doesn't need to be true; it just needs to be repeated over and over again until people believe it is true.After half a year of fear and hysteria in the mainstream media
column28: even officials in Brazil admit that Zika is an unlikely cause of their microcephaly .As reported in Nature News & Comment on July 23
column30: an official from Brazil's ministry of health raises doubts to suggest Zika is not the only factor in the reported microcephaly surge in his country. The report stated: Zika virus has spread throughout Brazil
column31: but extremely high rates of microcephaly have been reported only in the country's northeast. Although evidence suggests that Zika can cause microcephaly
column32: the clustering pattern hints that other environmental
column33: socio-economic or biological factors could be at play. ""We suspect that something more than Zika virus is causing the high intensity and severity of cases
column34: says Fatima Marinho
column35: director of information and health analysis at Brazil's ministry of health. If that turns out to be true
column36: it could change researchers' assessment of the risk that Zika poses to pregnant women and their children. [2] Despite this admission from Brazil
column37: the Zika propaganda campaign is moving ahead without interruption. The campaign will not be stopped by contrary evidence about Zika and microcephaly. Zika is a Mild Viral Infection Most people who get Zika
column38: will be completely unaware of being infected. For those who do get sick
column39: it is similar in many ways to having a cold or a mild case of the flu. People experience fever
column40: rash
column41: joint pain
column42: and conjunctivitis. The illness is usually mild with symptoms lasting from several days to a week. Infection is thought to provide lifelong immunity. Severe disease requiring hospitalization is uncommon. Deaths are rare. [3]The fact that almost no one dies from Zika infection made it a very unlikely candidate for the development of a vaccine. For those who actually feel sick from a Zika infection
column43: they can receive comfort care and rest while their immune systems overcome the viral illness. Zika Press Releases Set the Stage for a Propaganda Campaign However
column44: if Zika could be connected to some other horrible consequence
column45: such as microcephaly or paralysis (Guillain-Barre syndrome) for example
column46: then people would insist that we create a Zika vaccine and would insist that every person on planet Earth take it. They would be willing to give up basic individual freedoms for the benefit of society
column47: which is always the goal of mind control programs.In 2015
column48: a number of press releases and reports were released by the Pan American Health Organization / World Health Organization (PAHO/WHO) and the CDC
column49: to set the stage for the unfolding of a grand mind control project.The documents they published raised the red flag of alarm that a Zika epidemic was unfolding throughout South America and Mexico. The conventional media got excited about the epidemic when they saw the word ""microcephaly."" The prospect of large numbers of babies being born with abnormally small heads and brains was a story that would really grab the attention of their audience.The media used pictures of deformed babies to build fear in the hearts of people and to create the perception that we better watch out or Zika is going to get us and our babies! They worked really hard to instill public panic about Zika in January and February of 2016 .In the timeline that follows
