column1: Friday
column2: October 28
column3: 2016 by: Ethan A. Huff
column4: staff writer Tags: breast cancer
column5: mammography
column6: harming women (NaturalNews) Every year
column7: millions of women flock to their doctors to get their annual mammograms
column8: a breast cancer screening procedure that involves pressing a woman's breasts between two metal platforms to scope out tumors. But surgeons everywhere are starting to question the controversial practice
column9: which studies show isn't even an effective screening tool
column10: and is actually harmful to the bodies of women who receive it.The public is told that mammograms are the only way to catch breast cancer early
column11: but a review of eight scientific trials evaluating the procedure
column12: found that mammography is neither effective nor safe. After looking at data on more than 600
column13: 000 women between the ages of 39 and 74 who underwent the procedure on a routine basis
column14: researchers found that many women are misdiagnosed. Many of these same women are consequently mistreated with chemotherapy
column15: resulting in their rapid demise.As published in the Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews
column16: the review concluded that mammography causes more harm than good
column17: because many more women end up being misdiagnosed and mistreated than those actually avoiding the development of terminal breast cancer. Thus
column18: the procedure known as mammography is an outdated scourge that belongs in the history books of failed medical treatments
column19: and not at the forefront of women's medicine.""If we assume that screening reduces breast cancer mortality by 15% and that overdiagnosis and overtreatment is at 30%
column20: it means that for every 2000 women invited for screening throughout 10 years
column21: one will avoid dying of breast cancer and 10 healthy women
column22: who would not have been diagnosed if there had not been screening
column23: will be treated unnecessarily
column24: the authors concluded. Group of top medical experts admits mammography does more harm than good One year after this review was published
column25: a second one published in The New England Journal of Medicine (NEJM) came to a similar conclusion. A team of medical professionals that included a medical ethicist
column26: a clinical epidemiologist
column27: a pharmacologist
column28: an oncologic surgeon
column29: a nurse scientist
column30: a lawyer and a health economist
column31: decided that the medical industry's claims about the benefits of mammography are essentially bunk.They found that for every 1
column32: 000 women screened in the U.S. over a 10-year annual screening period beginning at age 50
column33: one breast cancer death would be prevented
column34: while a shocking 490 to 670 women would have a false positive
column35: while 70 to 100 would undergo an unnecessary biopsy. Between three and 14 of these women
column36: the study found
column37: would also be over-diagnosed for a non-malignant form of cancer that never even would have become ""clinically apparent.""This study out of Switzerland corroborates another out of Canada ‚Äì the 2014 Canadian National Breast Screening Study ‚Äì which concluded in lockstep with the others that mammography screenings do not reduce mortality rates from breast cancer any better than a simple physical examination. In other words
column38: the procedure is completely unnecessary
column39: and in many cases exceptionally harmful .And on and on the list goes
column40: with data out of Norway and elsewhere confirming that mammography isn't all that it's cracked up to be. U.S. data spanning the course of nearly 40 years shows that more women are over- or misdiagnosed with breast cancer because of mammograms than are successfully early-diagnosed with breast cancer in such a way as to protect against metastasization. This represents an exceptionally poor track record that calls into question why mammography continues to be used when it clearly doesn't work.""I believe that if you did have a tumor
column41: the last thing you would want to do is crush that tumor between two plates
column42: because that would spread it
column43: says general practitioner Dr. Sarah Mybill
column44: as quoted in the documentary film The Promise . column5: food fraud (NaturalNews) It seems that the more advanced human civilization becomes

column8: it has gone viral online on social media sites like Facebook
column9: with many people expressing disgust and outrage.The substance is often used in food as a thickening agent
column10: in particular for icing. But many people who have watched the video are labeling the Vietnamese factory and its workers as ""shameless"" and dishonest in their attempt to make the shrimp appear bigger and more meaty. In addition
column11: the practice makes one wonder what else is being done to shrimp or other food products
column12: not just in Vietnam
column13: but throughout the region. 'All local shrimp suppliers do this' Environmental protection organization Greenpeace recently released a report titled
column14: ""Dodgy Prawns
column15: as an aid for importers of shrimp to find sources that are harvested without using slave labor
column16: methods that are destructive or harmful to ocean ecosystems
column17: or that utilize toxic chemicals.The guide recommended shrimp harvested in and around Australia
column18: but also ""ecologically certified"" black tiger prawns from Vietnam. The organization also warned against all imported vannamei
column19: which very often is sourced from Vietnam
column20: because of concern about mangrove destruction
column21: pollution and the use of invasive species. Natural Blaze
column22: in reporting on the story
column23: noted that workers at the Vietnam shrimp preparation factory in question said they injected the shrimp there because ""all local shrimp suppliers do this.""The site noted further that the largest suppliers of shrimp products in Vietnam import more than half of their raw materials for processing from other countries
column24: including China
column25: which has a well-deserved reputation for unclean
column26: unsanitary food production.In the U.S.
column27: about 100 million pounds of shrimp ‚Äì or about 8 percent of the amount of shrimp Americans consume annually ‚Äì comes from Vietnam
column28: which in turn gets most of its shrimp from China
column29: where food regulation is a cruel joke. Added weight means additional profits Natural Blaze reported that after about $150 million worth of shrimp was imported into the U.S. from China between January and October 2015
column30: the U.S. Food and Drug Administration issued an import alert in December of that year. The alert warned importers of the ""presence of new animals' drugs and/or unsafe food additives"" in seafood originating in China
column31: and that included shrimp.The Daily Mail said that workers were injecting the shrimp with a substance known as carboxymethyl cellulose
column32: or CMC. Many say it is not considered harmful because it dissolves in water and becomes a smooth liquid before it is then pumped into the shrimp.But obviously CMC is not a naturally-occurring element either
column33: which means shrimp that it is injected into are no longer organic and natural . And the substance has been linked to diarrhea
column34: abdominal cramps
column35: eye pain and irritation
column36: and lingering changes in vision
column37: Natural Blaze noted.And yet its use in food continues. That's because wholesalers and retailers see a bigger profit margin in artificially inflating the size of shrimp that is then sold by weight. And even if retailers aren't doing the injecting
column38: they are knowingly selling a product that has been injected at the source. Sources:";english;2016-10-30T21:57:43.143+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;America's shrimp imports being injected with dangerous chemicals - just to add weight;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Food/Grilled-Shrimp.jpg;0;1;951;0;951;junksci

column2: staff writer;2016-10-30T13:00:00.000+02:00;Superbugs: Big Pharma to blame for coming death of 700

column1: Sunday
column2: October 30
column3: 2016 by: Ethan A. Huff
column4: staff writer Tags: superbugs
column5: antibiotics abuse
column6: Big Pharma (NaturalNews) As new guidelines set forth by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to curb antibiotic overuse and abuse on factory farms slowly come into effect
column7: the drug industry is apparently setting its greedy sights elsewhere ‚Äì towards countries where restrictions on antibiotic use are looser
column8: or simply where ""anything goes.""Livestock are the single biggest consumers of antibiotic drugs in the U.S. ‚Äì not by choice
column9: of course
column10: but because farmers have long been sold a bill of goods by Big Pharma when it comes to using them to bulk up their cattle more quickly and get them to market as fast as possible. It's a common practice that generates a lot of money in the short-term
column11: but a whole lot of problems in the long-term.The use of antibiotics on farms is arguably the biggest contributor to antibiotic resistance among humans
column12: where drugs that used to treat deadly bugs no longer do. The result is the emergence of so-called ""superbugs"" that are capable of outsmarting even the most potent antibiotics
column13: a phenomenon that's killing people by the hundreds of thousands.Some of the latest reports indicate that the superbug epidemic is claiming the lives of some 700
column14: 000 people annually all around the world. And if nothing is done now to stop the drug industry from continuing to poison the well
column15: so to speak
column16: then this number is expected to balloon more than 14-fold to 10 million lives lost by the year 2050.According to the World Health Organization (WHO)
column17: there are very few countries in the world with any sort of formidable plan in place to address antibiotic resistance. Even with the U.S. somewhat taking the lead with voluntary FDA suggestions on the matter
column18: none of this will stop drug companies from preying on the developing world that has yet to enact any sort of restrictions on antibiotic use.""They're international companies
column19: Gail Hansen
column20: a veterinarian and consultant who works with drug companies
column21: governments and nonprofit organizations
column22: told Bloomberg . ""What happens in the U.S. does certainly make a difference
column23: but it's not the only market they have."" Antibiotic resistance kills 10 times more people than opiate overdoses While it's become common practice for factory animal rearers to exploit antibiotics as a way to fatten their stocks more quickly and supposedly keep them healthy
column24: the use of these drugs for such purposes is disastrous for public health. Comparatively speaking
column25: only 69
column26: 000 people die from opiate overdoses globally
column27: which translates to 10 times more people dying from superbugs than from the most deadly pharmaceuticals on the market.Antibiotics are also overused in the realm of human medicine
column28: with some one-third of all prescriptions
column29: according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Pew Charitable Trusts
column30: being completely unnecessary. This translates to roughly 47 million prescriptions that aren't even helpful
column31: either because the patients have a viral infection
column32: or don't have an infection at all.The only way anything is going to change is if Big Pharma is barred from selling antibiotics to farmers whose only desire is to rush their animals to market for maximum profits. Doctors must also be reigned in and stopped from indiscriminately handing out antibiotics whenever their patients feel any kind of ailment ‚Äì and again
column33: these measures must have a global reach.""If some of the biggest responsible parties ‚Äì namely the companies making the products ‚Äì are still selling the antibiotics in other countries
column34: it just underscores that this has to be a change that happens across the entire world
column35: David Wallinga
column36: a senior health official and physician at the Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC)
column37: told Bloomberg .""And the companies bear a big responsibility for that approach."" Sources for this article include:";english;2016-10-30T21:57:45.045+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Superbugs: Big Pharma to blame for coming death of 700

column2: October 30

column5: China (NaturalNews) The Chinese food production industry is one of the world's least-regulated and most corrupt
column6: as has repeatedly been proven time and again. Now
column7: it appears
column8: there is no trusting anything that comes from China marked ""organic."" Natural Health 365 reports that several foods within the country are so contaminated that Chinese citizens don't trust them. What's more
column9: the countries that import these tainted foods are putting their citizens at risk.U.S. Customs personnel often turn away food shipments from China because they contain unsavory additives and drug residues
column10: are mislabeled
column11: or are just generally filthy. Some Chinese food exporters have responded by labeling their products ""organic
column12: though they are far from it.There are several factors at play which make Chinese claims of organic unreliable. First
column13: environmental pollution from unrestrained and unregulated industrial growth has so polluted soil and waterways with toxic heavy metals that nothing grown in them is safe
column14: much less organic. Also
column15: there is so much fraudulent labeling and rampant corruption within the government and manufacturing sectors that it's not smart to trust what is put on packaging.In fact
column16: farmers in China use water that is replete with heavy metals
column17: Natural Health 365 noted in a separate report . In addition
column18: water used for irrigation also contains organic and inorganic substances and pollutants. Chinese ""organic"" food is so contaminated that a person could get ill just by handling some of it. 'Dirty water' is all there is The report noted further:""This is reality ‚Äì all of China's grains
column19: vegetables and fruits are irrigated with untreated industrial wastewater. The Yellow River
column20: which is considered unusable
column21: supports major food producing areas in the northeast provinces.""Many Chinese farmers won't even eat the food they produce
column22: if you can believe that. That's because it's clear that China's water pollution issues are so pronounced that it threatens the country's entire food supply .Chinese farmers have said there is no available water for crops except "" dirty water ."" As part of the country's industrial prowess
column23: it is also one of the largest producers (and consumers) of fertilizers and pesticides
column24: Water Politics reported.The site noted further that as China's industrial might grows
column25: so too does the level of contaminants in the country's water supply. Lakes
column26: rivers
column27: streams and falling water tables are becoming more polluted by the year.In addition to man-made pollutants
column28: animals produce about 90 percent of the organic pollutants and half of the nitrogen in China's water
column29: say experts at the Chinese Academy for Environmental Planning. There are times when water is so polluted it turns black ‚Äì yet it is still used to irrigate crops
column30: and of course
column31: that affects so-called organic farming operations as well.These nine foods are particularly vulnerable to becoming tainted
column32: Natural Health 365 noted: Fish: Some 80 percent of the tilapia sold in the U.S. come from fish farms in China
column33: as well as half the cod. Water pollution in China is a horrible problem
column34: so any fish grown there are suspect. Chicken: Poultry produced in China is very often plagued with illnesses like avian flu. Apples and apple juice: Only recently has the U.S. moved to allow the importation of Chinese apples
column35: though American producers grow plenty for the country and the world. Rice: Though this is a staple in China and much of the rice in the U.S. comes from there
column36: some of it has been found to be made of resin and potato. Mushrooms: Some 34 percent of processed mushrooms come from China. Salt: Some salt produced in China for industrial uses has made its way to American dinner tables. Black pepper: One Chinese vendor was trying to pass off mud flakes as pepper. Green peas: Phony peas have been found in China made of soy
column37: green dye and other questionable substances. Garlic: About one-third of all garlic in the U.S. comes from China.Shop wisely.";english;2016-10-30T21:57:47.483+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Contaminated food from China now entering the U.S. under the 'organic' label;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Locations/China-Map-Close-Up-Country.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;junksci

column6: crop failures (NaturalNews) The utter failure of genetically-modified crops (GMOs) is once again on full display
column7: this time with crop products made by companies other than the usual Monsanto . A novel variety of transgenic corn produced and marketed by both Dow Chemical Corporation and DuPont is not exactly working as claimed
column8: new reports indicate
column9: and agricultural experts are urging the chemical industry to immediately cease selling these failed products to farmers.Known as ""Herculex
column10: the synthetic corn in question contains a gene modification that's supposed to prevent a pest known as the western bean cutworm from destroying crops. But so far
column11: the genetic alteration has done nothing to stop this worm
column12: which means farmers everywhere have been paying through their teeth for a technology that not only doesn't work
column13: but that's also proprietary and exceptionally costly
column14: especially when compared to non-GMO and organic crops that are open-source
column15: and are not patented or owned by multi-national corporations.A group of six entomologists published an open letter to the seed industry in a recent issue of Purdue University's Pest & Crop Newsletter
column16: calling on those involved to do the right thing and fess up to the fact that Herculex doesn't work. Farmers will soon be gearing up to plant next year's crops
column17: and they need to know that it's best to look elsewhere for corn that's not going to result in massive yield reductions.""People are frustrated and angry and
column18: more importantly
column19: yield was lost
column20: the letter states. ""Before growers make seed choices for 2017
column21: we again urge the seed industry to acknowledge the reality of what is happening in the field."" DuPont quietly admits Herculex doesn't work
column22: but refuses to take responsibility In typical corporate fashion
column23: the owners of Herculex are refusing to take the letter seriously
column24: resorting instead to excuses and legal speak to try to explain away the GM crop's failure. Rather than pull the Herculex product from the market
column25: DuPont
column26: according to Bloomberg
column27: has instead decided to merely decreased its efficiency rating in the company's 2017 Product Use Guide from ""very good"" to ""moderate.""DuPont has also issued an accompanying statement urging farmers to add other inputs to try to control cutworms
column28: including spraying additional chemical insecticides. In other words
column29: Herculex doesn't actually work
column30: and DuPont's solution is to have farmers just go ahead and blast away with all those endocrine-disrupting
column31: cancer-causing chemicals to kill anything and everything that might be living on or around the crop .It's basically the same advice that Monsanto is giving to farmers who foolishly adopted a similar GM corn product known as ""YieldGard"" that was supposed to deter the western corn root worm. The insecticidal proteins in this crop product
column32: just like the one in Herculex ‚Äì known as Cry1F ‚Äì haven't lived up to all the wild marketing claims
column33: and yet both Monsanto and DuPont's products continue to be sold to farmers.""Cry1F has failed in our states
column34: the letter continues

column40: dicamba

column1: 6475;328ffae07ba70c839fb59e96732a0ee790e570dd;0;David Gutierrez
column2: staff writer;2016-10-30T13:00:00.000+02:00;Compound found in onions has anti-ovarian cancer effects;"Compound found in onions has anti-ovarian cancer effects

column1: Sunday
column2: October 30
column3: 2016 by: David Gutierrez
column4: staff writer Tags: cancer prevention
column5: onions
column6: quercetin (NaturalNews) A chemical naturally occurring in onions may be able to suppress the proliferation of ovarian cancer cells
column7: and perhaps even initiate cancer cell death
column8: according to a study conducted by researchers from Kumamoto University in Japan
column9: and published in the journal Scientific Reports .These particular anticancer effects come from a chemical called onionin A (ONA). The study focused on the effects of ONA on the most common form of ovarian cancer
column10: epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC). This type of cancer has a five-year survival rate of only 40 percent. It is the 10th most common female cancer in the United States
column11: and the fifth most lethal form of cancer in women. As many as 80 percent of EOC patients relapse after their first course of chemotherapy. Kills cancer cells
column12: suppresses tumor growth In a prior study
column13: the researchers found that ONA suppressed the tumor-promoting activity of a type of white blood cells known as myeloid cells.In the new study
column14: researchers further examined cell-based models of EOCs. Firstly
column15: they found that the introduction of ONA caused EOC tumor growth to slow. Further examination showed that ONA was inhibiting the tumor-boosting activities of myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSCs)
column16: thereby confirming the findings of the prior study.Previous research has suggested that in the presence of cancer
column17: MDSCs may function to suppress anti-tumor activity by the rest of the immune system.The researchers also found that when combined with anti-cancer drugs
column18: ONA boosted the ability of the drugs to block cancer proliferation.""We found that ONA reduced the extent of ovarian cancer cell proliferation induced by co-culture with human macrophages
column19: the researchers wrote. ""In addition
column20: we found that ONA directly suppressed cancer cell proliferation.""The researchers then performed an additional experiment
column21: giving mice with EOC oral treatment with ONA and comparing them with a control group. They found that the mice given ONA lived longer
column22: and their tumors did not grow as aggressively. No side effects were observed from the treatment.The researchers concluded that with some additional testing
column23: ONA could be used as an oral cancer treatment.""ONA is considered useful for the additional treatment of patients with ovarian cancer owing to its suppression of the pro-tumor activation of [tumor-associated macrophages] and direct cytotoxicity against cancer cells
column24: they wrote.Studies have also linked onions to a lower risk of stomach and colorectal cancers. The overlooked superfood Scientists continue to uncover remarkable health benefits of the humble onion
column25: which is a staple food in every culture in which it is found.The benefits of onions start simply with their nutrient profile: These vegetables are highly nutrient dense
column26: delivering high levels of vitamins
column27: minerals and antioxidants
column28: with relatively few calories. A single cup of chopped onions contains 10 percent or more of the daily recommended amount of vitamin B6
column29: vitamin C and manganese
column30: and also contains calcium
column31: folate
column32: iron
column33: magnesium
column34: phosphorus and potassium. In addition to vitamin C
column35: onions are high in other antioxidants
column36: particularly quercetin . Antioxidants help protect the body from free radicals that cause chronic diseases such as heart disease and cancer.Researchers attribute many of onions' health benefits to quercetin
column37: including lower blood pressure and improved cardiovascular health. Quercetin is also a potent anti-inflammatory.Other benefits of onions may stem from some of the other nutrients it contains. Studies have shown that onions can help fight depression
column38: an effect that may come in part from their high folate content. Folate helps prevent a buildup in the body of homocysteine
column39: which in turn can suppress the production of mood-regulating neurotransmitters. Excess homocysteine can also interfere with sleep and appetite.Onions are a versatile food. The entire plant is edible (except for the small roots)
column40: and can be eaten in nearly any form. It can be cooked into recipes
column41: added raw on top of salads or sandwiches
column42: or used as an ingredient in dips and sauces. Sources for this article include:";english;2016-10-30T21:57:53.015+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Compound found in onions has anti-ovarian cancer effects;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Food/Bulk-Onions-Red-Brown-White-Vegetables.jpg;0;1;467;0;467;junksci

column1: 6476;611793a25a33b768c31816b6e1be941c5ec20507;0;David Gutierrez
column2: staff writer;2016-10-30T13:00:00.000+02:00;Why hydrogen peroxide should be in every home;"Why hydrogen peroxide should be in every home

column1: Sunday
column2: October 30
column3: 2016 by: David Gutierrez
column4: staff writer (NaturalNews) Inexpensive
column5: nontoxic
column6: versatile and potent: Hydrogen peroxide is a wonder product that belongs in every home.Hydrogen peroxide is widely known as a disinfectant for minor cuts and scrapes
column7: but many people don't understand that it works simply by oxidizing microbes to death. Hydrogen peroxide is simply water with an extra oxygen atom attached; in this unstable form
column8: the oxygen breaks off from the water and forms a free radical solution that is highly reactive. But once it has reacted
column9: the only byproducts are non-reactive oxygen and water. This is why
column10: when used properly
column11: hydrogen peroxide is so safe.Hydrogen peroxide is so safe and effective that our own immune systems actually generate it as the first line of defense against microbes as diverse as bacteria
column12: viruses
column13: yeast and parasites. In this context
column14: it also appears to act as an anti-inflammatory. Natural remedies So how can you make hydrogen peroxide work for you? Unsurprisingly
column15: many of this product's greatest uses are as natural cures or for some other health-promoting function. For example
column16: a nasal spray made from one tablespoon of 3 percent hydrogen peroxide in a cup of non-chlorinated water can be an effective treatment for sinus infections. Toothaches caused by minor infection can be treated with a hydrogen peroxide mouthwash; the same mouthwash can also remove bad breath.If you think you're coming down with a cold
column17: stave it off by placing a few drops of hydrogen peroxide in your ears each morning.Hydrogen peroxide is also a potent anti-fungal. A 50‚Äì50 mix of hydrogen peroxide and water
column18: sprayed on the feet every night and allowed to dry
column19: is a good way to get rid of athlete's foot and other fungal infections. A similar (but much more diluted) cure can be used on plants suffering from fungus; in this case
column20: dissolve half a cup of hydrogen peroxide in a gallon of water and spray on the affected plant. Replace your cosmetics! You can also get lots of use from hydrogen peroxide around the home. Mixed with baking soda
column21: it makes a great toothpaste. It can also be used to protect water that you expect to be standing for a while
column22: such as that in a humidifier or steamer ‚Äì a pint of hydrogen peroxide mixed in will prevent microbial growth. Similarly
column23: you can use hydrogen peroxide as a toilet bowl cleaner; let it sit for 20 minutes and then scrub.When properly diluted
column24: hydrogen peroxide can detox your skin by stripping away harmful environmental toxins. Just mix 2 quarts of hydrogen peroxide into a full bathtub and soak for half an hour or more.Other cosmetic uses of hydrogen peroxide include cleaning your contact lenses ‚Äì it denatures proteins that build up on the lenses ‚Äì or helping to remove ear wax buildup. A few drops in the ears
column25: followed by a few drops of olive oil
column26: will cause earwax to break up and drain out.Hydrogen peroxide can also be used as a safer
column27: gentler alternative to bleach for lightening your hair. Household uses Hydrogen peroxide isn't just for your body; it can also be for your dog's! Hydrogen peroxide can induce rapid vomiting in dogs that have swallowed dangerous objects. Vomiting should only be induced upon a vet's recommendation
column28: however.Finally
column29: hydrogen peroxide can be great for your clothing. Use it instead of bleach to whiten your laundry. More carefully applied
column30: it can take out organic stains by breaking apart the proteins causing the discoloration. This is particularly effective with blood.Use caution when applying hydrogen peroxide directly to clothing
column31: as it may bleach or discolor some fabrics. But if you have a fresh
column32: organic stain
column33: you should be fine if you pour on just a small amount of hydrogen peroxide
column34: wait a few minutes (it should foam)
column35: and then rinse it off with cold water and soap. Sources for this article include:";english;2016-10-30T21:57:54.117+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Why hydrogen peroxide should be in every home;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/AlternativeHealth/Food-Grade-Hydrogen-Peroxide-Bottle.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;junksci

column1: 6477;a0614586d670f7a48c865b67fc5910b6544186f5;0;Amy Goodrich;2016-10-29T14:00:00.000+03:00;Did you know that cinnamon can boost intelligence?;"Did you know that cinnamon can boost intelligence?
Saturday
column2: October 29
column3: 2016 by: Amy Goodrich Tags: cinnamon
column4: intelligence
column5: Parkinsons disease (NaturalNews) Cinnamon is one of the world's most consumed spices. For thousands of years
column6: it has been prized for its medicinal properties and sweet
column7: warming taste. Aside from sprinkling cinnamon on top of your lattes or adding magic to grandma's apple pie
column8: researchers have found that consuming this tasty household spice also might enhance learning skills.Scientists at Rush University Medical Center in Chicago found that increased ingestion of cinnamon significantly improved the memory of ""poor learning"" mice. Recently
column9: their findings were published in the Journal of Neuroimmune Pharmacology in an article entitled ""Cinnamon Converts Poor Learning Mice to Good Learners: Implications for Memory Improvement.""The study was supported by grants from the National Institutes of Health
column10: the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
column11: and the Alzheimer's Association. How cinnamon affects the brain For the study
column12: lead researcher Kalipada Pahan
column13: a neurology professor at Rush University Medical Center
column14: and his team zoomed in on two key proteins
column15: GABRA5 and CREB
column16: located in the hippocampus region of the brain. The hippocampus is a small part of the brain that generates
column17: organizes
column18: and stores memory. Previous research has shown that lower levels of CREB and higher levels of GABRA5 occur in the brain of poor learners.To see if ground cinnamon could improve the memory of slow learners
column19: the researchers took a group of mice and placed them in a maze with 20 holes. The experiment was focused on watching the mice learn how to locate their target hole.When they tested the mice again after one month of cinnamon feeding
column20: the researchers found that the mice determined to be poor learners had significantly improved their memory and learning skills. They could find their target hole twice as fast.Pahan and his team explained that when cinnamon is ingested the body converts it into sodium benzoate
column21: a chemical compound used to treat brain damage. Furthermore
column22: they discovered that when benzoate entered the mice's brains
column23: it increased CREB
column24: decreased GABRA5
column25: and stimulated hippocampal neurons
column26: which led to improved memory and learning skills.""We have successfully used cinnamon to reverse biochemical
column27: cellular and anatomical changes that occur in the brains of mice with poor learning
column28: Pahan said.However
column29: no significant improvements were seen in the mice that were considered good learners. But Pahan added that if these results could be replicated in slow learning students
column30: cinnamon could become one of the safest and easiest approaches to convert weaker students to good learners. Cinnamon may halt the progression of Parkinson's disease Pahan and his colleagues previously found that cinnamon had a positive effect on the brains of mice with Parkinson's disease. When cinnamon transforms into sodium benzoate
column31: it works to protect the neurons
column32: normalize brain cells
column33: and improve communication within the brain
column34: which slows down the progression of the disease.Given their promising results
column35: Pahan and his team - supported by grants from the National Institutes of Health ‚Äì plan on moving forward with testing in human patients with Parkinson's disease.""This could potentially be one of the safest approaches to halt disease progression in Parkinson's patients
column36: Pahan said. ""It would be a remarkable advance in the treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative disease
column37: he added.Before starting to add cinnamon to all your dishes
column38: know that not all cinnamon is created equal. Pahan explained that there are two major types of cinnamon available in the United States - Chinese or cassia cinnamon and Ceylon cinnamon. While both metabolize into sodium benzoate
column39: Ceylon cinnamon is much better than Chinese cinnamon. Chinese cinnamon contains coumarin
column40: a molecule that can damage the liver . Sources:";english;2016-10-30T21:58:03.508+02:00;naturalnews.com;US;6416.0;Did you know that cinnamon can boost intelligence?;0.0;http://www.naturalnews.com/gallery/640/Food/Cinnamon-Sticks-Tied-Twine-Closeup.jpg;0;1;628;0;628;junksci

column11: the EPA's inspector general said that the agency had the authority and enough information to issue emergency orders to protect Flint residents from the lead-contaminated water they were drinking as early as June 2015
column12: seven months before officials finally declared an emergency.Inspector General Arthur Elkins said in an interim report that the water crisis should have created ""a greater sense of urgency"" for the EPA to ""intervene when the safety of drinking water is compromised."" Everyone is pointing fingers at everyone else The drinking water in Flint became tainted with unsafe levels of lead after city officials decided to begin drawing from the Flint River in April 2014

column1: We all know about the popular and ancient practice of oil pulling
column2: but many of us don‚Äôt understand how this practice works or how exactly it benefits our teeth! Oil pulling began in Ayurvedic medicine thousands of years ago and has achieved widespread popularity in modern society today.

column1: But the question remains‚Äîdoes it help your smile? And how?
The Claims of Oil Pulling
Let‚Äôs take a look at each of these popular claims of oil pulling!
It makes your mouth healthier. By pulling out bad bacteria that can cause cavities and gum disease
column2: oil pulling can actually make your mouth healthier and even stop chronic bad breath.

column1: It whitens teeth. Research has not proved this
column2: but some people claim they get whiter teeth with oil pulling. This should be considered a side effect of oil pulling (albeit a great one) rather than its main purpose.

column1: It heals cavities. Oil pulling can remove the bacteria and plaque that cause tooth decay
column2: but typically oil pulling alone is not enough to heal cavities. You need to stop eating so much sugar
column3: get more vitamins and minerals (such as K
column4: D
column5: and calcium)
column6: and switch your toothpaste to help heal cavities with oil pulling!

column1: It cures disease. Ancient cultures used oil pulling as a way to draw out toxins from the mouth to prevent them from affecting the body. Research doesn‚Äôt show whether or not oil pulling can help any type of disease
column2: but research does link oral health to body health‚Äîso a healthy mouth could help you prevent heart disease
column3: respiratory illnesses
column4: and even cognitive decline!

column1: What the Research Says
Now that we‚Äôve seen the popular claims of oil pulling
column2: let‚Äôs find out what modern research actually says about this age-old practice.

column1: Research shows that oil pulling can actually the stop inflammation
column2: bacteria
column3: plaque
column4: and bad breath associated with gum disease
column5: therefore it may be an effective treatment for gum disease combined with a healthy diet and great oral health practices!

column1: It can decrease the likelihood of tooth decay and reduce overall plaque content in the mouth. Oil pulling can also help prevent tooth loss and oral diseases such as oral cancer
column2: periodontal disease
column3: and oral thrush. Oil pulling may be able to reverse tooth decay
column4: but only when combined with other healthy practices.

column1: Although research hasn‚Äôt proved that oil pulling helps decrease your chances for developing chronic disease
column2: keeping your mouth healthy and free of toxins can benefit your whole body!

column1: The Verdict
If you want to give oil pulling a try
column2: do this practice every day: put a tablespoon of oil in your mouth (preferably sesame or coconut) and swish it around for up to twenty minutes as soon as you wake up. Spit out in the trash
column3: then brush and floss your teeth as normal. Easy!

column1: The verdict is in: oil pulling can help you get a beautiful and healthy smile
column2: but it should not replace regular brushing and flossing as your oral care routine. Practice oil pulling first thing in the morning before you eat or brush
column3: then enjoy the benefits of a healthy smile without giving up your brushing and flossing habits! column4: water

column1: There was a time when my son‚Äôs eczema became so severe I was willing to try any natural healing method. My baby was 5 months old when he developed eczema. We tried the usual dose of steroids and over-the-counter creams from our family doctor. It got so bad that his scars were not healing. He wasn‚Äôt sleeping. And I wasn‚Äôt sleeping. As a child
column2: my mother took me to an Acupuncturist for migraines. And the migraines stopped after a handful of visits. I remember it being a pretty relaxing experience with the smell of incense and herbs and the quietness of the room. So
column3: I took a leap of faith and booked us for an appointment with a Traditional Chinese Doctor who specialized in skin disorders
column4: allergies
column5: and asthma. Why Try Acupuncture & Traditional Chinese Medicine? Reason 1: Acupuncture has been practiced for almost 4000 years in China.

column1: With that much history
column2: it‚Äôs worth a try. It is a method of relieving pain or curing an illness by placing needles in the patient‚Äôs body at precise points along the 12 meridians in the body. Meridians are energy pathways that are associated with different organs within the body. The World Health Organization lists 300 ailments that are treatable by Chinese Medicine & Acupuncture. Reason 2: Acupuncture has helped children with eczema

column1: In a study of 37 children who were treated with Chinese Medicinal herbs
column2: the treatment reduced eczema symptoms by 90% in 18 of the children (see Sources). Although it was a small study size
column3: the benefits seem to far outweigh the risks. When my son was a baby
column4: even a 10% improvement in his symptoms would have been amazing for us. Reason 3: Acupuncture does not hurt babies

column1: Many people worry about the needles hurting. But the needles that Acupuncturists use are about 1/100 th of a syringe needle. My son was a baby when we started the treatments
column2: and he never cried out when getting the needles in him. Reason 4: Acupuncture relieved my baby‚Äôs eczema by 80%

column1: Acupuncture healed the eczema to the point where we could figure out his triggers. Our doctor stabilized the eczema. Best of all
column2: flare-ups only occurred when my baby was teething. His skin was softer than it had been in months. Acupuncture needs to be done on babies for a minimum of 3 months in order to see an improvement. This is because the treatment is trying to alter the immune response
column3: which is a long process. But sometimes babies will respond quicker than that. We used a topical herb powder given to us by the doctor
column4: and applied it to his skin. This topical mix had a similar effect as hydro-cortisone cream if I applied it 3-5 times per day with a cotton ball. Reason 5: Acupuncture is affordable

column1: This is true especially if you go to a student clinic. You can pay the affordable price and yet the students are supervised by very experienced doctors. For child and baby treatments
column2: it is even more affordable. It cost us about $15-$30 per visit on average (we tried a few different clinics). Some health plans will cover Acupuncture
column3: so check with your health plan to see if yours covers it. To keep it affordable
column4: I suggest trying to find a specialist in Acupuncture & TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine)
column5: not a practitioner who does many different types of treatments. Tips for Helping Your Child While Getting Acupuncture

column1: Bring a favorite stuffed animal
column2: a book
column3: or some toys. Try nursing your baby while they are receiving acupuncture. A baby only needs the needle in the acupressure point for a second and then they are pulled out. Adults typically have needles in for 45+ minutes for each treatment
column4: because our bodies do not respond as quickly as babies‚Äô bodies do. Check out my YouTube video for more tips! Find an Experienced & Accredited Acupuncturist

column1: Make sure to look for an Accredited Acupuncturist or TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine) Doctor. Be sure the Acupuncturist has some experience in your condition. Chat with the people in the waiting room. And see if they‚Äôve had success with your doctor. I met a few moms in the waiting room that swore by the Chinese Doctor we were going to see. That made me feel more comfortable.
Find a TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine) Doctor who offers Certified Organic Chinese herbs. ‚ÄúCertified Organic‚Äù means the herbs were never sprayed with toxic pesticides and herbicides. As well
column2: there have been some reports of heavy metals residue in Chinese herbs. Herbs are just as powerful as prescription medications and can have adverse effects if used improperly. Make sure to ask about the testing done on the herbs that you or your baby are prescribed. Every Condition Has Different Treatment Needs

column1: Check with your family doctor to be sure you don‚Äôt have any conditions that would prevent you from using Acupuncture or Chinese Medicine. Rosemary Hansen is a published author and devoted Mama. She is passionate about healing eczema naturally. Rosemary is a self-taught organic

column1: When most people think about their eye health
column2: the first thing that comes to mind is whether or not they need to wear glasses. Although your vision is a major part of your overall eye health
column3: there are actually many more things that you need to be concerned about. For example
column4: there are a staggering 56 common disorders that can plague your eyes. These issues range from cataracts to ocular migraines. Fortunately
column5: there are many natural methods you can utilize to help keep your eyes healthy.

column1: Nutrients Your Eyes Need
There are three nutrients that are known to be critical for maintaining healthy eyes: Lutein
column2: zeaxanthin and meso-zeaxanthin. Each of these nutrients serves as an antioxidant that helps protect your eyes from the damaging effects of free radicals. As Natural News has pointed out before
column3: free radicals are the main basis of all injuries
column4: illnesses and deaths.

column1: Antioxidants are the only way to fight free radicals
column2: so it‚Äôs a good thing that these three nutrients are found naturally in the human eye. But what happens when something interrupts this process? Sadly
column3: you can end up with a long list of eye health problems that may even lead to blindness.

column1: Instead of merely sitting back and allowing this to happen
column2: you can be proactive and start taking supplements. The good news is that lutein and zeaxanthin supplements are easy to find. Research has discovered that most of these supplements also contain meso-zeaxanthin
column3: although this isn‚Äôt usually disclosed on the label. In fact
column4: it sounds likely that this recently discovered eye nutrient is a natural byproduct of lutein and zeaxanthin.

column1: Of course
column2: this doesn‚Äôt absolve the supplement companies of their duty to report whether or not meso-zeaxanthin is present in their products. However
column3: their negligence also doesn‚Äôt reduce the natural reliance that your eyes have on all three of these nutrients. In addition to stocking up on these supplements
column4: it is also wise to increase your intake of other naturally occurring antioxidants
column5: including Vitamin E
column6: Vitamin C and beta carotene.

column1: Food Sources

There are many foods that contain antioxidants . Carrots are perhaps the most well-known resource for eye health because they are so rich in beta carotene. It would be a mistake to think of carrots as the prime resource
column2: though. You can also turn to oranges
column3: tomatoes
column4: sweet potatoes and dark berries for a mixture of necessary vitamins. These are some of the best foods for eye health. Even better
column5: you can derive lutein and zeaxanthin directly from food sources such as eggs
column6: pistachios
column7: corn
column8: peppers and kale. With enough of these food items in your diet
column9: you can avoid the cost of supplements while still keeping your eyes extremely healthy.

column1: Additional Eye Health Tips
If you are a smoker who is also concerned about eye health
column2: now is a good time to carefully consider quitting. Unfortunately
column3: people who smoke have an increased risk of developing macular degeneration
column4: optic nerve damage and cataracts. If you begin abstaining from tobacco products now
column5: though
column6: your odds of ending up with one of these eye health complications will begin to decline.

column1: Other easy steps you can take to protect your eyes include always wearing sunglasses during sunny days and steering clear of computer screens as much as possible. If you use a computer for work
column2: take a 20 second vision break every 20 minutes.

column1: Ultimately
column2: combining the proper nutrients with easy tips such as wearing sunglasses will help keep your eyes healthy throughout your life. If you‚Äôre currently dealing with issues such as light sensitivity and vision loss
column3: you may also be able to naturally regain control of your eye health by using natural vision training and other eye exercises. This is definitely a better option than undergoing a surgery that has an extensive list of serious risks and usually leaves patients still needing eyeglasses. As usual
column4: the natural way is better!

column1: About the author:
Jade Rich is an LPN and Director at an Inpatient Rehabilitation Center. As a mother of three children
column2: she is always looking for natural ways to keep her kid‚Äôs eyes healthy. She knows from experience that another way to do this is by scheduling them for routine eye exams. This helps with early detection and prevention. It‚Äôs best to schedule this during the back-to-school season. During the visit
column3: their pediatrician examines their eye alignment and gives a test for visual acuity.

column23: heart disease

column1: Tuesday

column4: protestors
column5: police violence (NaturalNews) Tensions are ratcheting up in a region of North Dakota where construction of a pipeline that will take oil to a refinery facility in Illinois is being built
column6: as protestors objecting to the project are clashing with increasingly militarized police . The Bismark Tribune reported that police and protestors clashed as authorities moved in to break up a camp on private property belonging to the pipeline developers.Protestors had initially formed a line of no surrender
column7: the paper said
column8: but it became a line of retreat in the face of a militarized police presence that overwhelmed hundreds of Dakota Access Pipeline protestors
column9: pushing them back from the front line of resistance to their main camp.For about five hours on Thursday
column10: beginning around noon
column11: police officers pressed the protesters back about a half-mile on N.D. Highway 1806
column12: which was away from a new camp they had built earlier in the week that sat directly atop the pipeline easement. Rubber bullets
column13: bean bags
column14: smoke grenades and tasers Unrest continued into the evening hours
column15: however
column16: as police said that two fires were started on a nearby bridge
column17: and protestors began lobbing Molotov cocktails at officers. In addition
column18: police reported two incidents where shots were fired.The Tribune reported that one woman allegedly fired a handgun in the direction of police as she was being arrested
column19: while an armed man who was reportedly run off the road by protesters
column20: and was perhaps not connected to the protest
column21: had to be treated for a gunshot wound to the hand.As police moved in
column22: some protestors were urging calm and prayer
column23: but others threw rocks and water bottles at approaching officers. Eventually the crowd retreated under a barrage of pepper spray
column24: rubber and bean bag bullets
column25: smoke grenades and tasers.By late afternoon
column26: flames and thick plumes of smoke belched out of the cab of one of three Dakota Access Pipeline earth movers
column27: while protestors walked back to their main camp on U.S. Army Corps of Engineers' land.In all
column28: police arrested 141 people
column29: the local sheriffs' department said
column30: charging suspects with engaging in a riot
column31: maintaining a public nuisance
column32: and conspiracy to endanger by fire and explosion.A day before the violence
column33: as reported by AMI Newswire
column34: opponents of the pipeline barricaded a highway and pitched their camp on private land. These actions were led by members of the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe.The previous weekend some 127 people had been arrested.Standing Rock Chairman Dave Archambault II issued a statement last week in which he blamed the rising militarization of police for the increased tensions.""The militarization of local law enforcement and enlistment of multiple law enforcement agencies from neighboring states is needlessly escalating violence and unlawful arrests against peaceful protesters at Standing Rock
column35: Archambault said
column36: as quoted by AMI Newswire . ""We do not condone reports of illegal actions
column37: but believe the majority of peaceful protesters are reacting to strong-arm tactics and abuses by law enforcement."" Destruction of burial grounds
column38: water are chief concerns Law enforcement officers countered by saying that
column39: for the vast majority of the protest thus far
column40: they have shown remarkable patience and restraint
column41: and that they only moved after protestors became more aggressive.Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier ticked off a list of alleged violations by protestors
column42: including buzzing a police helicopter with a drone and firing arrows in the direction of officers. He also said that journalists had been harassed and security personnel assaulted.""For months protesters have described us as an aggressive police force
column43: Kirchmeier said in a prepared statement
column44: AMI Newswire reported. ""We have done nothing but demonstrate patience and restraint.""Protestors are angry about the pipeline stretching across ancient burial grounds
column45: NewsTarget reported

column1: 6502;e7b9cf4937ccbef1848f4250cc353269424f829b;0;Amy Goodrich;2016-11-01T13:00:00.000+02:00;Health experts share the top home remedies for fighting a cold;"Health experts share the top home remedies for fighting a cold

column2: November 01

column4: natural remedies
column5: immune booster (NaturalNews) Stay well during the colder months with these simple
column6: time-tested home remedies to prevent a common cold
column7: help shorten the duration and get you feeling better in no time. A common cold is caused by a virus
column8: so there is no point in taking antibiotics which only kill bacteria. While there is a host of over-the-counter remedies available to soothe the symptoms of a common cold
column9: nature offers far better and safer solutions.We all know the prevention drill. Load up on immune boosting foods rich in vitamin C
column10: exercise regularly and wash your hands often. But what else is there you can do to avoid a runny nose
column11: sore throat or a cough? Seven Health editors reveal their sickness-preventing secrets. Gargle salt water If you feel the first signs of a scratchy throat

column13: executive deputy editor
column14: recommends a salt-water gargle. She is convinced that it has stopped countless of her colds. To soothe a sore throat and kill the sick-making germs
column15: combine half a teaspoon salt with one cup of water and gargle. Repeat several times a day until scratchiness disappears. Create some heat According to Clare McHugh
column16: editor-in-chief
column17: a hot bath or shower is the thing you need. She explains that viruses that cause a common cold don't like the heat and are discouraged to multiply if you keep your body warm. And why not add immune boosting and cold fighting essential oils to your bathtub to enhance the healing effect?Furthermore
column18: you could try the good old hot water bottle to help loosen phlegm and deep congestions in the chest. Swallow raw garlic If you don't mind to sweat it out and have a garlic breath

column20: executive editor
column21: recommends eating or swallowing raw garlic. While the next day her symptoms usually get worse
column22: she feels better in 3 days.If you cannot stomach garlic's taste and spiciness
column23: then you might want to go with the traditional garlic cure which consists of garlic
column24: lemon
column25: and honey. Crush one clove of garlic and add it to a cup of warm water with one teaspoon of honey and the juice of one lemon. Give it a good stir and repeat this remedy two to three times a day for the duration of your symptoms. Take Echinacea Michael Gollust
column26: the research editor
column27: swears by echinacea lozenges. He says that while they don't stop a cold in its tracks
column28: they definitely reduce the severity of the symptoms. The BBC
column29: however
column30: reports on a comprehensive review that scanned the literature and included only the very best studies
column31: showing that people who use echinacea may also have 10 to 20 percent less chance to catch a common cold. Stay hydrated Most Health experts agree that hydration is essential for a speedy recovery. Anthea Levi
column32: the editorial assistant
column33: adds that if you are struggling with blocked sinuses
column34: adding lemon juice and cayenne pepper to your glass of water is all you need to breathe freely again. Go to bed early They often say sleep is one the best natural doctors. Tomoko Takeda Canel
column35: the acting beauty director
column36: couldn't agree more. When she gets sick
column37: she cancels all her plans
column38: has a light meal and then prioritizes an early bedtime to get better.Next time you get a cold

column40: and you won't need over-the-counter drugs that can do more harm than good. column7: produced by the pharmaceutical company Mallinckrodt
column8: just wasn't up to snuff. And now
column9: the FDA seems to finally be making moves to pull this inferior product off the shelves.Generic drugs are approved by the FDA through their abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) process. In the ANDA process
column10: the federal agency is primarily focused on data that shows the generic drug is a bioequivalent for the reference listed drug
column11: or what many people refer to as the ""brand name"" drug.The term ""bioequivalent"" means that there is no substantial differences in bioavailability between a generic drug and the brand name product. Specifically
column12: it suggests that the extent and rate of absorption of two drug equivalents over the same period of time
column13: at the same dose and under the same conditions
column14: should exhibit similar results. As the FDA explains on their website
column15: ""The generic version must deliver the same amount of active ingredients into a patient's bloodstream in the same amount of time as the pioneer drug.""Unsurprisingly
column16: discrepancies in actual equivalence are often discovered after a generic has been approved.Mallinckrodt's Concerta generic is not the only brand name knock-off under fire. Kremers Urban Pharmaceuticals
column17: a subsidiary of the Lannett Company
column18: also manufactures a generic form of the medication that the FDA's Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER) has deemed insufficient.As reported by the Regulatory Affairs Professionals Society: CDER tracked the issues from December 2013 through June 2014
column19: ran a re-analysis of bioequivalence data and ""determined that the Mallinckrodt product may deliver methylphenidate into the body at a slower rate than Concerta during the time period of 7 to 12 hours post-dosing."" Following the CDER's findings
column20: Mallinckrodt filed a lawsuit
column21: which was thrown out by a Maryland federal judge. The pharmaceutical company has since declined to voluntarily withdraw their product from the marketplace. And according to the FDA
column22: the drug manufacturer has yet to submit any new data or information that confirms the bioequivalence of their product to Concerta.Similarly
column23: the CDER concluded in June of 2014 that the data on the Kremers product is insufficient to determine whether or not their generic product is therapeutically equivalent to Concerta. In November that year
column24: the FDA announced that their product was not sufficiently equivalent to the name brand.Both manufacturers may submit a request for a hearing to the FDA within the next month so they can attempt to show why approval for their drugs shouldn't be withdrawn.Of course
column25: the FDA's concerns about the apparent lack of efficacy seen in these generic drugs is rather ironic
column26: given the magnitude of other concerns surrounding these drugs. In 2006
column27: a CBS News report revealed that 25 people died and 54 more suffered serious cardiovascular problems following the use of ADHD medication
column28: in a period of just four years.That may not seem like a lot
column29: but is important to recall that the FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS)
column30: which is used to track such events
column31: is a voluntary system. Only drug manufacturers are required to report adverse events ‚Äì if they know about them. Doctors
column32: patients and family members are under no such obligation. PSQH reports that drug safety experts estimate that only about 10 percent of all adverse events will even be reported ‚Äì who is to say how many people have been harmed by ADHD medications (and other drugs) and don't know it or haven't reported it?The FAERS website itself states that because of its own limitations
column33: ""FAERS data cannot be used to calculate the incidence of an adverse event or medication error in the U.S. population."" And yet
column34: in spite of this very statement
column35: the FDA itself used this information to form a safety report?Over the years
column36: several ADHD medications
column37: like Adderall XR
column38: have been linked to sudden death
column39: cardiovascular problems and psychosis. According to Consumer Reports
column40: the long-term safety of these drugs has not been evaluated or studied sufficiently
column41: and there is evidence to suggest that the benefit of such drugs wears off after about two years. Many kids take ADHD medication for quite a bit longer than that.In spite of all of this
column42: the FDA has yet to pull these drugs from the shelves
column43: and is instead concerned with drugs that aren't strong enough. Medications that don't work obviously don't belong in the marketplace. However
column44: drugs that are killing children don't belong there either. column1: Joint pain prevents us from exercising or doing simple tasks like walking. Unfortunately
column2: it only gets worse as we age. This happens because the fluid (synovial fluid) in the joints reduces as we age. Reduction of this fluid increases friction on the joints and leads to arthritis.

column1: But research also shows that uric acid can cause arthritis. Build-up of uric acid in the joints can damage joint tissues and cause pain. The build-up happens when the kidneys don‚Äôt excrete enough uric acid. It can also be triggered by the body converting purines to uric acid fast. Long-term build-up of uric acid can cause inflammation and reduce your mobility.
Switch to an Alkaline Diet
There‚Äôs been a never-ending argument about whether alkaline diets reduce acidity in the body or not. In fact
column2: some experts have discredited them as useless. But what does research say? Well
column3: this study found that alkaline diet enhances excretion of uric acid through urine. On the other hand
column4: researchers found that acidic foods reduce excretion of uric acid.

column1: Another study affirms that alkaline diets can help reduce uric acid in the body. And they can prevent uric acid crystallization in joints.
Note that more research needs to be conducted on effect of diet on uric acid crystal.
Eat these alkaline foods

You simply need to reduce intake of acidic foods and eat more alkaline foods. Alkaline foods are mostly vegetables and legumes. column1: 17. Orange juice: Oranges are rich in vitamin C which cleans the arteries and prevents oxidation of blood.

column2: lower blood pressure and improve heart health.

column1: I‚Äôm sure you have heard about fermented foods and are wondering if this is just a fad. Here are some reasons why fermented foods should not be just a fad but a food group to keep in your diet daily. What are Fermented Foods?

Bacteria and yeast are used as part of the fermentation process that gives these foods a nutritional boost. The bacteria convert sugars and starches into lactic acid through a process called lacto-fermentation. The yeast undergoes a process called ethanol fermentation.

These yeasts and bacteria that undergo the fermentation process boosts the nutritional content of the food. What it does to the food Provides beneficial bacteria that promote gut health Provides beneficial enzymes Increases the amount of B vitamins
column2: biotin
column3: and folate. Increases the bioavailability of minerals. Provides short chain fatty acids (which helps to improve your immune function) Provides you with GABA
column4: your calming neurotransmitter How can eating fermented foods help me? Optimize your Gut Health

column3: antibiotics
column4: unknown food allergies

column1: Ideally you want more ‚Äúgood‚Äù bacteria populating your gut as opposed to ‚Äúbad‚Äù bacteria. Fermented foods can help shift the balance since most people who consume the Standard American ‚Äúcrap food‚Äù diet have a disrupted microbiome.
So
column2: you can take all the supplements in the world

column1: A healthy gut can help to balance and support your endocrine system
column2: immune system

column4: and nervous system. So

column3: flu
column4: allergies and more. Almost 80% of your immune system is found in your gut
column5: thus

column1: Asthma and autoimmune conditions
column2: among numerous other health issues
column3: are all linked to having fewer good bacteria in your gut. The less diverse your microbiota is

column1: Adding in probiotic rich fermented foods can also shorten the duration of a cold or upper respiratory infection. Aid in weight loss

Studies show that those with certain healthy bacteria in their gut can maintain a healthy weight while those with more negative strains have a greater incidence of gaining weight/difficulty losing weight. Obese people have different gut bacteria than lean individuals.
In a 2011 study
column2: it was found that kimchee had a significant impact on weight and body fat of those who are overweight and obese in the study. In a 2010 study
column3: obese people were assigned to drink fermented milk for 12 weeks. Those that drank the fermented milk had significant fat loss as compared to the control group. Digestive/Bowel Issue Improvement

column3: has shown to improve symptoms of IBS and IBD. Research has shown that anywhere from 50 to 75% of those who make this change (Adding in fermented foods) will notice a significant difference in their IBS symptoms. Improved mental health

column1: The gut is considered your second brain. A healthy gut therefore can mean a healthy brain. Several probiotic strains have been shown to reduce symptoms of depression and anxiety in short term studies. For this reason
column2: to get more variety of probiotic strains
column3: it is best to not stick with the same fermented food to eat over and over. Mix it up; for instance

column5: kombucha the next

column1: Many of you know that GABA is your calming neurotransmitter. But did you know that fermented foods can supply you with GABA too? Oral administration of fermented rice bran and other traditional fermented foods have been shown to increase GABA content significantly! Whereas GABA in the oral form may have limited benefits due to absorption issues.
Another study looking at 700 college students found that those who ate a variety of fermented foods has less negative emotions than before such as anxiety
column2: fear
column3: moodiness
column4: worry
column5: envy
column6: frustration
column7: and loneliness.

column1: It is possible that the fermented foods not only healed leaky gut but also provided some needed GABA. Even in psychiatry they are starting to recognize the benefits of fermented foods for mood disorders. Reduce the risk of brain diseases such as Alzheimer‚Äôs.
Some scientists have recently begun to consider the possibility that Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease is in fact an autoimmune disease. And as many of you may know
column2: having one autoimmune condition puts you at risk for more autoimmune conditions down the road. For any autoimmune disease
column3: the immune system must be supported. So
column4: it would make sense that gut health needs to be addressed for AD. If you want to support your brain than I suggest that you add in fermented foods.

column1: Along with the benefits above
column2: fermented foods can also benefit those with Autism and help prevent H-Pylori. You don‚Äôt need a whole lot of fermented foods daily. Start with small amounts until you know how your body will react and slowly build your way up to say 3 tablespoons of fermented vegetables or a cup of kefir per day. What to add in

column1: Look for the product to say raw and fermented. These foods should be in the refrigerator section of the store. Sauerkraut or other fermented vegetables : eat these cold
column2: don‚Äôt heat them up. Bubbies pickles is a great way to get introduced to fermented foods. Kimchee : this is a Korean version of fermented cabbage
column3: carrots
column4: onions and garlic. Kefir: usually made from cow‚Äôs milk but is also made from goat milk or coconut milk. It has more of a drinkable texture than yogurt. I buy goat milk kefir and find that it is relatively thick and mix in some of my paleo granola and have this for breakfast. If you suspect any issues with milk it is best to opt for the coconut kefir or the goat milk kefir. If you have asthma or chronic sinus congestion
column5: avoid the kefir until issues resolve. Opt for the other fermented choices instead. Tempeh: Indonesian type of ‚Äúcake‚Äù with a nutty taste and chewy texture. A good vegan source of protein too. Kombucha : a fizzy fermented tea. Most stores carry a variety of flavors now. Don‚Äôt go overboard on the kombucha however. Some people who drink kombucha in excess amounts (i.e.: several bottles per day) report symptoms of gas and bloating. Miso: a fermented soybean paste which can be used in soups and sauces. A miso broth soup is a great way to start a meal and very easy to make.

column1: Notice I did not sat yogurt. While some yogurts may contain some probiotics
column2: many others are sugary processed foods in disguise. Yogurt is also not going to pack as powerful of a punch as the above-mentioned foods.

column2: cheap and effective way to jump start your metabolism

column1: What if I told you that by doing this every day
column2: making it part of your morning routine just like brushing your teeth
column3: would help you to lose weight

column1: Drinking water upon rising in the morning can have huge health benefits! Some people call it water therapy and has its origination in Ayurvedic medicine. It is purported to help with numerous diseases such as cancer
column2: asthma

column4: arthritis
column5: diabetes and migraines.

column1: To reap the benefits

column1: Ideally filtered water that is void of chemicals and fluoride is best. I personally like the Berkey filter system as this is affordable for many instead of a whole house system. Most water pitchers are ineffective for removing most of the chemicals in our water but there are a couple good ones out there such as the ‚ÄúClearly Filtered‚Äù pitcher. But even if you don‚Äôt have a water filter system

column1: For most people 16 oz. of water in the morning is the right amount. Others say to drink double this amount. This may be a lot of water to consume for most people first thing in the morning. My suggestion would be to start out with 8 oz. and slowly work your way up to the higher amount and see how you feel. Moderation is key as too little or too much water is never a good thing.

The 8 glasses filled with 8 oz. of water is a myth and no science behind this reasoning. Another simple rule is to divide your body weight in half and drink this amount in ounces. But if you are a large person

column1: Instead focus on getting that glass of water first thing in the day and then add in water

column5: drink up! Riboflavin
column6: a B vitamin can make your urine a bright yellow. Benefits to drinking water first thing in the morning It can jump start your metabolism

column2: we may experience brain fog
column3: lack of energy and metal clarity. Hydrating in the morning can increase the flow of oxygen which is energizing. Hydrating will also help the skin to look younger. Flushes out toxins

column1: Support your kidneys by helping them to flush out toxins and give your body the water it needs first thing in the a.m. Speed up the detox process by adding a tablespoon of lemon juice to your morning water. This is best done prior to brushing your teeth in the morning as the film on your teeth will protect the enamel from the acidity in the lemon juice. Support brain health

column1: 6511;4c9ade309b011be42dffaa57be0566016db2340b;0;George Zapo;2016-11-01T20:48:00.000+02:00;Cranberry Juice Does Not Prevent Urinary Tract Infection
column2: New Study Finds;"Keywords: cranberries
column3: cranberry
column4: cranberry juice
column5: kidney disease
column6: urinary tract infections
column7: UTI
column8: UTIs

column1: Cranberry juice and tablets have been recommended as a way to either prevent recurring urinary tract infection (UTI)
column2: or treat the symptoms. But a new study finds there‚Äôs no difference between people treated with cranberries or placebos.

column1: A lack of evidence for cranberry juice or capsules as being an effective preventative measure or treatment has been a recurring argument in the scientific literature for years now. Cranberry Juice ‚Äì An Unrealistic Recommendation for UTIs
A urinary tract infection occurs when bacteria gets into your urine and travels up to your bladder. According to the Urinary Care Foundation
column2: ‚ÄúUTIs cause more than 8.1 million visits to health care providers each year. About 10 in 25 women and 3 in 25 men will have symptoms of at least [one] UTI during their lifetime.‚Äù

column1: For years now
column2: cranberry juice has been recommended to aid in preventing or treating UTIs. However
column3: there‚Äôs no solid evidence that any amount is having a positive effect.

column1: Additionally
column2: based on the results of a recent study led by infectious disease specialist Manisha Juthani-Mehta from the Yale School of Medicine
column3: even if you switch to highly concentrated capsules
column4: you still don‚Äôt see a noticeable positive effect.

column1: In response to this recent study
column2: Lindsay E. Nicolle
column3: an expert on UTIs from the University of Manitoba advises the following:

column1: ‚ÄúThe continuing promotion of cranberry use to prevent recurrent UTI in the popular press or online advice seems inconsistent with the reality of repeated negative studies or positive studies compromised by methodological shortcomings.‚Äù
Nicolle adds
column2: ‚Äú[C]linicians should not be promoting cranberry use by suggesting that there is proven
column3: or even possible benefit. Any continued promotion of the use of cranberry products seems to go beyond available scientific evidence and rational reasoning. It is time to move on from cranberries.‚Äù Myth versus Facts

column1: There‚Äôs a couple of reasons why the myth that cranberry juice is beneficial in preventing and treating UTIs has persisted for so long.
First
column2: the active ingredient in cranberries ‚Äî A-type proanthocyanidins (PACs) ‚Äî has been shown to block the adhesion of bacteria to the wall of the bladder. So
column3: a vast majority of people have reasoned that if bacteria are causing UTIs
column4: something that blocks bacteria from accumulating in the bladder could be a potential preventive or treatment measure.

column1: But
column2: according to Timothy Boone
column3: M.D.
column4: Ph.D.
column5: vice dean of the Texas A&M Health Science Center College of Medicine Houston campus and chairperson of the department of urology for Houston Methodist Hospital
column6: there‚Äôs one problem .

column1: ‚ÄúCranberry juice
column2: especially the juice concentrates you find at the grocery store
column3: will not treat a UTI or bladder infection
column4: It can offer more hydration and possibly wash bacteria from your body more effectively
column5: but the active ingredient in cranberry is long-gone by the time it reaches your bladder.‚Äù

column1: Dr. Boone adds
column2: ‚ÄúIt takes an extremely large concentration of cranberry to prevent bacterial adhesion. This amount of concentration is not found in the juices we drink. There‚Äôs a possibility it was stronger back in our grandparents‚Äô day
column3: but definitely not in modern times.‚Äù

column1: For example
column2: Ocean Spray‚Äôs cranberry juice cocktail is only 27 percent juice. Something so watered down could not be so ineffective.

column1: The second reason the myth continues is that it‚Äôs a tempting myth to believe. If you experience recurring UTIs and want to prevent them ‚Äî or you want to feel empowered while you‚Äôre waiting for the antibiotics to take effect ‚Äî drinking cranberry juice or taking capsules is a fairly easy and simple way to feel like you‚Äôre helping resolve your problem.
Unfortunately
column2: though
column3: you‚Äôre paying a lot of money for something that‚Äôs only really doing the same job as a glass of water. And cranberry juice is full of sugar anyway. Golden Rules for Kidney Health

column1: You can do a number of things to help keep your kidneys functioning properly at every stage of life.
Here‚Äôs a list of ways to reduce the risk of kidney disease ‚Äì including urinary tract infections. Drink plenty of liquids
column2: especially water . Drinking water helps dilute your urine and ensures that you‚Äôll urinate more frequently ‚Äî allowing bacteria to be flushed from your urinary tract before an infection can begin. Stay active and keep fit . Keeping fit helps to reduce your blood pressure. Staying active and keeping fit also reduces the risk of chronic kidney disease. Eat healthy and keep your weight in check . This can help prevent diabetes
column3: heart disease
column4: and other debilitating conditions associated with chronic kidney disease. Reduce your salt intake . The recommended sodium intake is 5-6 grams of salt per day ‚Äî around a teaspoon. Try limiting the amount of processed and restaurant food. And don‚Äôt add salt to food. It‚Äôs easier to control your salt intake if you prepare the food yourself with fresh ingredients. Don‚Äôt take over-the-counter pills on a regular basis . Common non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs ‚Äî like ibuprofen ‚Äî are known to cause kidney damage and disease if taken regularly. This type of medication probably doesn‚Äôt pose considerable danger if your kidneys are reasonably healthy and you use them for emergencies only. However
column5: if you are dealing with chronic pain ‚Äî like back pain or arthritis ‚Äî work with your doctor to find natural ways to control your pain without putting your kidneys at risk. Wipe from front to back . Doing so after urinating and after a bowel movement helps prevent bacteria in the anal region from spreading to the vagina and urethra. Change your birth control method . Diaphragms
column6: or unlubricated or spermicide-treated condoms
column7: can all contribute to bacterial growth. Avoid potentially irritating feminine products . Using deodorant sprays or other feminine products
column8: such as douches and powders
column9: in the genital area can irritate the urethra. Empty your bladder soon after intercourse . Also
column10: drink a full glass of water to help flush bacteria. Regularly control of your blood sugar level . About half of people who have diabetes develop kidney damage
column11: so it is important for people with diabetes to have regular tests to check their kidney functions.

column5: Obama administration (NaturalNews) A Democratic presidential nominee ‚Äì Hillary Clinton
column6: who is by far the ""establishment candidate"" in this year's presidential race ‚Äì wants to take over from another Democratic president
