column1: 7664;1471de8c21e8b29f735e98371a182ff6cda75ba2;0;admin;2016-10-27T16:41:36.148+03:00;Leaked Memo Exposes Shady Dealings Between Clinton Foundation Donors And Bill‚Äôs ‚ÄúFor-Profit‚Äù Activities;"Zero Hedge October 27

We have written frequently in recent weeks about a feud that erupted between Chelsea Clinton and Doug Band back in 2011 after Chelsea raised concerns about potential conflicts of interest between Band‚Äôs firm
column2: Teneo
column3: the Clinton Foundation and the State Department(see here
column4: here
column5: here and here ).

column1: The feud ultimately resulted in Band being forced to draft a memo spelling out
column2: in vivid detail
column3: the many entangled relationships between himself
column4: Teneo
column5: the Clinton Foundation and the State Department. Fortunately
column6: today‚Äôs Wikileaks dump included that memo which reveals
column7: for the first time
column8: the precise financial flows between the Clinton Foundation
column9: Band‚Äôs firm Teneo Consulting
column10: and the Clinton family‚Äôs private business endeavors.

column1: The memo starts with a brief background on Teneo
column2: which was created in June 2011
column3: shortly after Declan Kelly resigned from his position as ‚ÄúUnited States Economic Envoy to Northern Ireland
column4: ‚Äù a position to which he was appointed by Secretary Clinton.

column1: In June 2009
column2: DK Consulting was founded by Declan Kelley. Mr. Kelly served as COO of FTI Consulting until June 2009
column3: when he stepped down and established DK Consulting. At that time
column4: he also became the United States Economic Envoy to Northern Ireland . Pursuant to the terms of his exit agreement with FTI and consistent with the ethics agreement of his uncompensated special government employee appointment at the State Department
column5: Mr. Kelly retained and continued to provide services to three paying clients (Coke
column6: Dow
column7: and UBS) and one pro bono client (Allstate) . In late 2009
column8: Declan retained me as a consultant to DK Consulting to help support the needs of these clients. In May 2011
column9: Mr. Kelly resigned his Envoy position at the State Department. In June 2011
column10: Mr. Kelly and I founded Teneo Strategies ; simultaneously
column11: Mr. Kelly closed DK Consulting and shifted its clients to Teneo.

column1: Throughout the past almost 11 years since President Clinton left office
column2: I have sought to leverage my activities
column3: including my partner role at Teneo
column4: to support and to raise funds for the Foundation . This memorandum strives to set forth how I have endeavored to support the Clinton Foundation and President Clinton personally.

column1: In a subsequent section of the memo entitled ‚ÄúLeveraging Teneo For The Foundation
column2: ‚Äù Band spells all of the donations he solicited from Teneo ‚Äúclients‚Äù for the Clinton Foundation. In all
column3: there are roughly $14mm of donations listed with the largest contributors being Coca-Cola
column4: Barclays
column5: The Rockefeller Foundation and Laureate International Universities.

column1: The donations from Dow Chemical are particularly notable for several reasons. First
column2: because of other emails revealed by WikiLeaks and other FOIA requests
column3: we now know that Dow Chemical CEO
column4: Andrew Liveris
column5: was granted special access to then Secretary Clinton back in July 2009 at the same time he was embroiled in ongoing litigation with another Clinton Foundation donor
column6: Kuwait
column7: over a failed joint-venture that would have netted Dow $9BN in cash . As Band notes in his memo
column8: 1 month after being granted special access to Secretary Clinton
column9: Liveris invited President Clinton and Band out for a day of golf. Moreover
column10: shortly after his meeting with Secretary Clinton and golf outing with President Clinton
column11: Liveris decided to donate $500
column12: 000 to the Clinton Global Initiative ‚Ä¶very convenient timing for all involved.

column1: In August of 2009
column2: Mr. Kelly invited Mr. Liveris to play golf with President Clinton and me. Mr. Kelly subsequently asked Dow to become a CGI sponsor at the $500
column3: 000 level
column4: which they did
column5: as well as making a $150

column1: 7683;b5fd0cb3f5c6583a9ab419f8b5d39f9e04ba4055;0;admin;2016-10-27T17:45:16.623+03:00;Dying out: Wild animal numbers could fall by 67% from 1970-2020
column2: study says;"RT October 27

column1: The number of wild animals on Earth could fall by more than two-thirds in the 50 years to 2020
column2: according to a new report which places the blame on the destruction of habitats
column3: hunting and pollution. The forecast could lead to major consequences for humans.

column1: The Living Planet Report 2016 says that animal losses are on track to reach 67 percent in the 50 years to 2020. The report‚Äôs authors also took into consideration a recent trend in animal population decline
column2: citing a 58 percent plummet between 1970 and 2012.

column1: The researchers analyzed the changing presence of 14
column2: 152 monitored populations of the 3
column3: 706 vertebrate species ‚Äì mammals
column4: birds
column5: fish
column6: amphibians and reptiles among them.

column1: According to the paper
column2: the biggest cause of the plummeting animal populations is the destruction of wilderness areas by farming and logging. Pollution was also mentioned as a significant problem. Vaccine-laden M&M‚Äôs to be distributed via drone for endangered ferrets https://t.co/wm4DUucNxn pic.twitter.com/9a6F9x3raG

column1: ‚ÄúHumanity‚Äôs misuse of natural resources is threatening habitats
column2: pushing irreplaceable species to the brink
column3: and threatening the stability of our climate
column4: ‚Äù said WWF‚Äôs director of science
column5: Mike Barrett. A d v e r t i s e m e n t

column1: Animals across the planet are expected to be affected. However
column2: rivers and lakes are the hardest-hit areas. Barrett noted that global warming is exacerbating the pressures.

column1: ‚ÄúWe are no longer a small world on a big planet. We are now a big world on a small planet
column2: where we have reached a saturation point
column3: ‚Äù the Stockholm Resilience Center‚Äôs Professor Johan Rockstr√∂m said in a foreword for the report.

column1: The decline in wildlife
column2: along with climate change
column3: is part of the proposed notion of Anthropocene
column4: a term which suggests a new era in which humans have managed to have a significant global impact on Earth‚Äôs geology and ecosystems.

column1: The notion ‚Äì which has yet to be officially approved as a term used to explain geological time ‚Äì can lead to major consequences.

‚ÄúThe richness and diversity of life on Earth is fundamental to the complex life systems that underpin it. Life supports life itself and we are part of the same equation. Lose biodiversity and the natural world and the life support systems
column2: as we know them today
column3: will collapse
column4: ‚Äù WWF Director-General Marco Lambertini said
column5: as quoted by the Guardian.

column1: In fact
column2: the report states that humans could be anything but happy if the forecast comes to fruition
column3: noting that the predicted situation could provoke serious competition.

column1: ‚ÄúIncreased human pressure threatens the natural resources that humanity depends upon
column2: increasing the risk of water and food insecurity and competition over natural resources
column3: ‚Äù the report states.

column1: There does
column2: however
column3: appear to be some hope. Some species are beginning to recover
column4: suggesting that conservation efforts could help tackle the crisis.

column1: However
column2: Barrett noted that in order for such efforts to take place
column3: society must largely change how it consumes resources.

column1: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd like to think that was a no-brainer in that if a business is consuming the raw materials for its products in a way that is not sustainable
column2: then inevitably it will eventually put itself out of business
column3: ‚Äù Barrett said.

column1: ‚ÄúThe report is certainly a pretty shocking snapshot of where we are
column2: ‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúMy hope though is that we don‚Äôt throw our hands up in despair ‚Äì there is no time for despair
column3: we have to crack on and act. I do remain convinced we can find our sustainable course through the Anthropocene
column4: but the will has to be there to do it.‚Äù

column1: The new report comes less than two months after a similar analysis found that Earth has lost one-tenth of its wilderness sites since the early 1990s.   6:41  ";english;2016-10-27T17:45:16.623+03:00;prisonplanet.com;US;41475.0;Dying out: Wild animal numbers could fall by 67% from 1970-2020

A 2011 New York Times article describes the shocking details of Shipp's harrowing personal story of seeking justice and eventually turning whistleblower after his health and the health of his family were severely compromised.Running into the juggernaut faced by so many whistleblowers

column4: and in so doing keep corruption and illegal activities at all levels covered up.Shipp's excellent essay below explains in detail why so few whistleblowers have come out on highly illegal activities related to Pentagon corruption

column10: Fred Burks for PEERS and WantToKnow.infoFormer White House interpreter and whistleblowerSilencing WhistleblowersBy Kevin ShippWhy don¬ít more ¬ìwhistleblowers¬î come out to expose illegal or unconstitutional secret government operations? If these activities are so illegal
column11: why are people not coming forward to report them?Over the last fifty years US government intelligence agencies have perfected a complex
column12: sequential system to systematically silence or destroy any employee
column13: including his or her family
column14: who attempts to reveal illegal or unconstitutional activities conducted as part of secret government operations.As a condition of employment
column15: military and intelligence employees recruited for secret operations are required to sign a ¬ìsecrecy agreement
column16: ¬î or ¬ìnondisclosure agreement
column17: ¬î before being given access to the position
column18: which offers high pay and status in the organization. This agreement threatens civil and criminal penalties if the employee reveals ANY information regarding the program. Thinking the agreement will only be used for legal purposes and will get them the coveted job
column19: all employees eagerly sign it.This secrecy agreement was originally designed to protect legitimate classified information
column20: to protect military personnel during wartime and protect legitimate national defense information and technology.However
column21: because of the binding power of the agreement
column22: government agencies began using it as a powerful tool to silence federal employees who question the legality of certain government operations. It was the perfect tool to threaten
column23: silence or jail any whistle blower who dared to challenge the secret operations of government.Today
column24: the secrecy agreement is routinely used as an efficient weapon to intimidate or silence employees. Annual refresher briefings are given to remind employees of the penalties for violating the agreement. These penalties include huge fines
column25: termination
column26: financial ruin and even prison ¬ñ all of which mean the destruction of their lives and their families. Most will not reveal any wrongdoing
column27: no matter how egregious
column28: for fear of calculated
column29: severe retribution.When employees sign the secrecy agreement and are cleared for classified programs
column30: they are not told they are giving up their right to a jury trial
column31: or to sue the agency that hired them. If they try to do so as a whistle blower
column32: they find they have no right to be heard in federal court. Many have found this out when their case was denied; then it was too late. That is part of the system.If the employee attempts to contact their Congressman or Senator
column33: their representative is blocked from receiving any information about their case
column34: because they do not have the necessary ¬ìclearance.¬îWhen the employee attempts to blow the whistle to the Congressional intelligence committees
column35: their response is ignored. It is made clear to committee members that they are not to touch such cases
column36: so they refer them back to their Senator or Congressman
column37: who cannot access information involved in their case.If a courageous employee continues to proceed and blow the whistle
column38: a system of personal and career destruction follows. This begins with promotions being denied
column39: being turned down for sensitive or career enhancing assignments
column40: and their files being flagged
column41: ruining their reputation inside their agency. At this point their career is over. If they go quietly

column1: 7939;de9af95b7d9425564331943095fc795b8b519660;0;Beau Albrecht;2016-10-26T23:04:39.175+03:00;How A Communist Brainwashing Method Was Exported To The United States;"During the height of the Cold War
column2: the CIA attempted to develop mind control techniques with the MKULTRA program. As it happens
column3: the Communists already had a leg up on them. We‚Äôll explore how this was done
column4: along with some new twists.

column1: The criticism and self-criticism technique in history This is what happens to people who joke about Chairman Mao ripping off Hillary‚Äôs wardrobe.

The technique of ‚Äú criticism and self-criticism ‚Äù (kritika i samokritika) was developed during the early days of the Soviet Union . This got results. When the early Soviet show trials and purges took place
column2: the targets would confess to committing treason‚Äîthe details stretching credulity‚Äîand beg for execution. The Maoists (Chinese Communists) used it too
column3: typically during ‚Äú struggle sessions .‚Äù Also
column4: forced confessions were required in Vietnam for prisoners in reeducation camps .

column1: What happened wasn‚Äôt much different from a medieval inquisition. Those targeted would be badgered until they confessed to whatever it was they supposedly did. Of course
column2: physical forms of coercion were also an option. These weren‚Äôt actual trials; their fates were already decided.

column1: The lucky ones were released and got to resume their lives as before
column2: after their memorable reminder to toe the Party line. Others faced stiffer penalties than that: from loss of Party membership (and accompanying status) all the way up to execution. No amount of compliance or abject groveling could save them if it was predetermined that they were going to be purged or killed.

column1: After the ordeal
column2: survivors were surely scared witless. With their egos beaten down
column3: they were ready to do as they were told without question. It‚Äôs basically a form of brainwashing. As for those who were executed after that
column4: the purpose of going through the motions was for benefit of the audience. It was political theater
column5: convincing those present that they were delivering justice to wrongdoers
column6: and serving as an example of what could happen to those who step out of line.

column1: Other than that
column2: the ‚Äúcriticism and self-criticism‚Äù technique‚Äîbadgering and forcing a confession‚Äîalso was picked up in the USA during the 1960s by certain cults and oddball encounter groups. Today
column3: we might think of these strange and humiliating rituals as a thing of the past
column4: but the truth is that they‚Äôve merely changed form . As I‚Äôve noted previously
column5: cultural Marxism is a crappy and inherently destructive ‚Äúfor-export‚Äù variety of Communism
column6: so it‚Äôs no great surprise that it has adapted this technique for its purposes.

column1: Modern witch hunts This is what happens to people who say that Bruce Jenner is actually a dude.
When people are encouraged to become incensed over even tiny things
column2: this causes a ‚Äúwalking on eggshells‚Äù atmosphere. In today‚Äôs politically correct climate
column3: it‚Äôs easy to run afoul of the Thought Police. This might result in a visit to the HR Department
column4: or a campus ‚Äúspeech code‚Äù investigation. However
column5: if the thoughtcrime is serious enough‚Äîor the target is prominent enough‚Äîthen this can ignite a media circus . Also
column6: someone could end up featured on a mailing list for Social Justice Warriors . Besides just trolling and harassment
column7: this can result in doxxing (release of your personal information) or pressure on an employer to fire the thought criminal.

column1: We in the Western world pride ourselves on the right to free speech. That was one of the main goals of liberalism
column2: back in the 18th Century when liberalism was still a good thing. Actually
column3: many ‚Äúfree‚Äù countries criminalize politically incorrect speech. Even in places that don‚Äôt have legal penalties for speaking your mind
column4: it carries the risk of the loss of your livelihood . This effectively makes entire policy arguments forbidden to articulate
column5: which naturally is the whole point. Other goals
column6: of course
column7: are information control and thus thought control. So much for freedom of speech! It took a few centuries
column8: but liberals now oppose what they once stood for.

column1: The following scenario has happened time and again. Someone points out an inconvenient truth
column2: writes something that offends someone
column3: donates to the ‚Äúwrong‚Äù cause
column4: mocks a feminist‚Äôs First World problems
column5: tells an off-color joke
column6: or even wears the wrong T-shirt . Then the feeding frenzy begins
column7: resulting in torrents of criticism. Usually the target apologizes profusely
column8: but loses his job no matter how abject or groveling his apologies are.

column1: It‚Äôs possible to convince a judge and twelve jurors that you‚Äôre not guilty of something
column2: but good luck getting the media or an online SJW mob to calm down and leave you alone! The traditional Communist session was better in one way. That is
column3: they quit after breaking the target‚Äôs will. A modern feeding frenzy
column4: though
column5: can drag on for months
column6: even after the target has been begging for forgiveness. What goes on the Internet can stay there forever
column7: including lies about you.

column1: If you get caught in a Social Justice Weenie witch hunt
column2: never apologize. Explain and clarify if you absolutely must. This is for the benefit of the uncommitted; the SJWs will already have made up their small minds about you and won‚Äôt stop no matter what you do. Never let them break your frame! Instead
column3: go on the attack. You have a right to your own opinion and to express it.

column1: If you beg for their forgiveness
column2: then you will be allowing them to turn their criticism into your self-criticism. Remember that groveling is unlikely to save you! Apologies are for people who actually did something wrong. Having a difference of opinion isn‚Äôt wrong
column3: despite some people‚Äôs curious notions about freedom of speech.

column1: Here are some other particulars to remember:
You can‚Äôt reason with them ; online mobs don‚Äôt know you and have been told that you‚Äôre an evildoer. You‚Äôll probably never know exactly what was said about you
column2: who said it
column3: and what email list all that was on. (If you do find out
column4: sue for defamation of character.) However
column5: you can be sure that you‚Äôve already been deemed guilty. They‚Äôre not interested in the truth. SJWs have great difficulty comprehending basic logic. Many of them don‚Äôt even believe in objective reality ; only their feelings are real to them. Why would the truth matter to these idiots? Finally
column6: Social Justice Weenies are a bunch of losers . Their opinion of you matters less than that of a snotty child cursing you out. Therefore
column7: don‚Äôt let these oxygen-wasters mess with your self-esteem. Societal criticism and self-criticism Wallowing in guilt at its finest

column1: The Frankfurt School
column2: a Communist think tank that moved to the USA and began subverting the educational system
column3: developed critical theory . One of their top classics was Eros and Civilization by Herbert Marcuse. It contained lots of Freudian arguments on how our society was too repressed and we needed to loosen up our morals. Another was The Authoritarian Personality by Theodor Adorno. That too contained Freudian mumbo-jumbo
column4: smearing right wing politics with accusations of neurosis and homo Daddy issues. All told
column5: they wrote dozens of books along those lines
column6: some attacking Western civilization directly. These vaporings wouldn‚Äôt have amounted to much
column7: if they hadn‚Äôt become trendy in academia and influenced the 1960s zeitgeist.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: radical feminism‚Äîthe Second Wave‚Äîwas starting up. This too had lots of Communist influence
column3: another front of cultural Marxism. This also was all about criticism of our culture. This caused friction between the sexes
column4: driving a wedge deep into the heart of society. The results included the snarky
column5: snotty
column6: and spoiled attitudes you‚Äôve surely encountered. Worse
column7: this caused untold misery from high divorce rates and broken homes .

column1: This was one of several movements that became prominent during the 1960s and are still with us today. (Surely you can think of many others.) The methodology was the same‚Äîall angrily made overblown complaints about how bad society has been to them. The way they tell it
column2: they‚Äôre out fighting for their rights. The goal of cultural Marxism
column3: though
column4: was all about attacking our morale and softening us up. The people involved in those movements were merely tools

column6: money
column7: and status.

column1: The educational system has been dumbed down . History has been rewritten too. Figures like Christopher Columbus and the US Founding Fathers are bad guys now. Even as early as the 1980s
column2: campuses were hell-bent in purging ‚ÄúDWEMs‚Äù (their charming term for ‚Äúdead White European males‚Äù) from the literary canon. None of this was really about inclusiveness; it‚Äôs all about robbing our people of our heritage
column3: making us ashamed of our accomplishments
column4: and destroying our resolve.

column1: The propaganda is everywhere. Television is full of social and political messages
column2: even in shows for children
column3: and piggybacked onto advertisements too. ‚ÄúSensitivity training‚Äù courses deliver politically correct indoctrination. College campuses are notorious for pushing propaganda. This even happens to elementary school kids. (My first exposure was in second grade.) Some of the indoctrination exercises require audience participation
column4: such as forcing them to fill out ‚Äúprivilege‚Äù checklists (with the facts cherry-picked ) to instill a sense of ‚Äúcollective guilt.‚Äù

column1: All this has worked according to plan. Many are out of touch with their roots
column2: and don‚Äôt understand that they have a heritage worth preserving. Worse
column3: others have been infected by guilt trips. Sometimes this leads to public spectacles of wallowing in guilt; again
column4: there‚Äôs the self-criticism part.

column1: The antidote to this is the truth. The fact is
column2: every civilization has its good points and its bad points
column3: and ours is no exception. It‚Äôs rotten hypocrisy for the bullshit merchants in academia and the media to dwell on our faults and overlook those of other parts of the world
column4: while selectively ignoring our accomplishments and elevating those of others . The truth is that none of our shortcomings or misdeeds are solely found in Western civilization
column5: but some of our good characteristics are indeed unique.

column1: You can protect your children by home schooling them or sending them to a private school where they won‚Äôt be indoctrinated. You can always get rid of your TV too. Meanwhile

column3: millions of other students will be putty in the hands of propagandizing professors and teachers
column4: and of course the lying media. Those pushing this from the top down must be called out

column6: and removed from power.

column1: Why rig the system? The elite realize that their time is short.

column1: It is human nature to want to accumulate wealth. It is also human nature to want to keep what you have. One of the ways that the wealthy do that is through influencing the political process to ensure it is favorable to them. A democratic republic is particularly easy to influence. The wealthy elite can ‚Äúbuy‚Äù candidates through donations to them or to their superpacs. They can make voting patterns more favorable to them by changing the country‚Äôs demographics. Or they can influence voters through the supposedly unbiased news media that they control. In the US
column2: the wealthy elite use every one of these levers to rig the system.

column1: For example
column2: liberal voters often favor a progressive tax system where high earners pay greater percentages than those who earn less. It sounds like a populist policy but it is not. Progressive taxation is put in place to prevent middle class people from rising into the ranks of the truly wealthy who have already accumulated their wealth and are taxed at the much lower capital gains rate. Progressive taxation keeps the rich on top and keeps the plebs down. That‚Äôs why no matter which political party is in power
column3: we are still stuck with progressive taxation.

column1: Everything goes well as long as both parties don‚Äôt rock the boat. But once you get a true wildcard like Trump
column2: the system must spring into action to stop the threat to the established order. That‚Äôs what we are seeing now. The elite are using every tool in the arsenal of the rigged system to ensure Trump does not upset their gravy train. The elite sense their time is short.

column1: Voter Fraud
The first way in which the election is rigged is through voter fraud. In his Gettysburg address
column2: Trump outlined some of the ways in which this occurs:

column1: According to Pew
column2: there are 24 million voter registrations that in the US that are either invalid or significantly inaccurate. 1.8 million dead people are registered to vote
column3: and some of them are voting. I wonder how that happens? 2.8 million people are registered to vote in more than one state. These are numbers folks. These are numbers. 14% of noncitizens are registered to vote.

column1: Liberals always object to any sort of voter identification requirement. They say that it negatively affects minority voters
column2: who may not have any identification. But this is obvious nonsense. The real reason liberals oppose voter identification is because it would make voter fraud more difficult.

column1: By raising concerns about voter fraud
column2: Trump is firing a warning shot. He is saying that he will fight voter fraud
column3: unlike prior GOP candidates who preferred defeat to calling out cheating by the other side. Simply putting the Democrats on notice may cause them to cheat less than they would have otherwise. The only question is whether Trump will be able to muster enough votes to overcome the amount of cheating that will take place.

column1: The L√ºgenpresse

column1: Trump is very media savvy. He‚Äôs been in the public eye since the 1980s and his philosophy has been that no publicity is bad publicity. Trump has used this to highlight his policies. By making controversial statements
column2: he has been able to force the media to cover his positions. Still
column3: the nonstop smear campaign has hurt Trump‚Äôs numbers particularly among older voters who still get their news from legacy sources.

column1: Voter Discouragement Fivethirtyeight doing its best to discourage Trump voters.

Another way that that system is rigged is that the legacy media conspires to discourage Trump voters from going to the polls. One way they do this is to over poll Democrats to make it look like Trump is losing. For example
column2: one recent poll placed Hillary 12 points higher than Trump. But even Obama was only able to beat McCain by 7 points even though he was packing stadiums of 70
column3: 000 people. And Hillary doesn‚Äôt command the sort of adulation that Obama did in 2008.

column1: There is a huge motivation gap between Trump and Clinton. Recently

column3: 000 people showed up. Some of these people waited in line for 12 hours for the chance to see Trump. A day later
column4: Hillary hosted a rally in Florida where only 1000 people showed up. And some of those were likely paid plants. Her running mate Tim Kaine did even worse barely getting 30 people to show up for one of his events.

column1: One day before the Brexit vote
column2: polls showed Remain leading by 10 points. Leave ended up winning by 3.5 points.

column1: Why does the legacy media report polls that show Trump losing by a landslide? Because it is designed to dishearten Trump voters.

Conclusion Will Trump be able to overcome the rigged system? It will be a heroic achievement if he does. One thing is certain: This is not the time to give up but to fight with all of our might. The elites want us to be discouraged
column2: to give up hope
column3: to lie down and die. That is the one thing we will never do. Even if the host of hell rise up to oppose you
column4: go to the ballot box on November 8th. Regardless of what you may hear otherwise
column5: your life will be very different under President Trump than it will be under globalist pawn Hillary.

column1: 1. Admiration
Society
column2: I think
column3: should admit some victimhood to those who were raised as weaklings or acted cluelessly out of good intentions. Women in particular should be more empathetic and nurturing towards nice and beta males‚Äîas long as their empathy does not extent out of admitted boundaries‚Äîhence taking an opposite direction from the egotistical

column1: As Nassim Taleb put it

column1: 2. Shame
Shame arises from measuring our actions against moral standards and discovering that they fall short. If our actions fall short and we fail to notice

column4: unlike embarrassment

column6: Heaven and Hell

column2: 2013 19 Comments Body

column1: 1. You have no idea how much you are eating.
Ever wonder why you can‚Äôt gain any muscle or lose any body fat? Well
column2: the first place to look for the answer is your diet. Are you eating the requisite amount of calories for your goals? If you want to gain muscle you have to eat more calories than you burn
column3: whereas if you want to lose body fat you have to eat fewer calories than you burn. There is no way around this simple fact. Even though this is nothing more than a grade school physics problem
column4: I‚Äôm still baffled by the number of guys out there whining about being ‚Äúhardgainers‚Äù or ‚Äúendomorphs.‚Äù Invest in a food scale and track your intake. It‚Äôs really not that hard.

column1: 2. You are constantly looking for the next best supplement to take.

This is the game equivalent of asking for the one magic pick up line that will allow you to swoop top shelf girls left and right. The hard truth is that the vast majority of supplements are a complete waste of money. Guys flock to supplements because it‚Äôs an easy fix. Instead of putting in the time and hard work needed to obtain the results they desire
column2: they look for shortcuts in order to get ahead. Unfortunately
column3: these shortcuts don‚Äôt exist. The only time you should be worrying about supplements is when you have all of the other nutritional building blocks in place.

column1: 3. You think you don‚Äôt have the time to eat healthy.

A lot of guys complain about being too busy to eat nutritious meals made mostly of whole foods. Guys will also complain about not having enough time to hit the gym after work (or during their lunch break). The problem here is not one of time
column2: but rather of priorities . Guys would rather sleep-in than get up early to make themselves a good lunch to take to work. The bottom line is this: if you value your health then find the time to make yourself nutritious meals. Ditch the excuses.

column1: 4. You think there is one ‚Äúbest‚Äù diet for everyone

I‚Äôve been in this game long enough to know that there is no one particular diet that is best for everyone. I remember about 10 years ago people were losing their minds over The Atkins Diet. About 5 years later people moved on to The Paleo Diet
column2: and now Intermittent Fasting is all the rage. New diets will always be on the horizon
column3: which pretty much guarantees that arguments on the internet about which diet is the ‚Äúbest‚Äù will never end. I do not know what the ‚Äúbest‚Äù diet is. What I do know is that all good diets have several things in common such as being based around whole foods
column4: and acknowledging the importance of portion control
column5: protein
column6: fiber
column7: and other important nutrients. Aside from these basics
column8: whether you eat low carb or high carb
column9: three meals a day or six meal
column10: is entirely up to you and your lifestyle but make sure you get the basics down first.

column1: 7951;5445f5e04da09d4559ca33c7d8579b0db39efa6d;0;Larsen Halleck;2016-10-30T20:01:09.452+02:00;Why It‚Äôs Necessary To Relax Into A Stretch;"In a previous article
column2: I discussed stretching‚Äînamely
column3: why stretching is important for the masculine man
column4: and several stretches that you should use in your training to maximize your physical fitness. And while that advice is still valid
column5: I neglected a very important concept in that first article: the techniques that detail how to stretch.

column1: I am not referring to a specific stretch or some sort of hypothetical ‚Äústretching mindset
column2: ‚Äù but rather a set of techniques that can be utilized for any stretch to increase ones flexibility immediately. But before I can discuss those
column3: I have to discuss the incorrect way of stretching that many people still use.

column1: How Not To Stretch Many people believe that stretching is a literal act of forcing the muscles and connective tissue to stretch‚Äî avoid this at all costs ! First and foremost
column2: as I have discussed previously in these pages
column3: you should never apply any stretching pressure to the connective tissue. They evolved solely to ‚Äúhold fast‚Äù and keep things in one piece
column4: they should never be stretched at all!

column1: The muscles are the anatomical feature that stretches
column2: as they evolved to do. When stretching
column3: your body should always be positioned in a way where the connective tissues are stable and the muscles are moving.

column1: Even when you are positioned properly
column2: no part of stretching should involve the athlete forcing his muscles to stretch
column3: as that risks muscular tearing which is a nagging injury that never truly goes away. This is because the human body has naturally evolved what is referred to as the ‚Äú anti-stretch reflex ‚Äù to prevent muscular tearing-stretching the muscles increases in difficulty the farther and deeper the stretch is
column4: and your body responds to this stress with pain. This is a biological sign telling you that if you go further you‚Äôll be risking muscle tears
column5: and should normally be a heeded warning.

column1: However
column2: if you want to do advanced stretching (such as that nigh-impossible benchmark of fitness the splits)
column3: you will have to find a way to overcome this reflex without hurting yourself. And as luck would have it
column4: there is!

column1: Relax Into Stretching Reflexes can be overcome with gradual and repeated practice‚Äîjust ask your friendly neighborhood hooker about how she overcame her gag reflex! Similarly
column2: your anti-stretch reflex that keeps your ‚Äújoints‚Äù (actually your muscles) stiff and immobile can be overcome with a few techniques.

column1: The most basic of these techniques is the one that I have had the best results with (as usual
column2: the simple but difficult answer is usually the correct one)
column3: and that is the titular concept of ‚Äúrelaxing into a stretch‚Äù‚Äîwith thanks to Pavel Tsatsouline for naming the concept.

column1: To use this technique
column2: take an easy form of the stretch you want to do: using the splits as an example
column3: you would do a seated groin stretch. Engage the stretch just to the point where you feel tension in the target muscle
column4: and then‚Ä¶sit and wait.

column1: Yes
column2: paradoxically
column3: relaxation is the key to increasing your physical fitness in this context. You are literally going to sit there and wait for your muscles to stop fighting the stretch‚Äîin other words
column4: you‚Äôre going to exhaust your reflex until it stops being reflexive.

column1: This is not something that happens quickly‚Äîfrom my experience
column2: it will take 5-10 minutes per stretch
column3: so it is perfectly acceptable for you to get a book or watch TV while doing this. As a side note
column4: this is literally the only time where it‚Äôs acceptable to have a visual distraction during exercise
column5: in my opinion.

column1: As you might expect
column2: once your muscles have relaxed and the pain has melted away
column3: you can increase the stretch a little bit more
column4: and hold it for another 10 minutes. Repeat this process until your muscles are in pain and you judge that you can‚Äôt go any further‚Äîthis is a personal call that you will have to decide for yourself
column5: as I can‚Äôt judge when your muscles are demanding you to stop.

column1: This technique can be utilized for any stretch
column2: and in many cases will give you the progress that you so desire. However
column3: there are other methods in the ‚ÄúRelax Into Stretch‚Äù family of exercises that can be utilized as well
column4: such as meditation‚Äîmentally relaxing will lead to muscular relaxation.

column1: Or you can try ‚Äúforced relaxation‚Äù
column2: where you flex the muscle simultaneously while stretching
column3: forcing the muscle to relax.

column1: Either way you slice it
column2: don‚Äôt just brute force your stretching
column3: utilize these techniques for better results.

column1: Read More: Why Stretching Is Essential For The Body (With 6 Beginner Stretches To Get You Started)

column1: A determined young man with a strong sense of his destiny - to save his country from postmodern collapse. October 30

column1: The global population in 1800 was about one billion people. Today it stands at over seven times that amount
column2: with the rapidly growing populations of India and Africa expected to increase that to at least nine billion over the coming years. Readers today are well used to the idea that the ‚Äúglobal south‚Äù is densely populated relative to its economic size and area
column3: but this was not always the case. Prior to the collapse of Empire
column4: Europe
column5: having undergone thorough industrialization
column6: was the most densely populated continent in the world. Source: ‚ÄúThe World at Six Billion‚Äù
column7: United Nations
column9: Dept. of Economic and Social Affairs
column10: Population Division (2011)

column1: Europe was also where the world‚Äôs social justice movements‚Äîliberalism
column2: communism and feminism‚Äîbegan
column3: overthrowing the old order of kings
column4: castes and courtship with the vulgar and degenerate world we suffer today. But why did this happen? Why did the immense increase of wealth and prosperity not correspond to an increase of human happiness
column5: but instead lead to the emasculation of men
column6: the breakdown of the family
column7: and the disappearance of religion and morality?

column1: In these series of articles

column8: and similarly make themselves into solid Men. Popular mainstream theories for social degeneration

column1: Many authors have postulated economic reasons for this degeneration‚Äîindustrialization
column2: having deprived men of their primary roles as the masters of nature
column3: reduced their worth and attractiveness‚Äîor utility‚Äîin the eyes of women. Relatedly
column4: others argue that technological progress
column5: which increased independence and ability for all
column6: allowed women to go their own way.

column2: disciplined societies create a generation of lazy youngsters
column3: fat off the success of their parents
column4: who cause so much havoc with their short sighted policies that their civilization collapses
column5: leading to a new generation of disciplined youngsters who again create greatness. One example of a short-sighted policy would be the feminist political movement
column6: which artificially separated woman from man by giving her
column7: through affirmative action
column8: socially harmful economic independence.

column3: spiritual
column4: human and thus fundamentally biological causes of social degeneration. Why the mainstream theories are flawed

column2: a healthy Man and a healthy woman

column4: should not so substantially less love and cherish each other

column6: Technology does not diminish her emotional and biological need for man.

column1: Further
column2: the availability of technology does not always translate into its adoption‚Äîthe failure of Google Glass is the emblematic example. It does not have to be the case that smartphones are automatically adopted for Slut Culture‚Äîthey do not have to automatically lead to female promiscuity. Anyone familiar with Russian or Japanese women
column3: who have the same technology at hand
column4: but a vastly greater sense of restraint and self-worth
column5: can attest to this fact. Therefore
column6: the technological argument is not sufficient to explain modern degeneracy
column7: although it is certainly a necessary condition. credit: Ninaras credit: moguphotos

column1: To briefly examine the argument that Men no longer have (non-financial) utility in the eyes of women: a man is not necessarily attractive to a woman if he actually breaks rocks

column3: being able to is sufficient.

column1: Therefore

column3: man

column5: the change in preferences of both men and women explains modern degeneracy. Men hardly today want to lead and possess their woman; and women do not respond to weakling men.

column1: Let us examine the r/K selection argument: if it were the case that wealth and ease begat indiscipline automatically
column2: it would be true that the rich produce weak and undisciplined progeny. This may seem like a truism today
column3: viewed through the lens of the post-industrial
column4: overpopulated Paris Hilton West
column5: but in societies of the past
column6: it was certainly not the case‚Äîrather
column7: historically
column8: the opposite has been true: the weak were poor because they were undisciplined
column9: and the strong were rich because they were disciplined. The poor raised weak and hence undisciplined children
column10: while the rich raised strong and disciplined ones
column11: so the cycle continued and over time aristocracies formed.

column2: many of whom
column3: financially wealthy and prosperous
column4: drive old
column5: beaten SUVs
column6: reuse clothes and generally minimize expenditures. While it cannot be denied that even the modern rich have in general become mostly degenerate
column7: this is
column8: in my opinion
column9: a (disproportionately visible) symptom of a deeper malaise that affects society across the board.

column1: Therefore
column2: I do not rely on the technological or economic explanations for societal degeneration-I view these theories as descriptive of passing symptoms or trends
column3: and not timelessly causal truths.int The population growth
column4: nutritional depletion and environmental pollution theory of societal degeneration

column1: Having outlined and accounted for the above theories

column3: and the two primary factors are: Nutritional depletion of food
column4: caused by the growth of industrial agriculture
column5: which itself is made necessary by unprecedented population growth. The pollution of the environment caused by industry and the introduction of unsafe technology.

column4: leading to a generation of overgrown children.

column2: according to this theory
column3: the increased dependence on technology is not viewed as the cause of millennial autism
column4: but rather a symptom of millennial autism. Recent historical examples

column4: even if earning a higher income than poor peasants

column6: making them both mentally and physically ill. The unfortunate result of insufficient mental development in a crisis situation ‚Äì our aim should be to save as many leftists as possible
column7: and almost all can be.

column4: despite usually being less wealthy than the urban poor

column1: The weakened population‚Äôs increasing demands for emotion based socialism led to the growth of a massive welfare state
column2: and eventual bankruptcy
column3: hyperinflation and collapse of the central government.

column4: and created

column6: a population of weaklings

column3: has been

column4: fairly universally

Special interests have also been the biggest corrupters of regulators and the institutions created to defend the population against industrial and chemical pollution.

Short-term residential accommodation network Airbnb is forcing its providers to adhere to a new ‚Äúnondiscrimination‚Äù policy
column2: including a requirement to accept transgender people. The policy takes effect on November 1 and is accompanied by a slew of other recent or impending changes
column3: which Airbnb says are designed to make its ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù more ‚Äúinclusive.‚Äù Those who refuse to accept the main nondiscrimination policy will barred from listing their properties with Airbnb.

column1: The major problem with Airbnb‚Äôs new nondiscrimination provisions is that they really just represent an euphemism‚Äîbowing to a customer‚Äôs feelings
column2: rather than proven discrimination. The overall framework of the company‚Äôs policy alterations assumes that those accommodation providers accused of discrimination are actually guilty of it. This rush to judgment gives little or no recourse to those who depend on Airbnb to generate an income. It also makes it very easy for certain protected groups
column3: most notably transgender people
column4: to falsely or very loosely claim discrimination
column5: when
column6: in fact
column7: the issue is likely to be the prospective guest‚Äôs temperament or perceived reliability in respecting the property.

column1: Secondly
column2: the policy changes ignore the unique nature of sharing economy sites like Airbnb. Accommodation providers are often accepting guests into their literal homes
column3: or their sole investment property. Whereas hotels have round-the-clock staff
column4: including security
column5: Airbnb properties are much more informal and unsupervised. Providers therefore have good reasons to be very judicious about who exactly they let into their residences. Airbnb‚Äôs ‚ÄúOpen Doors‚Äù policy treats any discrimination complaint as gospel truth Brian Chesky must‚Äôve drank the same poisoned water as fellow tech SJW Jack Dorsey of Twitter.

column4: or in any other interaction with a host ‚Äì we will find that Guest a similar place to stay if one is available on Airbnb
column5: or if not

column1: ‚Äî Brian Chesky

column1: Few people think of the effects civil unrest could have on their livelihood and well-being. It‚Äôs time for a little education on just how thinly stretched the American supply chain is
column2: and what could happen with only a short-term disruption in it.

column1: Here‚Äôs a scenario ‚Äì just one of many possible scenarios. Video of rioters stopping and then looting a semi tractor-trailer in Charlotte is worrying because if trucks stop
column2: America stops. If attacks on truckers happen often enough
column3: truckers may decide it‚Äôs not worth the risk to their lives to continue moving freight around and stop driving. Within a day
column4: bedlam could ensue as the supply chain runs on a razor‚Äôs edge in modern America and everything from food to medication to gasoline starts running out.

column1: Supply Chain Rioters broke into trucks on I-85 and burned cargo in Charlotte

According to the American Trucking Association (ATA) a disruption of 24 to 48 hours means hospitals and nursing homes would run out of food. Fuel supplies at gas stations would also run out in that time frame. Garbage would start to pile up. Most grocery and retail stores would start to run out of food and merchandise. ATM and bank cash supplies would also run out.
The tight rope the corporate system walks quickly breaks when merchandise stops moving.
As an example
column2: the ATA tells us this is what happens during a hurricane. Imagine what would happen with days or weeks of rioting in major cities.

column1: In a hurricane situation
column2: supplies that would normally last a few days
column3: such as water
column4: powdered milk
column5: and canned meat
column6: typically disappear within one day. Given these inventory rates
column7: this means that perishable goods could be depleted in a matter of days and non-perishables in just a few days. Runs on food and non-food staples during hurricanes
column8: and even before big winter storms
column9: provide a good example of how fast some retail inventories can be depleted during panic buying. The same quick depletion of inventories could occur if trucks stopped making deliveries for any reason.

column1: Panic buying means no food on the shelves. When people don‚Äôt have food at home and then the grocery store doesn‚Äôt have food
column2: rioting will intensify. Things could get ugly in a hurry as one small disruption leads to a domino effect
column3: after which Bedlam ensues.

column1: So
column2: it is best to be prepared with non-perishable items just in case things get out of hand. Have at least several weeks food supply on hand. But
column3: how do you stop people from coming and taking your stash?

column1: Be Armed The police won‚Äôt be around to protect you if Bedlam ensues
Contrary to gun propaganda from the media
column2: you absolutely want to be armed in the event the election and its aftermath don‚Äôt pass peacefully. What happens when stores no longer have food and gas stations no longer have gas? Gangs form looking for homes that do have those items.

column1: They‚Äôre going to pick out the weakest home in the neighborhood and pounce.
A home with guns is a safe home. Just as this YouTube video shows
column2: armed thugs may bust into a house looking for money or food
column3: but they started jumping through plate glass windows and scrambling like cockroaches once the homeowner came out with guns blazing.

column1: Several handguns with extra ammunition are advised. Know how to use them. Be steady with the trigger. And don‚Äôt be afraid to use them if looters come to your house.
The police will NOT be there to protect you as they‚Äôll have their hands full with the chaos.
Better To Be Safe Than Sorry The idea of an intact nuclear family may be a trite memory

column1: 7963;43d156d23a791d4998e064521bc75d9bcf7f075e;0;Troy Francis;2016-11-02T18:01:28.236+02:00;5 Habits All Successful Seducers Share;"Whether you are looking to attract a long-term girlfriend or wife

column1: But while it can be useful to absorb successful people‚Äôs techniques

column1: 1. They take every opportunity

Guys who are great with women recognize and take up every opportunity that is presented to them. In this way they are somewhat akin to entrepreneurs. They know that the market is in a constant state of flux

column3: like the speculators of pussy they are

column1: Game writers will often advise men that they should be approaching all the time. I would wholeheartedly endorse this. I would also add that however many opportunities you‚Äôre taking now

column3: for example
column4: will try to get my first approach of the day in in the morning while I‚Äôm traveling to my office on the subway. There are so many cute girls on their way to work in London (or any reasonably-sized commuter city) and yet guys won‚Äôt talk to them
column5: rationalizing that it is too early
column6: she‚Äôll think I‚Äôm crazy or whatever. In actual fact

column1: So next time you are out and about and see an attractive girl

column1: 2. They notice and follow up on IOIs
While most game advice is centered on what the guy should do in order to attract the girl
column2: the fact remains that there will be many times that girls will shoot you so-called ‚Äòindicators of interest‚Äô
column3: or IOIs
column4: without you having done anything.

column3: and to follow up with alacrity. Not only do direct IOIs frequently lead to sex
column4: but also
column5: if you fail to pursue a potentially-interested girl you may find yourself regretting it for a long time afterwards. Men
column6: after all
column7: are the more romantic gender. There are few more lasting self-inflicted wounds than the thought of that beautiful girl who smiled at you at the museum and who you just know you could have dated

column1: The successful seducer is always on the lookout for IOIs
column2: therefore
column3: and he‚Äôll execute quickly when he gets them
column4: even if it means deviating slightly from his routine. For example

column6: petite and very feminine brunette‚Äîjust my type. Once you‚Äôve been in the game a while you will learn to distinguish a solid IOI from casual interest

column1: From The Marquis De Sade To Neomasculinity
Because mainstream publishing almost exclusively caters to women
column2: underground and independent writers have turned to fill the void of male-centric literature. From braggadocios ‚Äúfratire‚Äù writers like Tucker Max and Maddox to ‚Äúloser lit‚Äù authors such as Andy Nowicki and Ann Sterzinger to our very own Roosh and Quintus Curtius

column1: Viewed against the backdrop of alternative publishing

column3: I assumed it would be a tell-all memoir along the lines of Roosh‚Äôs A Dead Bat in Paraguay
column4: or a roman √† clef in the fashion of Charles Bukowski‚Äôs work. However
column5: it does indeed live up to its subtitle
column6: as much of the novel is devoted to lengthy
column7: detailed descriptions of the protagonist‚Äôs sexual encounters:

column1: She‚Äôd also gotten used to her chastity belt

column1: In the introduction

column4: and most offensive novel you‚Äôve ever read

column7: in which a woman is systematically trained to become a sex slave.

column1: Interestingly

column2: as nature has created her
column3: and man at present is educating her

Power Doesn‚Äôt Care What You Need
column2: As Long As You‚Äôre On Your Knees

column1: Enjoying Memoirs of a Misogynist requires you to get past the initial few chapters
column2: which read like Fifty Shades of Grey with about 30 extra IQ points. The initial plot concerns Melinda
column3: a runaway who falls into the care of a wealthy man who goes unnamed for most of the book. After offering her room and board
column4: the man and Melinda begin a relationship
column5: sealed by a contract where she agrees to become his sexual plaything:

column1: ‚ÄúMy body is my Master‚Äôs. It is his blank canvas
column2: for him to modify as many times
column3: and in as many different ways as he chooses.‚Äù He could hear her breath quickening as he read. ‚ÄúHe will control my bodily functions; most particularly my orgasms. I will only orgasm when my Master allows me.‚Äù

column1: What saves the book‚Äîand what kept me reading‚Äîwas its depiction of the protagonist (henceforth referred to as ‚ÄúMaster‚Äù). Far from the masturbatory blank slate that Christian Grey was
column2: Cocker depicts Master as a complex and conflicted character
column3: constantly trying to rationalize the way he treats Melinda (later re-christened ‚ÄúSlave‚Äù). Cocker‚Äôs deft writing kept me wondering what the protagonist‚Äôs motivations were all the way to the end. The book also frequently switches to Melinda‚Äôs perspective; while it‚Äôs usually a challenge for male writers to depict female characters (and vice versa)
column4: Cocker is skilled enough to make her compelling as well.

column1: Where Memoirs really picks up is in the second half
column2: which is set nearly ten years later. The focus shifts to Elizabeth Avery
column3: a disgraced doctor stripped of her medical license after she‚Äôs caught abusing a male patient. Destitute and despondent

column3: she couldn‚Äôt help but be disgusted that a woman had allowed herself to be treated this way. He‚Äôd said she consented to this. In fact
column4: the way she looked at the man showed she clearly loved him
column5: and was a willing participant in her modifications and degradation. The woman
column6: or Melinda
column7: as the man had called her
column8: looked up at him with what the doctor could only call adoration.

column1: Once again
column2: it would have been easy for Cocker to depict Elizabeth as a raging
column3: bra-burning feminist stereotype
column4: but he agilely avoids clich√©s in favor of nuance. Elizabeth isn‚Äôt portrayed as a fire-breathing misandrist
column5: but as a woman who unthinkingly absorbs leftist cant and has her life ruined because of it. The final chapters of the book show Elizabeth tussling with the sexual arousal she feels working for ‚ÄúMr. X‚Äù (her name for the protagonist) and her attempts to maintain her beliefs as the evidence of her failed life piles up. I won‚Äôt spoil the ending
column6: other than to say that after finishing the book
column7: I had to sit on it and digest it for a few days.

column1: Each chapter of Memoirs begins with a factual statistic about the state of men and boys in America today
column2: a jarring contrast with the depravity of the book‚Äôs action. I initially wondered why they were there
column3: but as I approached the end of the book
column4: it all suddenly clicked. Memoirs of a Misogynist is a biting look at what our toxic sexual marketplace does to men and women. American dating is like an acid bath: no one who dives into it comes out unscathed. Even men who are successful at getting laid are affected by what they have to do to get ahead. There are no winners
column5: no saints
column6: and no role models: just people trying to make the best of a broken system.

column1: As I stated earlier
column2: Memoirs takes a while to really get going
column3: and if you‚Äôre not into lascivious descriptions of sex
column4: the book won‚Äôt appeal to you. But if you want a haunting
column5: piercing look at the horror show of modern gender relations
column6: Memoirs of a Misogynist is a must-buy. I can‚Äôt wait to see what Cocker comes up with next.

column3: Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW)

column5: Gas Metal Arc Welding is the easiest to learn and offers the fastest production. Welding involves both Ferrous (steel) and Non-ferrous metals (aluminum
column6: stainless steel).

column1: Why Welding? 1. According to a Bureau of Labor report
column2: the need for welders will grow by 26 percent by 2020.

column1: 2. According to a National Association of Manufacturers report
column2: nearly 81 percent of manufacturers in the United States report that they cannot find skilled welders to meet demand.

column1: 3. The American Welding Society reports that the average age for a welder is now in the mid-fifties
4. Entry-level wages in my region average $28
column3: 000 annually
column4: with skilled welders earning $50
column5: 000 and more after five years in the trade.

column1: I frequently hear from employers who are desperate for skilled welders. One plant manager told me ‚Äúthere are too many computer jockeys and not enough people who can weld and turn a wrench.‚Äù Another manufacturer told me ‚Äúwe have over a dozen welders retiring and no one to replace them‚Äù. Further
column2: the school I teach at has more jobs available than they have students enrolled.

column1: What Welders Do Welders work in manufacturing
column2: construction
column3: maintenance repair facilities
column4: and service companies. Welders typically work eight-hour shifts and a five-day week
column5: but overtime is common. Welders often perform other duties like operating metal fabrication equipment and doing assembly work.

column1: The more skills a welder develops
column2: the more value and earning potential he has. For example
column3: being able to weld
column4: cut and fit up metals
column5: and read weld symbols and prints will command a higher wage. Becoming certified in certain weld procedures also increases a welder‚Äôs wages and marketability.

column1: Qualifications
Welding is the quintessential blue-collar job. It is physically demanding
column2: hot
column3: dirty
column4: and requires a high degree of skill. Other personal characteristics are good eyesight and hand eye coordination
column5: good manual dexterity
column6: and good concentration.

column1: Training Community colleges offer affordable training for entry-level jobs in welding. Most programs are nine months
column2: but my school also offers a sixteen-week work ready certificate in welding. Students learn common welding processes
column3: thermal cutting processes
column4: and blueprint reading. Unlike the typical ivory palace college professors
column5: instructors are required to have a minimum of three years related and verifiable industrial experience. Job placement is also good.

column1: Additional Facts
Despite a decent paying skill in high demand
column2: clueless parents and educators continue to dissuade young men from entering blue-collar trades like welding. The result has been an entire generation of young men ruined by hostile four-year colleges
column3: worthless degrees
column4: and insurmountable debt.

column1: Perhaps you are a perceptive and bright young ROK reader considering a career change. In closing
column2: consider these facts.

column1: 1. You will always have employment as a welder.
2. Welding skills are highly transferable. You can carry these skills to your next
column2: and often higher paying job.

column1: 3. Unlike many white-collar corporate jobs of today
column2: the average welder‚Äôs wages increase with skill. Overtime
column3: merit increases
column4: and production bonuses are common benefits for welders.

column1: 4. At the end of your shift
column2: you can leave your job at the door.

column1: 5. Welding offers a level of creativity
column2: solitude
column3: and seeing the fruits of your labor. Studies show that welders
column4: machinists
column5: and other blue-collar trades have lower suicide rates than many white-collar professions.

column1: 6. Welding is often a ‚Äúgateway trade‚Äù into other even higher paying trades like machinist
column2: multi-craft machinery maintenance
column3: and millwright.

column1: 7. Welding is a male dominated occupation. Traditionalist men will find it offers some insulation and respite from the typical feminist diatribe and PC bullshit of today‚Äôs corporate world.
Conclusion How has welding benefited me? First
column2: I developed reasoning skills
column3: something that academia failed to do. I also developed a thorough understanding of how men do the dirty
column4: nasty
column5: and dangerous jobs in this life. Feminists and elitists can marginalize men all they want
column6: but men risk their lives and health to build and maintain their shit.

column1: Further
column2: welding has opened some doors for me
column3: mainly teaching. My ultimate goal is to teach welding full-time
column4: a late life career change if you will
column5: and one I hope will happen.

column1: A lack of self-confidence

column1: They Want To Be Friends With Everyone How to destroy a political movement established by one‚Äôs father in one fell swoop.

column5: like women

column1: Is There A Remedy For These Character Flaws? Even if we understand these characteristics

column1: Though she treading and surfing on bones of actual past people is not very respectful for sure

column1: Usual newcomers to the Catacombs come there with a genuine interest in the place. They come to find out

column1: 7978;cb8bf98e2abbf6b1008e8ccdc23195b23c0de6db;0;News Syndicator;2016-11-06T05:08:22.861+02:00;Donald Trump Rushed Off Stage In Reno After Possible Assassination Attempt;"  Donald Trump Rushed Off Stage In Reno After Possible Assassination Attempt Donald Trump Rushed Off Stage In Reno After Possible Assassination Attempt

column1: Via Breitbart :
Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump was rushed offstage at a Reno

column1: Video of Trump being rushed off stage was posted online:

In the video it appears Trump pauses to look out into the crowd for the event disrupter. Two U.S. Secret Service agents can be seen rushing in to remove Trump from the stage and two other agents also facilitate his removal.
During his absence someone announced to the crowd that Trump would return. The protester was eventually seen being removed from the crowd
column2: although there appeared to be a struggle with several law enforcement or Secret Service agents to secure the protester‚Äôs removal. It was several minutes before Trump was able to take the stage again.

column1: As Trump returned to the stage
column2: he thanked the crowd
column3: which cheered him back.

column1: ‚ÄúNobody said it was going to be easy for us
column2: but we will never be stopped
column3: never ever be stopped
column4: ‚Äù said Trump. Here is the man in question
column5: in handcuffs
column6: being searched by officers after he was escorted out of the rally area. pic.twitter.com/pjoMCtM39K";english;2016-11-06T05:08:22.861+02:00;returnofkings.com;US;25945.0;Donald Trump Rushed Off Stage In Reno After Possible Assassination Attempt;0.0;;0;1;0;0;0;hate

column1: 7980;c49315bda5abe1009687df53e32a2d11b785bcdb;0;Larsen Halleck;2016-11-06T20:01:01.964+02:00;Don‚Äôt Believe The Myth That Weightlifting Will Slow You Down;"Many older physical trainers
column2: and even those younger ones who were proteges of the older men
column3: will tell the trainee that there is an inverse correlation between strength and speed‚Äîthat being too big and muscular will slow down an athlete (for whatever reason
column4: I have found that this is most prevalent amongst traditional martial artists). The usual reason given is that the increased mass is simply a ‚Äúdead weight‚Äù
column5: while those with a little bit more knowledge will explain that lifting will develop ‚Äúslow twitch‚Äù muscles over the ‚ÄúFast twitch‚Äù muscles needed for sprinting
column6: jumping
column7: punching
column8: and kicking.

column1: I am here to tell you that the ‚Äúcommon wisdom‚Äù is completely wrong-when done properly
column2: weightlifting will not impede your speed
column3: and will in fact enhance your speed and explosiveness!

column1: Anecdotes Perhaps you‚Äôve heard of this man?
That is of course Jamaica‚Äôs Usain Bolt
column2: the fastest man in the world
column3: and holder of multiple Olympic records. Also worth noting is that in an interview
column4: Mr. Bolt revealed that he squats 400 pounds
column5: and at least partially attributes his nigh inhuman speed to his training regimen. And he‚Äôs not the only speed athlete who this can be said of-look at any Olympic class sprinter
column6: they are all quite muscular fellows.

column1: Similarly
column2: other athletic disciplines (that‚Äôs ‚Äúathletics‚Äù in the specific rather than general sense
column3: I‚Äôm using the European term for what my countrymen call ‚Äútrack and field‚Äù) have claimed to utilize weightlifting in their training
column4: such as the long jump and the hurdles. Or
column5: you can take my word for it: at my best I had a one rep max squat of 320 pounds
column6: and had a 38 inch vertical leap (I am judging this by my ability to perform a standing jump over 2nd-highest position hurdles
column7: which are measured at 38 inches ).

column1: In fact
column2: many world-level athletes of all disciplines are utilizing Olympic style weightlifting to develop speed and powe r.

column1: Anyway you slice it
column2: compound weight training is a fantastic supplement to all athletes
column3: even those who seemingly don‚Äôt need that raw brute strength.

column1: The Science As I elaborated in this article
column2: as well as in the free PDF I offer to subscribers to my website (the subscription sign-up is on the front page) there‚Äôs more than one type of way to be athletic. More accurately
column3: there are three
column4: speaking purely in terms of muscular and/or nervous system function
column5: so this does not include hand-to-eye coordination or other skills related to team sports. These three things can
column6: loosely
column7: correlate to the three types of muscle fibers-Red‚Äîor slow‚ÄîOxidative
column8: Fast Glycolytic-or White-
column9: and Fast Oxidative. Rather than rehash an article that I‚Äôve already written
column10: we will focus on the white muscle
column11: the fast glycolytic. This is the type of muscle you want to be training for if you want to develop sprinting speed or a high vertical leap.

column1: Or
column2: to put this into terms of Newton‚Äôs second law of motion
column3: Acceleration=Force/Mass
column4: ie: the amount of muscular force you can exert
column5: divided by your body weight=how fast you can accelerate. And yes
column6: I am aware that there‚Äôs probably a more mathematically accurate way of putting this.

column1: Which Exercises To Do? It is at this point that you‚Äôre probably asking which exercises you should train to develop those physical skills you desire. If you read my articles regularly
column2: you will know what I am likely to say-compound free weight lifting!

column1: In fact
column2: I‚Äôll go out on a limb and say if you don‚Äôt know which exercise you should do to develop a certain physical trait
column3: you should always default to a compound lift unless you receive some further information that says otherwise. Training for speed or vertical leap is no exception to this rule.

column1: If you are looking for sheer running speed and leaping ability
column2: the power lifts that hit the lower body are most effective: deep ‚ÄúAss to grass‚Äù squats
column3: deadlifts
column4: and the clean and jerk are used by professional athletes to great effect.

column1: Similarly
column2: if you want the ability to throw a ball or punch harder
column3: upper body compound lifts are the key: bench presses
column4: overhead presses and
column5: yes
column6: the clean and jerk
column7: will see you through.

column1: So for those of you who are afraid that your athletic performance will be somehow impeded by heavy weightlifting
column2: nothing could be further from the truth.

column1: Read More: Improve Your Weightlifting With A Video Camera

column1: 7982;af64d4793b8c19f04030ea273f8507bacd69b783;0;Relampago Furioso;2016-11-07T19:01:22.550+02:00;Relentless Media Censorship Is Brining Us A Fate Worse Than Big Brother;"Do you really like sexy women like the one in the photo above? Are you sure? Big Brother Google says ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you look at this story about alternative lifestyles about men who have realized what terrible misogynists they are for having sexual desires?‚Äù rather than searching for articles on for pick-up artistry .
Sooner rather than later
column2: all Internet roads will lead to the same New World Order Socialist philosophy.

column1: As profiling of Internet users becomes more prolific and the algorithms more sophisticated in the coming years
column2: the news and information we search for will be tailored to slowly ‚Äúnudge‚Äù us one way or the other politically
column3: one small step at a time.

column1: The management of the information we get to read is already in its infancy.

Why do you think that ‚Äúfree‚Äù app on your phone that only performs a few functions swells in size with each ‚Äúupdate‚Äù that is released? Do you really think they give a damn about your privacy and are plugging security holes? Hell no. The apps we download are moving from useful
column2: low-resource using services to resource hogs (necessitating an upgrade in processing power every year or two) because they only provide us with a ‚Äúfree‚Äù service in order to hook us so the apps can gather information about everything we‚Äôve ever written on our devices for social engineers and marketing flacks. The apps are becoming more sophisticated in the way they monitor everything we do ‚Äì which is why the apps need all that memory size.

column1: And soon
column2: apps will be gathering information about everything we‚Äôve ever said aloud by using the built in microphones on each device and speech recognition technology. CIA agents confirm microphones can easily be activated even when a device is switched completely off.

column1: This type of information will be collected in giant databases such as the Utah Data Center
column2: with the ultimate goal being the corporate-government complex knowing more about us than we know about ourselves.

column1: Big Brother Was So Yesterday Orwell‚Äôs Big Brother idea never could have imagined the insidious nature of today‚Äôs information technology
Today‚Äôs information technology has put Big Brother on steroids.

The Waking Times details this frightful world that is already emerging as anyone who pays attention knows search engines are already tailoring information to what we search for and even what we text people about.
‚ÄúMr. X
column2: we‚Äôve studied the little virtual bubble you live in
column3: and now we can sell you your own special brand of truth.‚Äù

column1: Most of the time
column2: the information one will see in this Internet bubble will be customized to suit a person‚Äôs interests. This is why Facebook relentlessly pushes the ‚ÄúLike a page or product‚Äù portion of its web site. This information is used to build a profile of a person that ultimately will be able to accurately predict the color of their next bowel movement.

column1: If a man is interested in non-GMO foods advertising and ‚Äúnews‚Äù stories will be tailored to inform him of grocers who sell organics and about news from ‚Äúapproved‚Äù outlets with stories written on the topic. Most of the time
column2: this will be insidious advertising and ads disguised as information.

column1: ‚ÄúHello
column2: audience. We‚Äôre going to pitch you on becoming full-fledged obsessed consumers
column3: as if there is no other worthy goal in life‚Äîand then we‚Äôre going to profile you from top to bottom
column4: to find out exactly what kind of obsessed consumer you are
column5: so we can hit you and trigger you with information that uniquely stimulates your adrenal glands‚Ä¶‚Äù

column1: The Utah Data Center is designed to store exabytes of information on ‚Äúall forms of communication
column2: including emails
column3: cell phone calls
column4: and Internet searches
column5: as well as all types of personal data trails‚Äîparking receipts
column6: travel itineraries
column7: and bookstore purchases‚Äù

column1: As another example: Okay
column2: we know you are interested in traditional gender roles. We ( the information managers like Facebook and Google) will now to find news stories and customize the information you get to read online in order to cause you to doubt the validity of your beliefs. The ultimate goal is to slowly but steadily move you away from believing in traditional gender roles to believing in militant feminism without you realizing what we have done.

column1: This type of information management is even more insidious than outright censorship
column2: as it will be designed to steer everyone towards what the controllers of society want us to think and buy
column3: no matter how far from the ideal consumer and fellow traveler we may be.

column1: Think of it as a game of Plinko on The Price is Right
column2: in which all chips ultimately fall into the ‚Äúperfect
column3: braindead consumer‚Äù slot at the bottom of the maze. The social engineers‚Äô dream is a world of nothing but sexless consumers who perform mindless work in meaningless jobs
column4: whose only outlets for pleasure are shopping and eating out and other State-approved activities.

column1: Think that‚Äôs hyperbole? Travel around the world for six months to a year
column2: then come back to the United States and tell me what you think.

column1: Little Information Bubbles Merge Into Big Information Bubbles We become what we are repeatedly exposed to
column2: which is why a war is on for your mind

column1: Once we have you believing a certain way or questioning your established beliefs
column2: the key comes when it is time to steer public perception one way or the other. This is where the ‚Äúrubber meets the road‚Äù in the realm of managing the populace like so many sheeple.

column1: BUT when a Big One comes along
column2: like the 2016 national election in the US
column3: the separate tunes come together and ring as one. Then the overriding need to extend Globalism‚Äôs goals (in the person of Hillary Clinton) blot out every other priority. Then the major media twist whatever they need to twist. Then it‚Äôs the same bubble for everyone.

column1: Soon
column2: just like the mainstream media on television and in print
column3: everything you see online will be directed at making you think
column4: behave and vote a certain way. The micromanagement and control of information just hasn‚Äôt become that sophisticated ‚Äì yet.

column1: Obama already hinted that only ‚Äúofficial‚Äù information should be linked up by the corporate interests of Facebook
column2: Google
column3: etc. Look for Hillary to implement that idea with an iron fist if she is whisked into the Oval Office . An Internet security ‚Äúcrisis‚Äù will likely be engineered in the near future in which‚Äîyou guessed it‚ÄîBig Daddy Government needs to step in and take control of the web. From there on out we will be back to corporate-government propaganda instead of the Libertarian‚Äôs dream the current iteration of the Internet is.

column1: So
column2: the awakening we have seen from the brainwashing of the corporate media will be a temporary one if the elite have anything to do with it. The groundwork of this new
column3: Socialist system of micromanaging information is already being laid. You already see it every time you do a search.

column1: Someday soon the only information we‚Äôll be able to find online will be from sources the corporate-government complex approves of. Of course
column2: there will be renegades and rebels like us who resist
column3: but most of the braindead sheeple out there will go along to get along just as has been happening since time immemorial.

column1: Our options will be to get off the grid or to move to a new Internet. Neither move will be peacefully tolerated by the powers that be.
