12620;863d932e2538314a1da6ffb022acd04a456e2260;0;Bill Federer;2016-10-27T00:40:20.883+03:00;The man who spoke softly but carried a big stick;"The man who spoke softly but carried a big stick Bill Federer remembers military philosophy of Theodore Roosevelt Published: 1 min ago Print Theodore Roosevelt
Theodore Roosevelt was born Oct. 27
column2: 1858. His wife and mother died on Valentine‚Äôs Day
column3: Feb. 14
column4: 1884. He wrote in his diary ‚ÄúThe light has gone out in my life.‚Äù Depressed
column5: he left to ranch in the Dakotas.

column1: Returning to New York
column2: he entered politics and rose to assistant secretary of the Navy. He resigned during the Spanish-American War
column3: organized the first Volunteer Cavalry
column4: ‚Äúthe Rough Riders
column5: ‚Äù and captured Cuba‚Äôs San Juan Hill. Elected Vice-President under William McKinley
column6: he became America‚Äôs youngest president in 1901.

column1: Republican Theodore Roosevelt was the first president to invite an African-American
column2: Booker T. Washington
column3: to dine in the White House on Oct. 16
column4: 1901. A Southern Democrat newspapers condemned him it
column5: as printed in the Memphis Scimitar: ‚ÄúThe most damnable outrage which has ever been perpetrated by any citizen of the United States was committed yesterday by the President
column6: when he invited a n- to dine with him at the White House. It would not be worth more than a passing notice if Theodore Roosevelt had sat down to dinner in his own home with a Pullman car porter
column7: but Roosevelt the individual and Roosevelt the president are not to be viewed in the same light.‚Äù

column2: Theodore Roosevelt warned: ‚ÄúThe thought of modern industry in the hands of Christian charity is a dream worth dreaming. The thought of industry in the hands of paganism is a nightmare beyond imagining. The choice between the two is upon us.‚Äù

the New York Bible Society had Theodore Roosevelt write a message which was inscribed in a pocket New Testament & Book of Psalms given to World War I soldiers: ‚ÄúThe teachings of the New Testament are foreshadowed in Micah‚Äôs verse (Micah vi. 8): ‚ÄòWhat more does the Lord require of thee than to do justice
column3: and to love mercy
column4: and to walk humbly with thy God?‚Äô Do justice; and therefore fight valiantly against the armies of Germany and Turkey
column5: for these nations in this crisis stand for the reign of Moloch and Beelzebub on this earth. Love mercy; treat prisoners well
column6: succor the wounded
column7: treat every woman as if she was your sister
column8: care for the little children
column9: and be tender to the old and helpless. Walk humbly; You will do so if you study the life and teachings of the Saviour. May the God of justice and mercy have you in His keeping. ‚Äì (signed) Theodore Roosevelt.‚Äù

Theodore Roosevelt
column2: in his book ‚ÄúFear God and Take Your Own Part‚Äù (NY: George H. Doran Co.
column4: wrote:

column1: Armenians ‚Ä¶ for some centuries have sedulously avoided militarism and war ‚Ä¶ are so suffering precisely and exactly because they have been pacifists whereas their neighbors
column2: the Turks
column3: have not been pacifists but militarists. (T. Roosevelt
column4: Fear God

column1: Armenians
column2: have been subjected to wrongs far greater than any that have been committed since the close of the Napoleonic Wars‚Ä¶the wars of Genghis Khan and Tamerlane in Asia. Yet this government has not raised its hand to do anything to help the people who were wronged. ‚Ä¶ This course of national infamy ‚Ä¶ began when the last Administration surrendered to the peace at-any-price people
column3: and started the negotiation of its foolish and wicked all inclusive arbitration treaties. Individuals and nations who preach the doctrine of milk-and-water invariably have in them a softness of fiber which means that they fear to antagonize those who preach and practice the doctrine of blood-and-iron. (T. Roosevelt
column4: Fear God

column1: American eye-witness of the fearful atrocities
column2: Mr. Arthur H. Gleason (New York Tribune
column3: Nov. 25
column4: 1915)‚Ä¶ Serbia is at this moment passing under the harrow of torture and mortal anguish. Now
column5: the Armenians have been butchered under circumstances of murder and torture and rape that would have appealed to an old-time Apache Indian. ‚Ä¶

column1: Even to nerves dulled and jaded by the heaped-up horrors of the past year and a half
column2: the news of the terrible fate that has befallen the Armenians must give a fresh shock of sympathy and indignation. Let me emphatically point out that the sympathy is useless unless it is accompanied with indignation
column3: and that the indignation is useless if it exhausts itself in words instead of taking shape in deeds. ‚Ä¶ If this people through its government had not shirked its duty ‚Ä¶ we would now be able to take effective action on behalf of Armenia.

column1: Mass meetings on behalf of the Armenians amount to nothing whatever if they are mere methods of giving a sentimental but ineffective and safe outlet to the emotion of those engaged in them. ‚Ä¶ The principles of the peace-at-any-price men
column2: of the professional pacifists ‚Ä¶ will be as absolutely ineffective for international righteousness. ‚Ä¶ This crowning iniquity of the wholesale slaughter of the Armenians ‚Ä¶ must be shared by the neutral powers headed by the United States for their failure to protest when this initial wrong was committed. ‚Ä¶ The devastation of Poland and Serbia has been awful beyond description and has been associated with infamies surpassing those of the dreadful religious and racial wars of the seventeenth-century Europe. ‚Ä¶

column1: Weak and timid milk-and-water policy of the professional pacifists is just as responsible as the blood-and-iron policy of the ruthless and unscrupulous militarist for the terrible recrudescence of evil on a gigantic scale in the civilized world. The crowning outrage has been committed by the Turks on the Armenians. They have suffered atrocities so hideous that it is difficult to name them
column2: atrocities such as those inflicted upon conquered nations by the followers of Attila and of Genghis Khan.

column1: It is dreadful to think that these things can be done and that this nation nevertheless remarks ‚Äòneutral not only in deed but in thought
column2: ‚Äô between right and the most hideous wrong
column3: neutral between despairing and hunted people
column4: people whose little children are murdered and their women raped
column5: and the victorious and evil wrong-doers. ‚Ä¶

column1: I trust that all Americans worthy of the name feel their deepest indignation and keenest sympathy aroused by the dreadful Armenian atrocities. I trust that they feel ‚Ä¶ that a peace obtained without ‚Ä¶ righting the wrongs of the Armenians would be worse than any war. ‚Ä¶
Wrongdoing will only be stopped by men who are brave as well as just
column2: who put honor above safety
column3: who are true to a lofty ideal of duty
column4: who prepare in advance to make their strength effective
column5: and who shrink from no hazard
column6: not even the final hazard of war
column7: if necessary in order to serve the great cause of righteousness. When our people take this stand
column8: we shall also be able effectively to take a stand in international matters which shall prevent such cataclysms of wrong as have been witnesses‚Ä¶on an even greater scale in Armenia. (T. Roosevelt
column9: Fear God

column1: In his book ‚ÄúFear God and Take Your Part
column3: Theodore Roosevelt wrote:

column1: Christianity is not the creed of Asia and Africa at this moment solely because the seventh century Christians of Asia and Africa had trained themselves not to fight
column2: whereas the Moslems were trained to fight. Christianity was saved in Europe solely because the peoples of Europe fought.

column1: If the peoples of Europe in the 7th and 8th centuries
column2: and on up to and including the 17th century
column3: had not possessed a military equality with
column4: and gradually a growing superiority over the Mohammedans who invaded Europe
column5: Europe would at this moment be Mohammedan and the Christian religion would be exterminated.

column1: A contemporary of Theodore Roosevelt was the English author G.K. Chesterton
column2: who wrote of Western Christian civilization (‚ÄúThe Collected Works of G.K. Chesterton: Volume XX
column3: ‚Äù Introduction and Notes by James V. Schall
column4: Ignatius Press): ‚ÄúThey seem entirely to forget that long before the Crusaders had dreamed of riding to Jerusalem
column5: the Moslems had almost ridden into Paris.‚Äù

column1: Theodore Roosevelt continued in ‚ÄúFear God and Take Your Part
column2: ‚Äù 1916: ‚ÄúWherever the Mohammedans have had complete sway
column3: wherever the Christians have been unable to resist them by the sword
column4: Christianity has ultimately disappeared. From the hammer of Charles Martel to the sword of Jan Sobieski
column5: Christianity owed its safety in Europe to the fact that it was able to show that it could and would fight as well as the Mohammedan aggressor.‚Äù

column2: have been subjected to wrongs far greater than any that have been committed since the close of the Napoleonic Wars‚Ä¶the wars of Genghis Khan and Tamerlane in Asia. Yet this government has not raised its hand to do anything to help the people who were wronged. ‚Ä¶ This course of national infamy ‚Ä¶ began when the last Administration surrendered to the peace at-any-price people
column3: and started the negotiation of its foolish and wicked all inclusive arbitration treaties. Individuals and nations who preach the doctrine of milk-and-water invariably have in them a softness of fiber which means that they fear to antagonize those who preach and practice the doctrine of blood-and-iron. (T. Roosevelt
column4: Fear God

column1: American eye-witness of the fearful atrocities
column2: Mr. Arthur H. Gleason (New York Tribune
column3: Nov. 25
column4: 1915)‚Ä¶ Serbia is at this moment passing under the harrow of torture and mortal anguish. Now
column5: the Armenians have been butchered under circumstances of murder and torture and rape that would have appealed to an old-time Apache Indian. ‚Ä¶

column1: Even to nerves dulled and jaded by the heaped-up horrors of the past year and a half
column2: the news of the terrible fate that has befallen the Armenians must give a fresh shock of sympathy and indignation. Let me emphatically point out that the sympathy is useless unless it is accompanied with indignation
column3: and that the indignation is useless if it exhausts itself in words instead of taking shape in deeds. ‚Ä¶ If this people through its government had not shirked its duty ‚Ä¶ we would now be able to take effective action on behalf of Armenia.

column1: Mass meetings on behalf of the Armenians amount to nothing whatever if they are mere methods of giving a sentimental but ineffective and safe outlet to the emotion of those engaged in them. ‚Ä¶ The principles of the peace-at-any-price men
column2: of the professional pacifists ‚Ä¶ will be as absolutely ineffective for international righteousness. ‚Ä¶ This crowning iniquity of the wholesale slaughter of the Armenians ‚Ä¶ must be shared by the neutral powers headed by the United States for their failure to protest when this initial wrong was committed. ‚Ä¶ The devastation of Poland and Serbia has been awful beyond description and has been associated with infamies surpassing those of the dreadful religious and racial wars of the seventeenth-century Europe. ‚Ä¶

column1: Weak and timid milk-and-water policy of the professional pacifists is just as responsible as the blood-and-iron policy of the ruthless and unscrupulous militarist for the terrible recrudescence of evil on a gigantic scale in the civilized world. The crowning outrage has been committed by the Turks on the Armenians. They have suffered atrocities so hideous that it is difficult to name them
column2: atrocities such as those inflicted upon conquered nations by the followers of Attila and of Genghis Khan.

column1: It is dreadful to think that these things can be done and that this nation nevertheless remarks ‚Äòneutral not only in deed but in thought
column2: ‚Äô between right and the most hideous wrong
column3: neutral between despairing and hunted people
column4: people whose little children are murdered and their women raped
column5: and the victorious and evil wrong-doers. ‚Ä¶

column1: I trust that all Americans worthy of the name feel their deepest indignation and keenest sympathy aroused by the dreadful Armenian atrocities. I trust that they feel ‚Ä¶ that a peace obtained without ‚Ä¶ righting the wrongs of the Armenians would be worse than any war. ‚Ä¶
Wrongdoing will only be stopped by men who are brave as well as just
column2: who put honor above safety
column3: who are true to a lofty ideal of duty
column4: who prepare in advance to make their strength effective
column5: and who shrink from no hazard
column6: not even the final hazard of war
column7: if necessary in order to serve the great cause of righteousness. When our people take this stand
column8: we shall also be able effectively to take a stand in international matters which shall prevent such cataclysms of wrong as have been witnesses‚Ä¶on an even greater scale in Armenia. (T. Roosevelt
column9: Fear God

column1: In his book ‚ÄúFear God and Take Your Part
column3: Theodore Roosevelt wrote:

column1: Christianity is not the creed of Asia and Africa at this moment solely because the seventh century Christians of Asia and Africa had trained themselves not to fight
column2: whereas the Moslems were trained to fight. Christianity was saved in Europe solely because the peoples of Europe fought.

column1: If the peoples of Europe in the 7th and 8th centuries
column2: and on up to and including the 17th century
column3: had not possessed a military equality with
column4: and gradually a growing superiority over the Mohammedans who invaded Europe
column5: Europe would at this moment be Mohammedan and the Christian religion would be exterminated.

column1: A contemporary of Theodore Roosevelt was the English author G.K. Chesterton
column2: who wrote of Western Christian civilization (‚ÄúThe Collected Works of G.K. Chesterton: Volume XX
column3: ‚Äù Introduction and Notes by James V. Schall
column4: Ignatius Press): ‚ÄúThey seem entirely to forget that long before the Crusaders had dreamed of riding to Jerusalem
column5: the Moslems had almost ridden into Paris.‚Äù

column1: Theodore Roosevelt continued in ‚ÄúFear God and Take Your Part
column2: ‚Äù 1916: ‚ÄúWherever the Mohammedans have had complete sway
column3: wherever the Christians have been unable to resist them by the sword
column4: Christianity has ultimately disappeared. From the hammer of Charles Martel to the sword of Jan Sobieski
column5: Christianity owed its safety in Europe to the fact that it was able to show that it could and would fight as well as the Mohammedan aggressor.‚Äù

column1: 12624;565be78e00f20aeb715adda13de5e833cab6d5c4;0;-NO AUTHOR-;2016-10-27T01:22:34.484+03:00;Federal judge charges Sheriff Joe with contempt;"Federal judge charges Sheriff Joe with contempt Arpaio seeking 7th term

column2: leaving the 84-year-old lawman in a tough spot two weeks before Election Day as he seeks a seventh term.

column2: but the misdemeanor count wasn‚Äôt officially filed against him until U.S. District Judge Susan Bolton signed it.

column1: 12625;37903d3104f269c41250752b30d469189f86222e;0;-NO AUTHOR-;2016-10-27T00:52:00.000+03:00;'All About Jesus' shirt sparks school uproar;"'All About Jesus' shirt sparks school uproar Legal action threatened over 'hostility toward religious beliefs' Published: 6 hours ago

(HOUSTON CHRONICLE) ‚Äî A Dallas Fort-Worth high school that initially refused to print a religious logo on their sports jersey has changed its mind after receiving a letter threatening legal action from a religious advocacy group.
At the beginning of the school year
column2: Texas Flower Mound High School was searching for potential sponsors for its competitive bass-fishing team. For a donation of $200
column3: a company would have their logo displayed on the team‚Äôs website and jersey for four years.

column1: In early September

column3: the owner of a boat repair company called 1st Choice Marine and parent to a member of the high school‚Äôs bass-fishing team
column4: responded to the offer. Jones‚Äô company logo
column5: a picture of a boat surrounded by red lettering that read ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not about us
column6: it‚Äôs all about Jesus
column7: ‚Äù was rejected by the school.";english;2016-10-27T01:59:51.424+03:00;wnd.com;GB;1550.0;'All About Jesus' shirt sparks school uproar;0.0;http://mobile.wnd.com/files/2016/09/jesus_wept.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 12626;a631576d9ebcdc01c623a7cbdd1c370245b17433;0;Joseph Farah;2016-10-27T02:38:20.630+03:00;Loretta Lynch takes on 'killer cops' -- except in D.C.;"Print
Have you ever noticed how Washington always has a plan to solve everybody‚Äôs problem ‚Äì except their own?
For the federal government
column2: it‚Äôs always easy and tempting to look at problems ‚Äì real or imagined ‚Äì outside of the beltway and solve them from afar.

column1: You will recall
column2: of course
column3: how former Attorney General Eric Holder was going to stop police shootings all over America with sensitivity training
column4: the power and force of the federal government and investigations
column5: investigations and more investigations.

column1: Now Loretta Lynch
column2: his successor
column3: also known as Hillary Clinton‚Äôs guardian angel
column4: is set to turn police shootings throughout America into big business and more power for Washington.

column1: Her latest pet project is assembling a national database on ‚Äúinteractions between law enforcement and civilians
column2: ‚Äù she reported this month.

column1: ‚ÄúAccurate and comprehensive data on the use of force by law enforcement is essential to an informed and productive discussion about community-police relations
column2: ‚Äù Lynch said. ‚ÄúIn the days ahead
column3: the Department of Justice will continue to work alongside our local
column4: state
column5: tribal and federal partners to ensure that we put in place a system to collect data that is comprehensive
column6: useful
column7: and responsive to the needs of the communities we serve.‚Äù

column1: The irony here is thick
column2: indeed.

column1: One of Lynch‚Äôs goals
column2: she says
column3: is to get law enforcement agencies to report more thoroughly about people who died during an interaction with them.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: Lynch presides over the most egregious cover-up of the most outrageous police shooting case I have ever seen in my life ‚Äì namely the killing of Miriam Carey
column3: a young black mother with baby in tow
column4: who was gunned down by Washington cops and Secret Service agents for a wrong turn in the nation‚Äôs capital.

column1: Lynch wants reports?
So does WND
column2: which has been pursuing the information through Freedom of Information Act requests and finally
column3: after being stonewalled for years
column4: a lawsuit.

column1: So does the public and the family of Miriam Carey. Unfortunately
column2: Lynch is holding back on a few things: Missing Evidence The 92-page memo with findings
column3: analysis of evidence and conclusions in the Carey shooting investigation. This would show the evidence and reasoning that led the Department of Justice to decline to file criminal charges against officers. Why they considered this a justifiable homicide ‚Äì or whether they should have
column4: based on the evidence. Why officers used deadly force. Whether officers followed or violated the policy of their agencies. Video of shooting at Capitol Police guard post at intersection of Constitution Ave.
column5: Maryland Ave. and 2nd Street. Only stills have been released. Video would show more clearly if officer‚Äôs life actually was in danger
column6: as DOJ claimed
column7: when he fired fatal shot to Carey‚Äôs head. Not one of the five witnesses at the scene said Carey was driving at the officer
column8: as the DOJ claimed. Police statements The police report said four officers fired shots at Carey
column9: two from the Capitol Police and two from the Secret Service. Not one statement from those officers was in the report. Their names were also redacted. Redacted information An attorney in the Washington
column10: D.C.
column11: mayor‚Äôs office said the only redactions were names
column12: in order to protect privacy. It turned out much more was redacted than names. The report was riddled with blacked-out sections and missing information. 12 pages in the report were entirely blacked out. 15 pages were mostly blacked out. 22 pages were partially blacked out. Some of the blacked-out pages just included a heading marked ‚ÄúEvidence.‚Äù Some just had a date. Witness statements An astonishing 38 witness accounts are missing from the police report. The police report stated: ‚ÄúThere were seventy-two (72) witnesses interviewed regarding this incident and their statements were captured by audio and/or video recordings. Copies of the aforementioned recordings were turned over to the USAO for review. Copies of the aforementioned audio and video recordings are stored in the main case file at the Technical Support Unit (TSU) located at the IAD.‚Äù Of those 72 witness statements
column13: only 34 were in the materials provided to WND
column14: leaving 38 missing. Statement transcripts None of the actual transcripts of interviews in the witnesses‚Äô own words were provided
column15: just paraphrased versions in what the former NYPD officer Sanders described as ‚Äúcop talk.‚Äù White House guard post video Stills were released but not the video. It would show whether anyone was manning the post when Carey drove up; whether she tried to drive around the off-duty guard who dragged a gate in front of her; and whether she sped off
column16: or left at a normal speed
column17: as a witness said. Police radio recordings No recordings or transcripts of radio transmissions during the pursuit and shooting of Carey were provided in the FOIA material. Also not provided were transcripts of computer transmissions (instant messaging) between squad cars and police headquarters. Ballistics and forensics reports The Justice Department Washington Metro Police Department responses to FOIA requests did not include a ballistics or a forensics report.

column1: I could go on and on. For people who want facts and reports
column2: the U.S. Justice Department under both Holder and Lynch have a strong propensity for not willingly releasing the facts and reports to the public or the press.

column1: We‚Äôve been at this for a long time ‚Äì years. Yet the stonewall and cover-up of a horrendous
column2: unjustifiable
column3: outrageous police shooting right in their own jurisdiction and backyard continues.

column1: Do we really expect Eric Holder and Loretta Lynch to find justice for police shooting victims outside of their own jurisdiction with a track record like that?

column1: 12629;dbcce1b01ac8d83098b30eaf70846b2ab115adc2;0;Matt Barber;2016-10-27T02:38:55.138+03:00;Why 'Never Trumpers' must reconsider;"While Democrats perpetually circle the wagons
column2: Republicans engage a perpetual circular firing squad. The same holds true for many evangelicals. Democrats and secularists count on it.

column1: And we never disappoint.
Full disclosure: I went from a dogged ‚ÄúNever Trumper‚Äù to a ‚ÄúMaybe Trumper‚Äù and
column2: finally
column3: settled as a ‚ÄúReluctant Trumper.‚Äù I
column4: like any God-fearing father of daughters was
column5: and remain
column6: appalled by Donald Trump‚Äôs sordid past
column7: and his 11-year-old vulgar video in which he objectified women. His words are indefensible
column8: and I fully expect the Clinton camp to strategically release additional revolting and embarrassing opposition research about the Republican nominee before Election Day.

column1: Still
column2: I will be voting against Hillary Clinton on Nov. 8 in what is objectively and irrefutably the most effective way possible: by casting a vote
column3: for better or worse
column4: for the policies and promises of Donald Trump ‚Äì and for the vice presidency of Gov. Mike Pence.

column1: Regrettably
column2: with many of my Never Trump friends I‚Äôm reminded of the fanatic who refuses his daughter chemotherapy and watches her die in an effort to convince himself (and others) of the strength of his own faith. Pride is an awful thing. We are to be ‚Äúwise as serpents and innocent as doves‚Äù (Matthew 10:16). Foolishness called ‚Äúfaith‚Äù is just foolishness.

column1: Even so
column2: there are Christian Pharisees on both extremes of this Trump fiasco: first
column3: those Trumpian cultists who buy the ‚ÄúMake America great again!‚Äù pablum and deride any person who
column4: while not casting judgment upon others
column5: makes
column6: with all sincerity
column7: what they view as the principled decision. The latter say they‚Äôll sit this one out (or go through the motions by voting third party ‚Äì a wasted vote by any objective standard). While I appreciate this milder strain of Never Trumper‚Äôs sincerity
column8: I nonetheless believe it is sincerely wrong.

column1: And then there are the self-righteous
column2: plank-in-the-eye Never Trump prigs who slander as having ‚Äúlost their saltiness
column3: ‚Äù‚Äúsinned against God‚Äù and ‚Äúcompromised their principles
column4: ‚Äù brothers and sisters who recognize the empirical reality that a vote for a horribly flawed (Lord knows I‚Äôm the worst sinner of all) baby Christian as president is a vote against Hillary Clinton‚Äôs tyranny in perpetuity.

column1: The Media Research Center has done America a tremendous service. In 2014 the watchdog organization released a video of an actual partial birth abortion ‚Äì something Hillary Clinton stood on stage during the final presidential debate
column2: stared into the camera with cold
column3: callous eyes
column4: and then both lied about and defended unequivocally. I plead with Never Trumpers to watch the video and then prayerfully reassess their plans for Nov. 8.

column1: Mrs. Clinton‚Äôs beloved late-term abortion practice is one so brutal and needless that even the left-leaning American Medical Association has admitted that it is dangerous to the mother and never necessary under any circumstances
column2: not the least of which is for ‚Äúthe life or health of the mother.‚Äù

column1: During a partial-birth abortion
column2: the abortionist pulls a fully ‚Äúviable‚Äù child ‚Äì often kicking and thrashing ‚Äì feet first from her mother‚Äôs womb
column3: leaving only the top of her head in the birth canal. This is so the abortionist can technically claim to be performing an abortion
column4: rather than committing murder.

column1: He then stabs the child through the base of her skull with scissors
column2: piercing her brain until her kicking and moving about suddenly and violently jerks to a halt. Next
column3: he opens the scissors to enlarge the wound as blood and brainstem fluid gush down his hands
column4: inserts a vacuum tube and sucks out her brains
column5: thereby collapsing her skull.

column1: Her now limp and lifeless body is then cast away like so much garbage.
This is homicide
column2: plain and simple. Hillary Clinton supports it. Donald Trump opposes it.

column1: We deserve God‚Äôs wrath and judgment as a nation for allowing this abortion holocaust to occur on our watch. In my estimation
column2: Mrs. Clinton is a bloodthirsty monster who enthusiastically supports this barbarity. Her Supreme Court appointees will ensure that tens of millions of precious babies like the one in the video are murdered in the same brutal manner.

column1: My conscience tells me that I must vote in such a way that exercising my civic duty will have the strongest net effect against Mrs. Clinton and ensure that she is stopped. She must not be elected president. To not vote ‚Äì or to vote for a non-starter third party candidate
column2: which is effectively the same thing ‚Äì while not an actual vote for Mrs. Clinton
column3: still puts this Mengele in a pantsuit one step closer to the White House and the Supreme Court.

column1: It‚Äôs simple math
column2: and it‚Äôs undeniable. The most effective thing you can personally do as a citizen is to vote against Mrs. Clinton by voting for Mr. Trump. This does the most electoral damage possible to candidate Clinton and offers the best chance for life that you can provide future generations.

column1: With its 1973 Roe v. Wade decision
column2: the U.S. Supreme Court put the government‚Äôs official stamp of approval on mass murder. Since then
column3: the battle lines have been drawn. This is war. ‚ÄúPro-choicers‚Äù are the bad guys and pro-lifers
column4: the good guys. It really is that simple ‚Äì that black and white. It‚Äôs good versus evil.

column1: History will reflect as much.
Under a President Hillary Clinton
column2: millions more babies will be tortured and dismembered alive. Under a President Donald Trump
column3: these millions might live. And yet
column4: even as Hillary sharpens her knives
column5: we quibble like fools over Donald‚Äôs potty mouth.

column1: The devil and Democrats: Oh
column2: how they love derision and division within the body of Christ.";english;2016-10-27T02:38:55.138+03:00;wnd.com;GB;1550.0;Why 'Never Trumpers' must reconsider;0.0;;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 12630;9fa953d2365f9642b5003b66957a77efe539c6fd;0;Jane Chastain;2016-10-27T02:39:04.504+03:00;Election crossroads: Socialism or capitalism?;"Election crossroads: Socialism or capitalism? Exclusive: Jane Chastain explains impact of Dems' 'living wage' proposal Published: 20 mins ago Jane Chastain About | | Archive Jane Chastain is a Southern California-based broadcaster
column2: author and political commentator. Despite her present emphasis on politics
column3: Jane always will be remembered as the nation's first female TV sportscaster
column4: spending 17 years on the sports beat. Jane blogs at JaneChastain.com. She is a pilot who lives on a private runway. Print

column1: Our country is at a crossroads. Never before have we faced such an obvious fork in the road. One road
column2: the one favored by politician Hillary Clinton and her Democratic colleagues
column3: promises to lead us to a socialist utopia. The other
column4: favored by businessman Donald Trump and some of his Republican colleagues
column5: promises to get us back on the road toward free-market capitalism.

column1: It is no secret that most career politicians lean toward a socialist system. In this system they control the lion‚Äôs share of our money and
column2: in turn
column3: hand out favors. In this system
column4: they make the major decisions that affect our lives. As the government accumulates more and more power
column5: we invariably end up with less. Statistics show that the longer a politician stays in power
column6: the more of our hard-earned money he or she spends. Yet we keep electing the same people over and over and over again
column7: expecting a different result.

column1: We‚Äôve been headed down the road toward socialism for quite some time
column2: and this could be the last fork in the road we will have to get us back to the free-market system that has given this country the highest standard of living in the world. No
column3: it isn‚Äôt perfect
column4: but it works for everyone who is willing to work hard and wants to improve his or her life.

column1: Notice what I didn‚Äôt say is ‚Äúsimply willing to work hard.‚Äù There is the belief by some that if you simply work hard
column2: you should have what these politicians now call a ‚Äúliving wage‚Äù ‚Äì the income necessary to support a family of four and supply all its basic needs
column3: which is around $85
column4: 000 a year in some parts of the country. The Democrats want to replace the minimum wage
column5: which is a training wage
column6: with this living wage. That completely kicks the bottom rungs out from under the economic ladder Americans have traditionally climbed to reach their goals and live independently.

column1: Ideally
column2: it would mean that you could take a job flipping hamburgers and never gain any skills or accept any responsibility
column3: and live as comfortably as the guy or gal who does.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: this so-called living wage will destroy jobs. It will cause companies to automate
column3: and those that cannot will begin moving offshore at an even faster rate.

column1: But this living wage is only part of what the Democrats want to do in the name of fairness.
This
column2: no doubt
column3: appeals to many in this poor economy who have lost all hope
column4: so they are lulled into thinking that the socialist road is much better.

column1: Wages have remained flat for far too long
column2: but the Democrats are proposing raising taxes even higher on businesses and job creators.

column1: Most people simply do not understand that businesses don‚Äôt pay taxes. They are passed down to consumers in the form of higher prices. And when the price of the necessary goods and services becomes too high
column2: such as we‚Äôve seen in Obamacare
column3: there is a large outcry. That‚Äôs when the government steps in and takes over the means of production and the control of those services. That‚Äôs when the door to socialism/communism slams shut.

column1: They tell us if we take this socialist road there is nothing to fear. Our benevolent government will take care of us. They are offering us free college ‚Äì or almost free loans ‚Äì in order to get the job we want at a salary we think we deserve. And if we don‚Äôt get that job
column2: the government is going to give us free health care
column3: free food and free housing. Under President Hillary
column4: there will be free child care
column5: free preschool and paid family leave. What a country!

column1: If we don‚Äôt reach our goals
column2: everything will be OK because Social Security and Medicare will be there to finance our retirement
column3: and if that isn‚Äôt enough
column4: the government will put us in a retirement center where we live out the remainder of our years playing checkers or watching television.

column1: What about the fact that Social Security and Medicare are going broke? How long can we keep printing money to keep us afloat before our economy collapses? They never talk about that.
As British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher once said
column2: ‚ÄúThe problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people‚Äôs money.‚Äù

column1: Don‚Äôt be fooled: This election is about a lot more than the two personalities at the top of the ticket. It‚Äôs an important fork in the road: One fork requires hard work and sacrifice but offers freedom. The other offers a free lunch.

column1: 12631;fd09b18b80ab643ed34d77058ac5339083ec2b91;0;Michael Brown;2016-10-27T02:39:04.763+03:00;7 reasons I'll vote for Trump;"Print
Before you applaud me for my integrity or condemn me for selling out
column2: allow me to explain my decision to vote for Donald Trump on Nov. 8.

column1: First
column2: I‚Äôm writing this because I have been asked incessantly for months how I would be voting
column3: not because I think I‚Äôm someone special or that what I do should influence you.

column1: Second
column2: I‚Äôm not endorsing Donald Trump. In my mind
column3: there‚Äôs a world of difference between endorsing a candidate and voting for a candidate.

column1: Third
column2: I respect those in the #NeverTrump camp and share many of their concerns
column3: including the possibility of his further vulgarizing and degrading the nation
column4: the possibility of him deepening our ethnic and racial divides
column5: and the possibility of him alienating our allies and unnecessarily provoking our enemies
column6: just to name a few. Among the #NeverTrump voices I respect are columnists like David French and Ben Shapiro
column7: bloggers like Matt Walsh and evangelical leaders like Russell Moore and Beth Moore.

column1: Fourth
column2: I take strong exception to evangelicals who have fawned over Trump as if he were some kind of savior figure
column3: supporting him as if he were St. Donald. I also take issue with evangelical leaders who want us to minimize some of Trump‚Äôs failings
column4: constantly saying
column5: ‚ÄúLet him who is without sin cast the first one‚Äù (see John 8:7). This is not a question of condemning the man but rather a question of making a moral assessment as to his readiness to serve our nation.

column1: Fifth
column2: my decision to vote for Trump
column3: barring something earth-shattering between now and Nov. 8
column4: is consistent with my position
column5: which has been: 1) During the GOP primaries
column6: I issued strong warnings against voting for Trump while we had other excellent choices. I did this in writing
column7: on video and on the radio
column8: but always stating that if Trump won the nomination
column9: I would re-evaluate my position. 2) Once Trump became the Republican candidate
column10: I wrote that I was rooting for him to take steps in the right direction and thereby win my vote. 3) I have stated repeatedly that under no circumstances would I vote for Hillary. (For two strong warnings about Hillary
column11: see here and here .)

column1: So
column2: what has convinced me that I should now vote for Donald Trump?

column1: The culture war is not over! Gain hope
column2: courage and practical advice in Michael Brown‚Äôs latest book
column3: ‚ÄúOutlasting the Gay Revolution: Where Homosexual Activism Is Really Going and How to Turn the Tide‚Äù

column1: First
column2: I believe that he actually is serious about appointing pro-life
column3: pro-Constitution Supreme Court justices. When he said during the last debate that if you‚Äôre pro-life
column4: you want to see Roe v. Wade overturned
column5: and when he reiterated at his Gettysburg speech that he will be drawing from his list of 20 potential appointees
column6: he helped me feel more confident that he would not suddenly flip-flop if elected.

column1: Second
column2: one reason I endorsed Sen. Ted Cruz was because he took on the political establishment
column3: both Democratic and Republican
column4: to the point of calling it the Washington cartel. Trump is an absolute wrecking ball to the negative parts of the political system (although
column5: unfortunately
column6: he‚Äôs been a wrecking ball to some of the good parts of the system)
column7: so my vote for him is also a protest vote.

column1: Third
column2: I am voting for the Republican platform
column3: not the Republican Party
column4: which means I‚Äôm in agreement with the platform while at the same time having very little confidence in the party as a whole.

column1: Fourth
column2: while I have always felt that the line
column3: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre electing a president
column4: not a pastor
column5: ‚Äù was overstated and superficial
column6: if we rephrased it to say
column7: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre electing a general to train hand-to-hand combat warriors
column8: not a pastor
column9: ‚Äù it might have more relevance. In other words
column10: we are not looking for Trump to be a moral reformer (even if hedoes appoint righteous judges)
column11: and
column12: at this point
column13: he certainly is anything but a moral example (although we pray he will be truly converted and become one). Rather
column14: out of our choices for president
column15: which are stark
column16: we are voting for the one most likely to defeat Hillary and make some good decisions for the nation
column17: not be the savior. And with things so messed up in America
column18: the hand-to-hand combat analogy is closer to home.

column1: Fifth
column2: within the first few minutes of the last debate
column3: the massive differences between Hillary and Trump were there for the world to see
column4: she a pro-abortion radical and an extreme supporter of the LGBT agenda and he unashamedly speaking out against late-term abortions and wanting to appoint justices who would defend our essential liberties. Since I have the opportunity to vote
column5: I feel that I should vote for Trump.

column1: Sixth
column2: Trump continues to be drawn to conservative Christians
column3: and not just ones who tickle his ears. One of my dear friends has spent hours with Trump and members of his family
column4: and he has told me that in 55 years of ministry
column5: no one has received him as openly and graciously as has Trump. Yet my friend continues to speak the truth to him in the clearest possible terms. While I am not one of those claiming that Trump is a born-again Christian (I see absolutely no evidence of this)
column6: the fact that he continues to listen to godly men and open the door to their counsel indicates that something positive could possibly be going on. It also indicates that these godly leaders might be a positive influence on him if he were elected president.

column1: Seventh
column2: although I‚Äôm quite aware that a president could do great harm or good to the nation
column3: I‚Äôm far more concerned with what we as God‚Äôs people do with our own lives and witnesses
column4: and for me
column5: the state of the church of America is much more important than the state of the White House. In that context
column6: I echo the words (and warning) of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: ‚ÄúThe church must be reminded that it is not the master or the servant of the state
column7: but rather the conscience of the state. It must be the guide and the critic of the state
column8: and never its tool. If the church does not recapture its prophetic zeal
column9: it will become an irrelevant social club without moral or spiritual authority.‚Äù

column1: So
column2: in sum: 1) My hope is in God
column3: not Donald Trump
column4: and I do recognize that either Hillary or Trump has the potential to do great harm to America; 2) My urgent call is for us as followers of Jesus to get our own act together so we can be the salt and light of the nation; 3) I will continue to urge all believers not to vote for Hillary Clinton
column5: whose policies will certainly do us great harm; and 4) Ultimately
column6: the most effective way to defeat Hillary is to vote for Trump
column7: while also praying that God will use him for good
column8: not for evil.

column1: In the end
column2: if Trump gets elected and fails miserably
column3: I will be grieved but not devastated. If he does well
column4: I will rejoice.

column1: Either way
column2: though
column3: my vote is just that: a vote. My greater role is to live a life pleasing to God with the hope of advancing a gospel-based moral and cultural revolution. Receive Michael Brown's commentaries in your email BONUS: By signing up for Michael Brown's alerts

column1: Two weeks left to go in the election and the electorate feels like a battered NFL fan. The game gets increasingly old and tiring to watch
column2: and playing it can inflict permanent brain damage.

column1: Democrats can be counted upon to call the Republican opponent racist
column2: whether the opponent is the priestly Mitt Romney or the Supreme Court justice who wrote the Dred Scott decision. Donald Trump
column3: you see
column4: is ‚Äúracist‚Äù because
column5: among other reasons
column6: at a campaign stop he pointed to a black man and called him ‚Äúmy African-American.‚Äù Hillary Clinton
column7: on the other hand
column8: is not anti-Semitic
column9: even though three witnesses
column10: one of whom took and passed a polygraph
column11: claim that she referred to her husband‚Äôs former congressional campaign manager as a ‚Äúf‚Äì-ing Jew bastard.‚Äù

column1: With a Republican candidate
column2: the media can be counted upon to seize upon any deficiencies ‚Äì big or small
column3: real or imagined ‚Äì while giving the Democrat a pass. So Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúfailure to ever apologize‚Äù outweighs an examination of Clinton‚Äôs flat-out lie during the third debate when she insisted that the Supreme Court Heller case was about ‚Äútoddlers
column4: ‚Äù as opposed to the fundamental issue of whether the Second Amendment confers an individual right to keep and bear arms.

column1: In Heller
column2: nowhere in the majority decision or in any of the dissenting decisions does the word ‚Äútoddler‚Äù appear. Clinton
column3: a year ago
column4: flat-out said
column5: ‚ÄúThe Supreme Court is wrong on the Second Amendment.‚Äù To normal people
column6: this meant she opposed what the decision ruled on
column7: which
column8: again
column9: was whether we
column10: as individuals
column11: have a right to keep and bear arms.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: we learn more and more about what the media labels an ‚Äúemail scandal
column3: ‚Äù when the accurate description is ‚Äúnational security scandal.‚Äù The Espionage Act criminalizes gross negligence in the handling of important national security matters. The law does not require
column4: as FBI Director James Comey falsely stated
column5: an ‚Äúintent.‚Äù Nor is it relevant
column6: as Clinton insists
column7: whether or not her private server
column8: the one she maintained in her basement
column9: was ‚Äúhacked.‚Äù

column1: Five people who worked with or for Clinton
column2: including her chief of staff
column3: all received immunity deals
column4: something normally given to get someone to flip on a target. Some of the five were involved in deleting emails after the emails were subpoenaed. But the ‚Äútarget
column5: ‚Äù that is to say Hillary Clinton
column6: was deemed by Comey to have lacked sufficient criminal intent to be prosecuted. So why the immunity deals? Who knows ‚Äì and as far as most of the media are concerned
column7: who cares?

column1: Clinton insists that ‚ÄúPresident Obama doesn‚Äôt get enough credit‚Äù for the swell job he did with the economy. This would be the economy in which
column2: for the first time in history
column3: a president has presided over a recovery without a single year of at least 3 percent growth in gross domestic product. This would be the same economy with an alleged low unemployment number that Gallup CEO Jim Clifton calls ‚Äúthe big lie
column4: ‚Äù given the large number of people who simply abandoned the job hunt or are under-employed.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: it‚Äôs yet another day in which another woman who alleges she was kissed
column3: groped
column4: touched
column5: or made fun of by Trump has appeared with her attorney
column6: feminist Gloria Allred. Allred
column7: a Clinton supporter
column8: sees no contradiction between representing alleged victims of Trump‚Äôs sexual misconduct and her support for Clinton
column9: who is alleged to have hired private detectives and lawyers to dig up dirt on her husband‚Äôs accusers. One such accuser
column10: Juanita Broaddrick
column11: claims not only that she was raped by Bill Clinton but also that two weeks after the alleged rape
column12: Hillary Clinton verbally threatened her.

column1: Hillary Clinton
column2: mind you
column3: has never been asked by anyone in the media about Broaddrick‚Äôs allegation. Never. And only one national reporter
column4: Sam Donaldson
column5: has ever asked Bill Clinton about Juanita Broaddrick‚Äôs allegation. Ever. Clinton‚Äôs answer? He referred Donaldson to his lawyer
column6: David Kendall. Donaldson quickly tried again
column7: asking the then-president to ‚Äúsimply deny it.‚Äù Same answer: ‚ÄúMy attorney ‚Ä¶ speaks for me.‚Äù And that was that.

column1: So Hillary Clinton is a candidate who wants to continue the same policy that‚Äôs given us the worst recovery since 1949; who has clearly violated the Espionage Act and placed the nation‚Äôs security at risk; who told the Benghazi victim‚Äôs families that the death of four Americans was inspired by a video

column1: 12635;e7e02bcd38ca9865189a93eafce57bd9ac5410b7;0;-NO AUTHOR-;2016-10-27T02:39:29.413+03:00;Clinton transmitted classified info to her lawyers;"Clinton transmitted classified info to her lawyers Andrew McCarthy: There's no attorney exception to criminal law that prohibits such action Published: 27 mins ago
(National Review) ‚Äî What was the legal rationale under which Hillary Clinton quite intentionally shared classified information with her lawyers
column2: including David Kendall
column3: Cheryl Mills
column4: and Heather Samuelson?

column1: As I outlined in last weekend‚Äôs column
column2: we know that Clinton‚Äôs e-mails were replete with classified information. According to the FBI
column3: the classified e-mails included intelligence graded at the most closely guarded level: eight top-secret e-mails
column4: and seven designated as ‚Äúspecial access program‚Äù (SAP) information. (While FBI director James Comey‚Äôs presentation understandably left this vague
column5: the likelihood is that seven of the eight top-secret e-mails are SAP.) Under President Bill Clinton‚Äôs 1995 executive order
column6: top-secret intelligence is information the mishandling of which ‚Äúcould be expected to cause exceptionally grave damage to the national security.‚Äù The SAP designation is added when the unauthorized disclosure of intelligence could compromise critical intelligence-gathering methods or imperil the lives of intelligence sources.

column1: That is why access to this information is so tightly restricted
column2: and its unauthorized disclosure is routinely prosecuted.";english;2016-10-27T02:39:29.413+03:00;wnd.com;GB;1550.0;Clinton transmitted classified info to her lawyers;0.0;;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: 12637;60e2238941049dfd8aa0dbc1ab930171f59430e1;0;Joseph Farah;2016-10-27T03:04:39.872+03:00;Loretta Lynch takes on 'killer cops' -- except in D.C.;"Print
Have you ever noticed how Washington always has a plan to solve everybody‚Äôs problem ‚Äì except their own?
For the federal government
column2: it‚Äôs always easy and tempting to look at problems ‚Äì real or imagined ‚Äì outside of the beltway and solve them from afar.

column1: You will recall
column2: of course
column3: how former Attorney General Eric Holder was going to stop police shootings all over America with sensitivity training
column4: the power and force of the federal government and investigations
column5: investigations and more investigations.

column1: Now Loretta Lynch
column2: his successor
column3: also known as Hillary Clinton‚Äôs guardian angel
column4: is set to turn police shootings throughout America into big business and more power for Washington.

column1: Her latest pet project is assembling a national database on ‚Äúinteractions between law enforcement and civilians
column2: ‚Äù she reported this month.

column1: ‚ÄúAccurate and comprehensive data on the use of force by law enforcement is essential to an informed and productive discussion about community-police relations
column2: ‚Äù Lynch said. ‚ÄúIn the days ahead
column3: the Department of Justice will continue to work alongside our local
column4: state
column5: tribal and federal partners to ensure that we put in place a system to collect data that is comprehensive
column6: useful
column7: and responsive to the needs of the communities we serve.‚Äù

column1: The irony here is thick
column2: indeed.

column1: One of Lynch‚Äôs goals
column2: she says
column3: is to get law enforcement agencies to report more thoroughly about people who died during an interaction with them.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: Lynch presides over the most egregious cover-up of the most outrageous police shooting case I have ever seen in my life ‚Äì namely the killing of Miriam Carey
column3: a young black mother with baby in tow
column4: who was gunned down by Washington cops and Secret Service agents for a wrong turn in the nation‚Äôs capital.

column1: Lynch wants reports?
So does WND
column2: which has been pursuing the information through Freedom of Information Act requests and finally
column3: after being stonewalled for years
column4: a lawsuit.

column1: So does the public and the family of Miriam Carey. Unfortunately
column2: Lynch is holding back on a few things: Missing Evidence The 92-page memo with findings
column3: analysis of evidence and conclusions in the Carey shooting investigation. This would show the evidence and reasoning that led the Department of Justice to decline to file criminal charges against officers. Why they considered this a justifiable homicide ‚Äì or whether they should have
column4: based on the evidence. Why officers used deadly force. Whether officers followed or violated the policy of their agencies. Video of shooting at Capitol Police guard post at intersection of Constitution Ave.
column5: Maryland Ave. and 2nd Street. Only stills have been released. Video would show more clearly if officer‚Äôs life actually was in danger
column6: as DOJ claimed
column7: when he fired fatal shot to Carey‚Äôs head. Not one of the five witnesses at the scene said Carey was driving at the officer
column8: as the DOJ claimed. Police statements The police report said four officers fired shots at Carey
column9: two from the Capitol Police and two from the Secret Service. Not one statement from those officers was in the report. Their names were also redacted. Redacted information An attorney in the Washington
column10: D.C.
column11: mayor‚Äôs office said the only redactions were names
column12: in order to protect privacy. It turned out much more was redacted than names. The report was riddled with blacked-out sections and missing information. 12 pages in the report were entirely blacked out. 15 pages were mostly blacked out. 22 pages were partially blacked out. Some of the blacked-out pages just included a heading marked ‚ÄúEvidence.‚Äù Some just had a date. Witness statements An astonishing 38 witness accounts are missing from the police report. The police report stated: ‚ÄúThere were seventy-two (72) witnesses interviewed regarding this incident and their statements were captured by audio and/or video recordings. Copies of the aforementioned recordings were turned over to the USAO for review. Copies of the aforementioned audio and video recordings are stored in the main case file at the Technical Support Unit (TSU) located at the IAD.‚Äù Of those 72 witness statements
column13: only 34 were in the materials provided to WND
column14: leaving 38 missing. Statement transcripts None of the actual transcripts of interviews in the witnesses‚Äô own words were provided
column15: just paraphrased versions in what the former NYPD officer Sanders described as ‚Äúcop talk.‚Äù White House guard post video Stills were released but not the video. It would show whether anyone was manning the post when Carey drove up; whether she tried to drive around the off-duty guard who dragged a gate in front of her; and whether she sped off
column16: or left at a normal speed
column17: as a witness said. Police radio recordings No recordings or transcripts of radio transmissions during the pursuit and shooting of Carey were provided in the FOIA material. Also not provided were transcripts of computer transmissions (instant messaging) between squad cars and police headquarters. Ballistics and forensics reports The Justice Department Washington Metro Police Department responses to FOIA requests did not include a ballistics or a forensics report.

column1: I could go on and on. For people who want facts and reports
column2: the U.S. Justice Department under both Holder and Lynch have a strong propensity for not willingly releasing the facts and reports to the public or the press.

column1: We‚Äôve been at this for a long time ‚Äì years. Yet the stonewall and cover-up of a horrendous
column2: unjustifiable
column3: outrageous police shooting right in their own jurisdiction and backyard continues.

column1: Do we really expect Eric Holder and Loretta Lynch to find justice for police shooting victims outside of their own jurisdiction with a track record like that?

column1: 12638;9346ae7921b3137c9acf23271bfb2ce9806a43d2;0;Erik Rush;2016-10-27T03:04:44.225+03:00;Will it be representative government or thugocracy?;"Will it be representative government or thugocracy? Exclusive: Erik Rush envisions Clinton using high court 'as a bludgeon' against liberty Published: 43 mins ago About | | Archive Erik Rush is a columnist and author of sociopolitical fare. His latest book is ""Negrophilia: From Slave Block to Pedestal - America's Racial Obsession."" In 2007
column2: he was the first to give national attention to the story of Sen. Barack Obama's ties to militant Chicago preacher Rev. Jeremiah Wright
column3: initiating a media feeding frenzy. Erik has appeared on Fox News' ""Hannity and Colmes
column4: CNN
column5: and is a veteran of numerous radio appearances. Print

column1: ‚Äú I feel strongly that the Supreme Court needs to stand on the side of the American people
column2: not on the side of the powerful corporations and the wealthy. For me
column3: that means that we need a Supreme Court that will stand up on behalf of women‚Äôs rights
column4: on behalf of the rights of the LGBT community
column5: that will stand up and say no to Citizens United
column6: a decision that has undermined the election system in our country because of the way it permits dark
column7: unaccountable money to come into our electoral system. ‚Äù

column1: ‚Äì Hillary Clinton
The first salvo from Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton (or rather
column2: her answer to the first question posed by Fox News‚Äô Chris Wallace to her and Donald Trump at the third presidential debate) was as chilling as it was an exemplar of hypocrisy.

column1: Those on the left are quite fond of leveling the accusation against conservatives of employing ‚Äúdog whistle politics
column2: ‚Äù rhetoric that allegedly contains hidden or esoteric derogatory messaging which targets a specific subgroup within the opposition. Ms. Clinton‚Äôs response to Wallace‚Äôs question (where they wanted to see the Supreme Court take the country
column3: and their views on how the Constitution ought to be interpreted) however
column4: was representative of this tactic.

column1: While women‚Äôs rights and those of the LGBT community may seem to be a curious focus for the high court (since objectively
column2: women wouldn‚Äôt appear to be particularly oppressed given that one has been nominated to run for president
column3: and the LGBT community accounts for less than 5 percent of the American population)
column4: Clinton‚Äôs answer revealed the focus she believes the court should have once she becomes empress.

column1: ‚ÄúWomen‚Äôs rights‚Äù is of course ‚Äúdog whistle‚Äù for unfettered abortion
column2: even late-term abortion
column3: which is essentially infanticide via dismemberment. ‚ÄúLGBT rights‚Äù is ‚Äúdog whistle‚Äù for disenfranchising the majority of Americans who hold traditional values
column4: primarily Christians. Leveraging a vocal minority of homosexuals
column5: bisexuals and transgender individuals whom the left has whipped into a froth against Christians is the methodology that was employed to negate the political power of Christians in Europe and Canada. A direct assault via legislation in this area would not work in the U.S. (at least not at present); however
column6: judicial rulings could effectively bring about the same result.

column1: Let us leave aside for a moment the fact that judicial activism is unethical and skirts the Constitution and that Clinton‚Äôs overall objectives are manifestly evil. Hillary Clinton‚Äôs stated priorities for the Supreme Court are a clear indicator of her desire to use the court as a bludgeon against the Constitution and individual liberties
column2: rather than allowing it to perform its designated function. The hypocrisy attendant to Clinton citing the rights of women and homosexuals when she is beholden via financial contributions to nations that institutionally persecute and murder members of these groups remains plain for all to see
column3: despite being conveniently ignored by the press.

column1: Clinton‚Äôs reference to ‚Äúpowerful corporations and the wealthy‚Äù and the malign influence of that sinister conservative organization
column2: Citizens United
column3: was of course another exercise in blatant hypocrisy. Clinton is quite wealthy
column4: and corrupt or otherwise compromised powerful corporations have been instrumental in bringing about the designs of American socialists. Even if Citizens United were a vehicle for ‚Äúdark
column5: unaccountable money
column6: ‚Äù the scope of its influence would pale next to the subversive designs of the Muslim Brotherhood
column7: with which Bill and Hillary Clinton have been partnered for decades
column8: or the myriad tentacles of organizations funded by George Soros
column9: the former Nazi collaborator dedicated to advancing oligarchical collectivism in America
column10: someone with whom the Clintons also have a long association.

column1: One need not attempt to decipher the thinly veiled intent behind Clinton‚Äôs debate rhetoric to discern what a Hillary Clinton presidency might look like. Her actions to date ‚Äì and particularly those in the pursuit of seeking that office ‚Äì should suffice quite nicely. Despite the craven complicity of the establishment press (mainstream media)
column2: there is ample evidence for even the most indolent news consumer to reach the conclusion that she and the Democratic leviathan supporting her
column3: and which facilitated Barack Obama‚Äôs rise to power
column4: are fundamentally malignant.

column1: In recent days
column2: we‚Äôve become aware of all manner of unethical conspiracies and outright criminality that‚Äôs been brought to bear in getting Clinton elected
column3: from Democratic officials tampering with the outcome of the illegal email server investigation
column4: to the oversampling of key demographics in polling in order to enhance the public perception of Clinton‚Äôs popularity
column5: to the recent revelation of criminally prosecutable actions on the part of the Clinton campaign
column6: the Democratic National Committee and the White House.

column1: The bottom line here is that Hillary Clinton represents a class of people who transcend even the loathed archetypal modern politician in their rapaciousness and amorality. What all Americans ‚Äì not just voters
column2: and not just Republicans ‚Äì need to realize is that leaders at the highest levels in the Republican Party are every bit as culpable as the gutter operatives of the Democratic Party who pay miscreants to dress up as ducks
column3: instigate fistfights at opposition rallies and
column4: yes
column5: even vote for their candidates.

column1: The burning question is this: In the end
column2: are we to be governed by the will of the people
column3: or are we going to continue pretending that we have a representative government
column4: when we are in effect being ruled by abject thugs operating behind a faux veneer of government?

Sign the precedent-setting petition supporting Trump‚Äôs call for an independent prosecutor to investigate Hillary Clinton!

column1: Please share with your Republican friends who seem comfortable with this woman returning to the White House. Unless

column1: 12641;c69797f3a44314f780b597a90990acab17b2ffeb;0;Jane Chastain;2016-10-27T03:04:50.704+03:00;Election crossroads: Socialism or capitalism?;"Election crossroads: Socialism or capitalism? Exclusive: Jane Chastain explains impact of Dems' 'living wage' proposal Published: 49 mins ago About | | Archive Jane Chastain is a Southern California-based broadcaster
column2: author and political commentator. Despite her present emphasis on politics
column3: Jane always will be remembered as the nation's first female TV sportscaster
column4: spending 17 years on the sports beat. Jane blogs at JaneChastain.com. She is a pilot who lives on a private runway. Print

column1: Our country is at a crossroads. Never before have we faced such an obvious fork in the road. One road
column2: the one favored by politician Hillary Clinton and her Democratic colleagues
column3: promises to lead us to a socialist utopia. The other
column4: favored by businessman Donald Trump and some of his Republican colleagues
column5: promises to get us back on the road toward free-market capitalism.

column1: It is no secret that most career politicians lean toward a socialist system. In this system they control the lion‚Äôs share of our money and
column2: in turn
column3: hand out favors. In this system
column4: they make the major decisions that affect our lives. As the government accumulates more and more power
column5: we invariably end up with less. Statistics show that the longer a politician stays in power
column6: the more of our hard-earned money he or she spends. Yet we keep electing the same people over and over and over again
column7: expecting a different result.

column1: We‚Äôve been headed down the road toward socialism for quite some time
column2: and this could be the last fork in the road we will have to get us back to the free-market system that has given this country the highest standard of living in the world. No
column3: it isn‚Äôt perfect
column4: but it works for everyone who is willing to work hard and wants to improve his or her life.

column1: Notice what I didn‚Äôt say is ‚Äúsimply willing to work hard.‚Äù There is the belief by some that if you simply work hard
column2: you should have what these politicians now call a ‚Äúliving wage‚Äù ‚Äì the income necessary to support a family of four and supply all its basic needs
column3: which is around $85
column4: 000 a year in some parts of the country. The Democrats want to replace the minimum wage
column5: which is a training wage
column6: with this living wage. That completely kicks the bottom rungs out from under the economic ladder Americans have traditionally climbed to reach their goals and live independently.

column1: Ideally
column2: it would mean that you could take a job flipping hamburgers and never gain any skills or accept any responsibility
column3: and live as comfortably as the guy or gal who does.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: this so-called living wage will destroy jobs. It will cause companies to automate
column3: and those that cannot will begin moving offshore at an even faster rate.

column1: But this living wage is only part of what the Democrats want to do in the name of fairness.
This
column2: no doubt
column3: appeals to many in this poor economy who have lost all hope
column4: so they are lulled into thinking that the socialist road is much better.

column1: Wages have remained flat for far too long
column2: but the Democrats are proposing raising taxes even higher on businesses and job creators.

column1: Most people simply do not understand that businesses don‚Äôt pay taxes. They are passed down to consumers in the form of higher prices. And when the price of the necessary goods and services becomes too high
column2: such as we‚Äôve seen in Obamacare
column3: there is a large outcry. That‚Äôs when the government steps in and takes over the means of production and the control of those services. That‚Äôs when the door to socialism/communism slams shut.

column1: They tell us if we take this socialist road there is nothing to fear. Our benevolent government will take care of us. They are offering us free college ‚Äì or almost free loans ‚Äì in order to get the job we want at a salary we think we deserve. And if we don‚Äôt get that job
column2: the government is going to give us free health care
column3: free food and free housing. Under President Hillary
column4: there will be free child care
column5: free preschool and paid family leave. What a country!

column1: If we don‚Äôt reach our goals
column2: everything will be OK because Social Security and Medicare will be there to finance our retirement
column3: and if that isn‚Äôt enough
column4: the government will put us in a retirement center where we live out the remainder of our years playing checkers or watching television.

column1: What about the fact that Social Security and Medicare are going broke? How long can we keep printing money to keep us afloat before our economy collapses? They never talk about that.
As British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher once said
column2: ‚ÄúThe problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people‚Äôs money.‚Äù

column1: Don‚Äôt be fooled: This election is about a lot more than the two personalities at the top of the ticket. It‚Äôs an important fork in the road: One fork requires hard work and sacrifice but offers freedom. The other offers a free lunch.

column1: Two weeks left to go in the election and the electorate feels like a battered NFL fan. The game gets increasingly old and tiring to watch
column2: and playing it can inflict permanent brain damage.

column1: Democrats can be counted upon to call the Republican opponent racist
column2: whether the opponent is the priestly Mitt Romney or the Supreme Court justice who wrote the Dred Scott decision. Donald Trump
column3: you see
column4: is ‚Äúracist‚Äù because
column5: among other reasons
column6: at a campaign stop he pointed to a black man and called him ‚Äúmy African-American.‚Äù Hillary Clinton
column7: on the other hand
column8: is not anti-Semitic
column9: even though three witnesses
column10: one of whom took and passed a polygraph
column11: claim that she referred to her husband‚Äôs former congressional campaign manager as a ‚Äúf‚Äì-ing Jew bastard.‚Äù

column1: With a Republican candidate
column2: the media can be counted upon to seize upon any deficiencies ‚Äì big or small
column3: real or imagined ‚Äì while giving the Democrat a pass. So Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúfailure to ever apologize‚Äù outweighs an examination of Clinton‚Äôs flat-out lie during the third debate when she insisted that the Supreme Court Heller case was about ‚Äútoddlers
column4: ‚Äù as opposed to the fundamental issue of whether the Second Amendment confers an individual right to keep and bear arms.

column1: In Heller
column2: nowhere in the majority decision or in any of the dissenting decisions does the word ‚Äútoddler‚Äù appear. Clinton
column3: a year ago
column4: flat-out said
column5: ‚ÄúThe Supreme Court is wrong on the Second Amendment.‚Äù To normal people
column6: this meant she opposed what the decision ruled on
column7: which
column8: again
column9: was whether we
column10: as individuals
column11: have a right to keep and bear arms.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: we learn more and more about what the media labels an ‚Äúemail scandal
column3: ‚Äù when the accurate description is ‚Äúnational security scandal.‚Äù The Espionage Act criminalizes gross negligence in the handling of important national security matters. The law does not require
column4: as FBI Director James Comey falsely stated
column5: an ‚Äúintent.‚Äù Nor is it relevant
column6: as Clinton insists
column7: whether or not her private server
column8: the one she maintained in her basement
column9: was ‚Äúhacked.‚Äù

column1: Five people who worked with or for Clinton
column2: including her chief of staff
column3: all received immunity deals
column4: something normally given to get someone to flip on a target. Some of the five were involved in deleting emails after the emails were subpoenaed. But the ‚Äútarget
column5: ‚Äù that is to say Hillary Clinton
column6: was deemed by Comey to have lacked sufficient criminal intent to be prosecuted. So why the immunity deals? Who knows ‚Äì and as far as most of the media are concerned
column7: who cares?

column1: Clinton insists that ‚ÄúPresident Obama doesn‚Äôt get enough credit‚Äù for the swell job he did with the economy. This would be the economy in which
column2: for the first time in history
column3: a president has presided over a recovery without a single year of at least 3 percent growth in gross domestic product. This would be the same economy with an alleged low unemployment number that Gallup CEO Jim Clifton calls ‚Äúthe big lie
column4: ‚Äù given the large number of people who simply abandoned the job hunt or are under-employed.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: it‚Äôs yet another day in which another woman who alleges she was kissed
column3: groped
column4: touched
column5: or made fun of by Trump has appeared with her attorney
column6: feminist Gloria Allred. Allred
column7: a Clinton supporter
column8: sees no contradiction between representing alleged victims of Trump‚Äôs sexual misconduct and her support for Clinton
column9: who is alleged to have hired private detectives and lawyers to dig up dirt on her husband‚Äôs accusers. One such accuser
column10: Juanita Broaddrick
column11: claims not only that she was raped by Bill Clinton but also that two weeks after the alleged rape
column12: Hillary Clinton verbally threatened her.

column1: Hillary Clinton
column2: mind you
column3: has never been asked by anyone in the media about Broaddrick‚Äôs allegation. Never. And only one national reporter
column4: Sam Donaldson
column5: has ever asked Bill Clinton about Juanita Broaddrick‚Äôs allegation. Ever. Clinton‚Äôs answer? He referred Donaldson to his lawyer
column6: David Kendall. Donaldson quickly tried again
column7: asking the then-president to ‚Äúsimply deny it.‚Äù Same answer: ‚ÄúMy attorney ‚Ä¶ speaks for me.‚Äù And that was that.

column1: So Hillary Clinton is a candidate who wants to continue the same policy that‚Äôs given us the worst recovery since 1949; who has clearly violated the Espionage Act and placed the nation‚Äôs security at risk; who told the Benghazi victim‚Äôs families that the death of four Americans was inspired by a video
column2: while telling her daughter and foreign officials something entirely different; whose charitable foundation engaged in pay-to-play in Haiti
column3: so that donors got contracts for disaster relief and non-donors went to the back of the line; who wants to gut the Second Amendment; who wants to continue the same foreign policies that that have encouraged aggressiveness on the part of ISIS
column4: Russia and the Chinese; and whose media compadres
column5: including scribes with the New York Times
column6: Washington Post and CNBC
column7: have been outed by WikiLeaks as colluding with her campaign. And she is now odds-on favorite to become the next president of the United States. Receive Larry Elder's commentaries in your email BONUS: By signing up for Larry Elder's alerts

column1: 12645;2fa10c2260b0b3865d6c947b6a2cfd04a080f500;0;-NO AUTHOR-;2016-10-27T03:05:07.528+03:00;Gingrich slut-shames Megyn Kelly;"OUT OF LEFT FIELD Gingrich slut-shames Megyn Kelly Adele M. Stan: Misogyny isn't just baked into the Trump brand

column1: (American Prospect) ‚Äî When

column3: you answer allegations that your candidate may be a sexual predator with a sex-laced attack on your female interviewer
column4: you‚Äôre probably a misogynist. A desperate misogynist.

During a Tuesday discussion of Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump‚Äôs sinking poll numbers

column1: 12646;9e4f003bd85f10af1395b0dfc7bc43f3c0b60f59;0;Jerome R. Corsi;2016-10-27T03:05:08.609+03:00;YouTube bans 'Clinton's black son';"Print Side-by-side of Bill Clinton and Danney Williams
NEW YORK ‚ÄìYouTube on Wednesday suspended the account of Danney Williams
column2: the 30-year-old who has claimed since the 1990s to be the black son of former President Bill Clinton.

column1: YouTube

column1: 12659;df65c51ab1d3b94525917637b253648ef5af05c5;0;-NO AUTHOR-;2016-10-27T04:22:40.638+03:00;Bellwether? Trump kippas outselling Hillary yarmulkes;"Bellwether? Trump kippas outselling Hillary yarmulkes Company sees preference as 'early exit poll of Orthodox Jews' Published: 9 mins ago Print
WASHINGTON ‚Äì The campaigns of Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton are looking for signs anywhere and everywhere that might suggest who will move into the White House in January.

A company that makes Trump and Hillary kippas or yarmulkes has some good news for one of the presidential hopefuls ‚Äì Trump head coverings are winning in a landslide among the Orthodox Jewish clientele.
So far
column2: the company
column3: Pic-A-Kippa
column4: has sold 331 Trump yarmulkes to 65 for Clinton.

column1: ‚ÄúMy kippa (yarmulke) company sells Trump and Hillary kippas and are keeping track of who is selling more
column2: ‚Äù Uri Turk
column3: founder and ‚Äúchief kippa officer
column4: ‚Äù told WND. ‚ÄúWe see it as an early exit poll of the Orthodox Jews
column5: a type of bellwether of where this important community is leaning. Once the first debate came around
column6: the orders started flying in
column7: with much more interest in the Trump kippas.‚Äù

column1: Pic-A-Kippa is the brainstorm of two former elite red beret IDF soldiers from Miami. Turk says the company is the leader in the kippa market and has been selling Trump and Hillary custom kippas on its site since August
column2: all the while keeping a running tally of which one has sold more.

column1: ‚ÄúOur mission is to help Jews everywhere show and wear their Jewish pride
column2: with our beautifully unique and completely customizable picture kippas
column3: ‚Äù the company says on its website.

column1: It donates 10 percent of every kippa sale to the Lone Soldier Center in Israel
column2: assisting young lone soldiers during difficult times.

column1: Turk said while American Jews have leaned heavily Democratic for decades
column2: the past few presidential races have seen Orthodox Jews
column3: who make up over 10 percent of American Jewry
column4: vote Republican in ever increasing numbers. He attributes that fact to the Democrats putting ‚Äúdaylight between America and Israel.‚Äù

column1: A number of influential Jewish pro-Trump organizations have emerged
column2: chief among them ‚ÄúJews Choose Trump‚Äù and ‚ÄúJewish Democrats For Trump.‚Äù A recent poll of Florida Jews showed Orthodox voters are leaning toward Trump by a 3-1 margin.

column1: According to Turk
column2: Pic-A-Kippa has sold many Trump kippas to a congregant of Ivanka Trump‚Äôs synagogue on the liberal Upper East Side of Manhattan and has gotten orders for Trump kippas from Israel
column3: Australia
column4: Britain and even Mexico. Pic-A-Kippa has also gotten hate mail from Jews unhappy they are selling the Trump designs
column5: he says.";english;2016-10-27T04:22:40.638+03:00;wnd.com;GB;1550.0;Bellwether? Trump kippas outselling Hillary yarmulkes;0.0;http://www.wnd.com/files/2016/10/3rd-debate-donald-trump-hillary-clinton-3-600.jpg;0;1;0;0;0;bias

column1: ‚ÄúHero‚Äù opens with Joe (played by Burgess Jenkins) coaching his son David‚Äôs baseball team
column2: the Gappers
column3: to the state championship. Seven years later

column1: A member of the increasingly divided and disputatious Alabama Supreme Court is warning that judges need to be elected and thus accountable to the voters or their decisions end up being based on ‚Äútheir empathetic feelings‚Äù instead of the law.
‚ÄúAlabama‚Äôs judges are elected and accountable
column2: ‚Äù wrote Justice Tom Parker this week. ‚ÄúFederal judges
column3: as recently noted by Chief Justice Roberts in his dissent in Obergefell v. Hodges ‚Ä¶ a case in which ‚Äòfive lawyers‚Äô on the United States Supreme Court announced a fundamental right to same-sex marriage
column4: are ‚Äòunaccountable and unelected.‚Äô
